Munchkin
1556344732

This award winning card game, designed by Steve Jackson, captures the essence of the dungeon experie...nce with none of that stupid roleplaying stuff. You and your friends compete to kill monsters and grab magic items. And what magic items. Don the Horny Helmet and the Boots of Butt Kicking. Wield the Staff of Napalm or maybe the Chainsaw of bloody dismemberment. Start by slaughtering the Potted Plant and the Drooling Slime, and work your way up to the Plutonium Dragon. For 3 to 8 players. 60 minutes. Munchkin is a stand alone card game designed by Steve Jackson that "simulates" a fantasy themed RPG in a simple, card based game that's chock full of silliness.

January 16, 2014 A2OFBBU4TXNOV6
open-ended
Can you use this with Munchkin Deluxe or does Munchkin Deluxe replace this?
January 17, 2014 AM6N9TR5UXJFH
This is the same as Munchkin Deluxe, except the Deluxe version has a board with totem pieces to track points. The core game (cards) are in both versions and is the same.
JTXD AM6N9TR5UXJFH
4 Fun and entertaining
12 7, 2013
I got this for my partner for his birthday. He loves it and was really excited to finally get it. It's a very fun game and entertaining. Half the game is based on chance (good or bad cards) and the other half depends on strategy. There was a lot of going back and forth between who was on top and who was on bottom, which is surprising because in most games there is a clear front-runner.
January 17, 2014 A3RB9WFE6KL5CQ
The original Munchkin has the same cards as Munchkin Deluxe, making it the same game but the Deluxe has a board and game pieces.
John Schnorr "Carnage" A3RB9WFE6KL5CQ
5 To "Munchkin" or not...
12 1, 2013
We had never heard of this game before we received this game as a gift and we loved it! We have 5 children and it really is not suited for the younger kids. Our 8 year old is really interested in playing, but it is a little hard for her yet. It is our older kids' favorite by far (16, 19 and 21). We have bought many of the "expansion" packs to add to it and have purchased several of the games for Christmas gifts for others. Our boys try to get us to play any chance they get! They also didn't want us to buy it for their older sister because they wanted her to come to "our" house to play. I like the game because it is different every time we play and it can change direction in just a moment, meaning the person winning could get knocked back down to level 1 and the last place person can become the winner! It is fun and keeps the family laughing, conversing and arguing (in fun) the entire time.
July 10, 2014 A2MFXWSKC3EB0B
yes/no
do games typically take about 60 minutes as the game description states?
July 10, 2014 A1RDQFNF6LD25Z
?
0.9624
It really depends on the number of people and how fast everyone takes turn. Also, the rules can sometimes be up to your interpretation, so it also depends on how much debate happens over that. If you have a focused group I'd say the game would be a lot faster. With my family, games probably do take about an hour.
kalpal A1RDQFNF6LD25Z
5 fun game
04 27, 2014
I wasn't really sure what to expect when I ordered this game, but it is actually really fun. There are a lot of rules in this game, but once you've read through the rule book (which is, admittedly, a very entertaining read) the game is pretty simple to play. It's a different game every time. I've played this several times now with my husband and several of my siblings and we all love it.

0.9354
Once you've played a few times and are familiar with the cards, the game can take as little as 15 minutes. However, the more players that are in the game, the longer the game will take.

December 28, 2013 AG8DWEUBMIUH0
open-ended
When we opened it at Christmas, there was no board, just cards. Should there be a board?
December 28, 2013 AM6N9TR5UXJFH
No, the board comes with the Deluxe version. It's used to help keep track of your points. In the regular version (this one), you can keep track using pen and paper.

5 Love this game!
12 2, 2013

December 30, 2013 A3RB9WFE6KL5CQ
This game is not really a "board" game, but a "card" game. You can buy a version of this game (Munchkin Deluxe) that does include a board, but all it really does is keep track of your levels, which we do with paper. We have both versions of the game. You can also buy many different "versions" of this game such as the original Munchkin or "Pathfinders", "Conan" etc and all of them can be intermingled to make a bigger game. There are also "booster" packs which have a variety of cards to add to your decks. We have a lot of different versions and they are all a lot of fun and every time you play, it's different, depending on the hand you're dealt etc. This game is not really a "board" game, but a "card" game. You can buy a version of this game (Munchkin Deluxe) that does include a board, but all it really does is keep track of your levels, which we do with paper. We have both versions of the game. You can also buy many different "versions" of this game such as the original Munchkin or "Pathfinders", "Conan" etc and all of them can be intermingled to make a bigger game. April 5, 2014 A1DK86NI174YBU
it is mostly counting up your attack points, besides reading the cards and following directions. there is some strategy to using the curse cards and how you use items, but that doesn't stop my 8 year old from playing with us.
Ashen Chore A1DK86NI174YBU
4 Fun game for kids, and role playing types
01 12, 2014
This is a fun game to play with your kids. I enjoy it as father playing with my boys. The cards are funny and the rules aren't too hard to figure out, especially if you review them first then play and review them as you go during the first game. It is a numbers game. You have to have the higher combat score to win against monsters to collect treasure cards. But there are other cards that will allow you to win or give you more points. There are cards that you put face up which are your character and everything he can hold, then there are face down cards/hand card that you keep secret to play during combat or against other players. It is fun to play but can be too easy for older kids who may lose interest if they aren't into role playing card games. If you need a game for an older set of kids, middle school up to 99, you should try The Settlers of Catan. You will pleasantly surprised by its uniqueness each time you play along with planning and strategy required to win.
April 5, 2014 A3A63FT9HX5VJJ
No it is not correct. It has some crude humor in it. I would say 14 - any age. My friends and I are in our 20's and we love it. This game, while simple in its nature, takes a lot of strategic planning in order to win, as everyone is against each other. Though if a 10 year old got good at it, they would probably really advanced in their processing abilities later in life.
Ken Wojnarowski A3A63FT9HX5VJJ

Bearzy A30HKXENO1X3QU
5 A great game with wacky cards.
12 11, 2013
Munchkin has really grown on us. At first it was strange, the rules were odd, and victories felt cheap and unearned. Now that our gaming group has played this dozens of times, we know the ins and outs of what's going to be in the deck. What equipment to look for and what items we could use to prevent the leading player from winning.Wacky and fun, this game can cause arguments to break out. It is a game about trumping your friends when they least expect it, and making alliances with others. There's even an Elf class that will gain a level by helping out a friend in battle.
December 16, 2013 AU600EWNO5IOV

June 27, 2014 A2TCSS8QD4V5AG
open-ended
Does this game talk about sex changes, transexuals and poke fun at gay people? I overheard a game being played and thought I might be mistaken?
June 27, 2014 AINWFBGZJS60M
There is nothing in the game that I or my family has taken that way. There are some cards that are more of a mature joke that kids would not get. Some examples are a Broad Sword that only females can use, Crabs as a monster where you discard armor and all items worn below the waist, a Horny Helmet (elf with a helmet with big horns) and snails on speed. There is a 'curse change sex card' which my 8 year old thinks is funny unless he is the one changed to a girl. We only have the first set, so there might be something in one of the other sets.
Amazon Customer AINWFBGZJS60M
5 Munchkin card game
05 13, 2014
My family really enjoys this game! The directions seem a little too much to figure out at first, but after a couple of practice hands we had it down. I plan to get some of the other packs for birthday gifts.
June 30, 2014 A36Q1PCM1TNBWG
There are some cards in the game that change your gender, which affects certain other cards that can only be used by a specified gender. However, it does not poke fun at gay people. More than likely, that was just the players.

Clear Sleeves: Standard Card Game Pack 50 Sleeves
1589945158

Fits Cards of This Size: 2 1/2" x 3 1/2" (63.5 x 88 MM)Each pack of sleeves includes 50 sleeves.All ...sleeves in the Fantasy Flight Supply board game sleeve line are made of clear, 100 micron-thick, non-PVC, acid-free polypropylene plastic. This means that the sleeves are durable, difficult to tear or crease, and are free of chemicals that will corrode the cards within the sleeves. The sleeves are also designed to fit cards snugly, to make shuffling and handling easy.Examples of games with cards that this sleeve will fit: Most trading card games, Call of Cthulhu LCG™, A Game of Thrones LCG™, UFS™, Pandemic™Universal Fighting System © Fantasy Flight Publishing, Inc. Call of Cthulhu ™ Chaosium, Inc.A Game of Thrones ™ George R.R. Martin. The chromatic (color) sleeve system is © 2009 and represents FFG's proprietary trade-dress to identify sizes for respective games.All rights reserved by their respective trademark holders.

January 11, 2014 AQ7I815BY9RXU
open-ended
Are they clear on both sides or one side is frosted?
January 11, 2014 A3FX9SBMU63UTH
They are clear on both sides. I use these pretty regularly.
Evil Spoon A3FX9SBMU63UTH
5 The best you can get.
09 16, 2012
Fantasy Flight card covers are consistently rated the best you can get by board game and card game junkies all over the world. They are durable, sized better than other brands, and they do their job. No other brand stands up to them. That said, the online cost of them is rather high, so I make this recommendation: check your local gaming store for these! I can't speak for every shop in the country, but where I live you can get these for HALF the price they are selling online at your local gaming or comic book shop. A lot of these places make their money off their merchandise, not the accessories, so they sell the card sleeves cheap. If your local shop doesn't do it, then go ahead and order here. These are a great product wherever you get them, and I'd rather overpay on these than underpay on junk.
January 11, 2014 A37A2FV1XKFUPC
Clear on both sides. Great for personal play, not acceptable for tournament play (for fear of card marking)
mtgarden A37A2FV1XKFUPC
4 Slippery
12 6, 2013
A little slippery, but overall, these are nice. I've bought about 12 packs over the last year and haven't had any sleeves have issues.
January 11, 2014 AI61II21B9NKZ
Clear on both sides.
S. Arthur Martin AI61II21B9NKZ
5 Well made, some inconsistent sizing, but FFG fixed the problem
02 24, 2012
I bought 14 packs of these sleeves to go along with my Lord of the Rings: Living Card game core set plus 6 adventure packs and the Kazad-Dum expansion.I'm very happy with how durable they are, and I appreciate the slick feel so that they are very easy to shuffle. I don't mind that they like to glide right off of each other when stacked. I'd rather my cards were easy to move.Unfortunately, however, I realized quickly as I was sleeving my cards that there were two distinct sizes (lengthwise only, not width) by a small margin. I ended up having to split the sizes between using the taller size for all the player cards, and the shorter size for all of the adventure deck cards.It was a crapshoot every time I opened another pack of 50 whether I'd see the taller or slightly shorter size. All of the packaging was identical (blue), and ten packs came in a sealed container together, so I'm confident I wasn't dealing with two products.Edit: 04/09/12I have revised my previous review from 3 stars to 5 stars. Fantasy Flight was responsive to my issue and far exceeded my expectations in resolving all the problems I had with sizing. I am very happy with my product and I thoroughly recommend this company to everybody.
January 12, 2014 A25UVNN541GC7T
Clear on both sides.
Armando Vigil A25UVNN541GC7T

4 Boring - but that's OK
03 27, 2014
They're cards sleeves and they protect your cards. This is not a product to get excited over, but one that is just tough and does its job well.Would be nice if Fantasy Flight made more of them as sometimes the prices can get ridiculous - they're not worth buying if they would cost more than the game they're protecting!
Fluxx 4.0
192978001X

A card game where the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, yo...u change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win. There are many editions, themed siblings, and promo cards available.

February 12, 2013 A1UC9Q69SASULU
open-ended
how is it different from the original fluxx? is it worth getting if i have the first version?
February 12, 2013 A14WE7RROKC4Q2
The only difference is a few extra cards, it's just the newest version of the original. If you were thinking about getting a new fluxx game i would suggest getting one of the specialty games like pirate fluxx or Monty Python fluxx. That way you could play them separately or mix the decks together.
Kaitlin R Odell A14WE7RROKC4Q2
5 This game is great!
12 8, 2012
This is definitively a game everyone should own. It's always changing so its always different. I had never played it before and found it easy to learn from the directions alone, and everyone in my family love it too :]
February 13, 2013 A17YX4X7EXE7HK
This is pretty similar to the original, however this version does have the extra "space/star" theme which comes in a handful of cards. I would say as someone else pointed out, some of the keepers, such as war and taxes, are now called Creepers and can prevent you from winning the game unless there is a rule card in play that allows the creeper to be used towards winning the goal. There are a few other cards such as a "Double Agenda" card that changes up the way you play. Overall, if you have the original Fluxx, I would recommend getting any of the themed specialty ones that really tends to creative new dynamics to the game. The Star Trek themed fluxx is a good one that involves character play and even special "powers." And as always, you can mix the original fluxx with any of the other versions for double the fun, though it might get extraordinarily confusing. Edna B A17YX4X7EXE7HK
4 A Unique More Challenging Version of Uno
09 7, 2012
I bought this after I saw it on the lineup for TableTop reviews (if you don't know what that is, please go check it out on youtube with Wil Wheaton!), and we have had quite a few fun games with it. It's a pretty simple game that has only 1 rule to start with (draw 2 cards, play 1) and as you play your action cards you begin to modify the rules (draw 4 cards, play 2, hand limit 1) and you even keep changing the requirements for how you win so the game is in constant fluctuation (Fluxx - get it?).It's easy to play, basically a no-brainer to teach considering the rules are never the same for any two games, and it's a little more sophisticated for adults who like to play Uno but get bored of matching colors and numbers. You can easily sabotage your friend who's about to win by abruptly changing a rule and so on goes the game. However, I have played with very competitive people and the games can last a really long time if you're constantly thwarting everyone's efforts to win. But it's always in the airplane bag for long airport waiting times or layovers.Pick it up because it's affordable and just simple enough to be fun for a long time.
February 12, 2013 A3E2PXTK5LBNJ6
Not really worth it if you have the original. As I recall, it has a few different/new cards.We lost our original deck, so had to get the new one!
M. Berendsen A3E2PXTK5LBNJ6
5 Love this game - keeps you on your toes.
12 25, 2012
With its constantly changing rules (which the players control) you really need to pay attention. Very engaging and pleasantly challenging.
February 12, 2013 A3637I8IQIRWRU
I have only played the original version once. However, I did notice a couple changes. First of all, in 4.0 there is a "rules escalation" card, so that every time the deck has to be shuffled during one game then the basic rules "draw one, play one" increase by one. For example, if the deck has to be shuffled once, then the rules escalation changes the basic rules from"draw one, play one" to "draw two, play two". If the deck has to be shuffled a second time during three same game then the basic rules escalate to "draw three, play three" and so on. Also in 4.0, some of the keepers, such as war and taxes, are now called Creepers and can prevent you from winning the game unless there is a silver lining rule card in play, or the creeper is part of a goal card. I don't know of any other differences as I only played the one game and didn't get through the whole deck, but some other things in 4.0 that could possibly be different are as follows:There is a "radioactive potato" that is passed around the table everyone the goal changes when it is in play. If you have the potato card in possession you can't win. However there is also a rule card that can be played that says you must have the potato card to win when you have the keepers that match the goal. There is a "double agenda" card that allows two possible goals to be available at the same time. There is an inflation card and a party bonus card that both increase the number on the cards, similar to the basic rules escalation mentioned above, but they increase any of the rule cards with a number on them, not just the basic rules. Lastly, there is a "first play random" card that requires the player to your left to choose your first play, unless you only have one play at the time according to the rules.As I said, I don't know how much of this is really different, but I hope I helped you decide if it is worth it. A someone else posted, there are always the specialty versions like the Monty Python version (you really need to know your Monty Python skits and songs to do well), martian, pirate, etc...Have fun no matter what you decide. For example, if the deck has to be shuffled once, then the rules escalation changes the basic rules from"draw one, play one" to "draw two, play two". However, I did notice a couple changes. First of all, in 4.0 there is a "rules escalation" card, so that every time the deck has to be shuffled during one game then the basic rules "draw one, play one" increase by one. For example, if the deck has to be shuffled once, then the rules escalation changes the basic rules from"draw one, play one" to "draw two, play two". If the deck has to be shuffled a second time during three same game then the basic rules escalate to "draw three, play three" and so on. Also in 4.0, some of the keepers, such as war and taxes, are now called Creepers and can prevent you from winning the game unless there is a silver lining rule card in play, or the creeper is part of a goal card. I don't know of any other differences as I only played the one game and didn't get through the whole deck, but some other things in 4.0 that could possibly be different are as follows:There is a "radioactive potato" that is passed around the table everyone the goal changes when it is in play. If you have the potato card in possession you can't win. However there is also a rule card that can be played that says you must have the potato card to win when you have the keepers that match the goal. There is a "double agenda" card that allows two possible goals to be available at the same time. Yinner68 "Hummbaby68" A3637I8IQIRWRU
5 Just ordered my 10th Fluxx 4.0
06 29, 2012
This is the 10th time I have ordered Fluxx 4.0. It's not that there is anything wrong with it, but rather I invite family and friends over to play and they end up loving the game so much I send it home with them. This is definitely my family's favorite game from the 8 year old to the 86 year old and everybody in between. My 86 year-old dad loves it because it helps him exercise his brain. The games you play are like snowflakes, no two games are the same. Some games have lasted only 5-10 minutes while others we've had to shuffle through the deck three or four times and lasted for over an hour. The beginning of the game is the same with the number of cards you start with and the first play is draw one, play one, after that you never know what is going to happen. The other thing that is the same every time is that we always have fun and end up laughing a lot.
January 27, 2014 A2L3CR4N15491T
open-ended
Is mixing a bunch if the different themed decks together a good idea or does it become too complicated?
February 9, 2014 A2BDL2YFS450GW
It depends on the rules for each deck. I have added Eco Fluxx without it the game too complex.However, we also tried to add Cthulhu Fluxx and it was too much.
Bjorkast A2BDL2YFS450GW
3 Eh...I've gotten more entertainment from a dirty sock
11 27, 2013
This games isn't bad if you want to try something new & get away from the typical monopoly -like board games. However, it gets boring fast & can drag on & on...
January 27, 2014 ADCK44EX8NZ8A
That's not really necessary. Each themed set is the entire game of fluxx, with a twist. If you are going to play or have played the original fluxx, that is the concept of the game. Each themed deck is the same game, so to speak, but with different rules, goals, keepers and creepers that fit with that theme. The Looney Labs crew may have a different take on this, and I haven't read their FAQ recently on this topic, but just thinking about the game(s) I wouldn't mix them up. Once you've played 2 different versions of fluxx you'll know exactly what I'm talking about, and how the concept of the game..."how it works" is the same framework, but each game has a flavor of it's own!It also seems like there's something for everyone within all of the expansions. There are still a few I haven't played, but look forward to! That's not really necessary. Each themed set is the entire game of fluxx, with a twist. Jobeth Bowers ADCK44EX8NZ8A
5 A game of ever changing rules and goals!
11 21, 2013
This game is great. Very much what I've come to expect from Looney Labs. I started off with Chrononauts, which is a somewhat complex game--certainly not one for the monosyllabic.Fluxx is a little more straightforward, but its always changing. This game starts off simple- Draw one card, play one card, pass to the next player. Then, players can play additional rules, changing the game. Now maybe you draw 4 cards, and perhaps you must play 2 each turn? Hand limits now? You never know what will happen next!There are goals, but those goals often change throughout the game. You may think you're one card away from winning it all, and in the blink of an eye and the play of one card, you've handed the game to an opponent.Love this game, great for 2 players or more. Also try out some of the other versions. I've played zombie fluxx and eco fluxx, and will probably grab a few more for the holidays this season.
September 27, 2013 A2ZIS0CUBXTUHR
open-ended

September 27, 2013 A1SDGV6AIPKXTI
It's actually geared more toward adults. Super enjoyable game!
Craminjoyous A1SDGV6AIPKXTI

Call it 15 minutes on the low side, 45 average. The game constantly changes in the most delightful way. Everyone always feels relevant, and it's hard to hold a grudge against a winner.

11 21, 2013
This game is great. Very much what I've come to expect from Looney Labs. I started off with Chrononauts, which is a somewhat complex game--certainly not one for the monosyllabic.Fluxx is a little more straightforward, but its always changing. This game starts off simple- Draw one card, play one card, pass to the next player. Then, players can play additional rules, changing the game. Now maybe you draw 4 cards, and perhaps you must play 2 each turn? Hand limits now? You never know what will happen next!There are goals, but those goals often change throughout the game. You may think you're one card away from winning it all, and in the blink of an eye and the play of one card, you've handed the game to an opponent.Love this game, great for 2 players or more. Family Flux does not have the "creepers" so it is easier to play. Family Flux also has family cards - parents get a bonus if the card is played. That kind of thing. It's a blast!

5 Fantastic game!
08 27, 2013
Account holders wife here giving the review! The kids (8 and 9 years old) and I play this all the time! It is great! I would suggest getting Family Fluxx first to get kids used to the rules and then moving on to this one. Family Fluxx is a bit more friendly ... no Creepers. You'll just have to buy the game to see what bad things Creepers are and can do ... but they can help you too! ;) We have the Monty Python version but haven't played it yet. We keep going back to this one! You never get the same hand twice! The replay value is excellent and it doesn't take up much room to store it!

Aradne A2SV833FKWH97M
5 Great Game for Gamers
11 30, 2013
Fluxx is a game in which the 'rules' constantly change. Each turn consists of drawing card(s) and playing card(s). You play certain 'keeper' cards in front of you, and if you have the correct combination of keepers that match the current goal. Of course, you can change the goal, or the keepers you have, or any of the rules depending upon what cards you have.Two downsides to this game- you have to read every card, which is difficult for people who are unused to games like this, and it's just complicated enough of a game that some people cannot play. (My mom cannot really play this game.)
December 14, 2013 A26QQ7YITP2HQC
You can pretty much tell what every card does by looking at the picture, but sometimes my younger ones need help with the action cards. So some light reading is necessary. My 6 yr old plays with us all the time.
CHRISTOPHER F FALZONE A26QQ7YITP2HQC

5 Fluxx

November 10, 2013 A262ZFT010SDLU
open-ended
Are there different cards than the family fluxx to warrant purchasing or is it about the same?
November 27, 2013 ARTERMU59Z3HW
They are different enough to make them all fun. We have Family Fluxx (safe for visitors to play), Monty Python (a bit adult), Zombie (kids love it and it has a real mean streak in it) and regular Fluxx (visitor safe also but larger than Family Fluxx). It is the same basic rules so if you can play one then you can play any of them. Family Fluxx does not have "Creepers". If you play the cards right you can steal keepers you need from other players, discard goals you know they could use to win and other little sneaky tricks to make the game last longer and to keep others from beating you. All of them are great fun! Our 9 year olds play all by Monty Python and love them. They are different enough to make them all fun. We have Family Fluxx (safe for visitors to play), Monty Python (a bit adult), Zombie (kids love it and it has a real mean streak in it) and regular Fluxx (visitor safe also but larger than Family Fluxx). It is the same basic rules so if you can play one then you can play any of them. Family Fluxx does not have "Creepers". If you play the cards right you can steal keepers you need from other players, discard goals you know they could use to win and other little sneaky tricks to make the game last longer and to keep others from beating... » Read More They are different enough to make them all fun. We have Family Fluxx (safe for visitors to play), Monty Python (a bit adult), Zombie (kids love it and it has a real mean streak in it) and regular Fluxx (visitor safe also but larger than Family Fluxx). Maggie A2WCDPO01CDUHK
5 Perfect fun, fast-paced game that changes every time you play it
02 3, 2014
I love the Fluxx series so much, and you can't go wrong with the original!Fluxx is the perfect go-to game if you want something fast-paced, fun and easy to learn. Because the explanation and basic rules of the game are so simple, I've found that it's equally fun for brand-new players as for those who've played it before. Everything is explained on each card, so you can give very minimal instructions to new players and they'll pick it up easily. We usually use this as a warm-up game on game nights with friends and family, before moving on to more strategy-based games.Since I mentioned strategy, I will give you one word of caution: this is not a game for those who are looking for something with elaborate strategy and get frustrated when the plan they've been working on for several rounds either doesn't work out or backfires. The nature of the game is to be ever-changing, so you have to be willing to go with the flow. You can have some strategy, of course, but you have to be willing to see it blow up in front of you in seconds--and then laugh about it!A word about the theme versions of the game: I own several of the other versions (Monty Python Fluxx, Star Fluxx, Oz Fluxx, Zombie Fluxx), and this is the version I play with either new players or when I have a mixed group of people in terms of their familiarity with some of the other themes. Monty Python Fluxx, for example, is best played by a group of MP lovers--this can be played by anyone, and they'll get the references and the humor!
March 10, 2014 A22QD0KFCEHG7
?
0.5898
Just adults? Its fin for the whole family but not sure its a game i wpuld play with just adults
Suzanne Boland "sixbolands" A22QD0KFCEHG7

Volantex RC 6-CH Simulator USB RC Airplane R/C Helicopter Training Kit for windows XP/Vista/Win7
7293000014

6CH USB Flight Simulator FMS RC Airplane R/C Helicopter Training KitThis is a revolutionary new Mode...l Flight Simulator. Its updated FMS software support Windows Vista and Win7. This simulator includes a model airplane simulator, model helicopter simulator, model glider simulator, and the ability to create your own models and landscapes. Flight Simulator comes with different types of planes and helicopters. You can sharpen your skills by practicing on computers. You can learn a lot no matter basic or advanced skills.This new simulator gives you real world flying experiences from your PC.Its Interlink Controller plugs into a USB port on your computer.It looks and feels just like a real transmitter and has switches for dual rates,retracts, and a knob for flaps. Especially, without AA battery, it can directly work with computer.You can operate an aircraft with the same feeling of a pilot in the computer, experiencing the exciting flight of a real plane, and your of dream flying freely in the blue sky deriving from your childhood come true! Come on! Challenge to be a pilot and enjoy the exciting!Note: Please practice simulation flight first on the computer before operating the electronic helicopters or airplanes in order to reduce the damage!- High-performance, High-realism 3D graphics and 3D sound effects- Connect with USB port cable and no batteries is required- Full 3D collision detection with all objects on the landscape, Many new landscapes- Separate channel and keyboard mapping for helicopters and airplanes- System Requirement: Windows2000/XP/ME/98/Vista/Win7 32-bit- Hardware Requirements: CPU Intel Pentium 800 or above; 32MB GAP 3D; 512MB RAM; 10GB hard disc; 12xDVD- Simulator supported: FMS Version2.0 Beta7 / FMS Version 2.0 Alpha8.4 and above

0.0127
No, you'll need a DX5e, DX6, DX6i, DX7, DX8 or any of the other controllers from Spectrum. The DX4 will not work with this. This controller can be used with other simulators, mind you, their physics is not to be compared with Phoenix.

3 It's alright for a cheap simulator...
04 16, 2014
The software worked on my computer; it's running Windows 7 64-bit. I don't really like it that much, so I'm using the Clearview SE simulator that I found free online. I never found any uses for the 5th and 6th channel which are the knobs which is a bummer. The software that I was using didn't even pick up on the 6th channel as I believe it's broken (I bought this as new). I kind of wish they made it closer to the Spectrum controllers, but I guess cheap is cheap I suppose. It did help me prepare myself for flying 4 channel airplanes, but nothing comes close to the real thing. It gave me inspiration and the confidence to go ahead and buy the micro Trojan and micro Mustang along with the DX6i remote on eBay.If you want to start flying four channel planes, I recommend starting here first. After here, decide if you want to buy a luxury simulator or use that same amount of money to buy a RTF plane... Your choice I suppose.

January 17, 2015 A3NC807DNWIF7I

There are several other free programs that might work if you search for "Flight Simulators." All of the ones that I have tried are truly terrible to figure out due to the lack of any real instructions. If you find a good one you should post it in a review.
Garner A3NC807DNWIF7I
3 Not what I expected
06 24, 2014
You basically get a "Controller" for your money. I couldn't get anything to work from just the disk. I had to find a missing "DLL" file on the internet to even try using the system. After that, none of the helicopter simulations would work so I contacted the company. They provided a link to another simulation that I could download for free. It worked, but only after "calibrating" the controller. That was a feat in itself considering the terrible instructions. I think that you could do the same thing if you had a 2 stick game controller of any type that hooks to your computer. This unit didn't cost much so I suppose it's OK for practicing. The simulations are pretty realistic and could save you some crash repairs on a real plane or helicopter.
January 18, 2015 AM8TWJRLPXNLH

?
0.2495

R. Simpson "Butterfly mind" A35E28O01JBAM2
4 Just as advertised
09 5, 2007
If you are interested in learning to fly a radio-controlled (R/C) airplane or helicopter, this is the most complete yet inexpensive way to try it out. The item contains a controller (the gadget you use to tell the plane where to fly) and the simulator software. The controller just plugs into your PC USB port. Load the software from the CD and off you go! Be sure to go to the Controller menu and calibrate the controller before you try to fly. You will have to reverse several of the controls and re-assign the throttle control to the proper control stick.The software is FMS, public-domain software that has not been upgraded in several years. There are hundreds of plane "models" for this software posted around the web.Considering that this competes with several commercial packages that list at $200-$300, it does an OK job. The big problem is that the simulator makes flying too easy. If you go to the field having only flown this software you will find the "real world" flight much more challenging. Also, the "world" in this simulator is very small. You will fly "out of the world" very quickly. The R/C airplane you fly in "the real world" can cost several hundred dollards, so if this saves you one crash it has paid for itself.
March 9, 2014 A3H1AGSKT365MB
yes/no
does the controller work on a mac?

Thunder AC680 Professional Dual-Power LiPo Balance Charger/Discharger w/ AC Adapter for 1-6 Lipo/ 1-15 Nimh + USB to PC Software
8499000037

Features:Accept various types of Lithium batteryThe smart charger can accept three types of Lithium ...batteries - LiIo, LiPo and LiFe. They have different characteristics by their chemistry, such as minimum, maximum, and charge termination voltages.Lithium battery Fast and Storage modeThe smart charger offers additional Lithium programming. Fast charge reduces the charging time of the Lithium battery and the Storage mode controls the final voltage of the battery to be suit for long time storage.Data store/load5 data of different batteries programs can be stored and retrieved. These data files can be recetrived at any time you need them without reprogramming.Cyclic charging/dischargingThe smart charger can perform 1 to 5 cycles of charge>discharge or discharge>charge for battery break in/refreshing and balancing.Back-light LCD screenInclude LCD displayRobust outer aluminum caseHigh-quality aluminum case is durable and very efficient to cool out the internal heatAdvanced temperature sensor cable port (sensor cable not included)An optional temperature probe contacting the surface of the battery to monitor the battery temperature during charging can be used

WL Toys V262 Cyclone UFO 4 Channel 6 Axis Gyro Quadcopter 2.4Ghz Ready to Fly (Red)
9269803716

The WL Toys V262 "Cyclone" Quadcopter is the perfect machine for those curious about quadcopters and... drones. Designed with simplicity in mind, it is light weight and its flight characteristics benefit from this design feature. Constructed of durable materials and graphite booms the light weight enhances the crafts power to weight ratio. The 4 rotors are driven by 4 motors protected in plastic housings. The rotors are also gear driven which relieves the stress on the motors. The rotor blades are also protected by a molded foam shell that absorbs impacts and protects the blades during collisions with obstacles. The V262 handles exceptionally well. With the help of an on board gyro and adjustable control sensitivity, the V262 is perfect for pilots of different skill level and ages. This drone is agile, and it has the ability to do flips and tricks. With the push of a button on the transmitter the aircraft enter "trick mode" allowing the pilot to do flips and rolls. The WL Toys V262 transmitter features a 2.4ghz radio system. This means you don't have to worry about signal interference and you have the ability to fly many of these at one time.WL Toys V262 Specification:Brand Name: WL ToysItem No: V262Channel: 4CHGyro: 6 axisFlight Duration: 8-10 MinutesRemote Control Distance: 100-150 MetersRecharging Time: 1-1.5 HoursBattery For Quadcopter: 7.4V 850 mAhBattery For Transmitter: 6 x AA Battery (not included)Quadcopter Size: about 55 x 55 x 5cmPackage Includes:1 x WL Toys V262 RC Quadcopter1 x transmitter1 x battery1 x charger4 x spare propeller**Required to Fly:**6 AA Batteries for Transmitter

October 29, 2014 A1O0GW3YNCXH3E
open-ended
What is actual weight of quadcopter? It says shipping weight 3.3 pounds, but my packaged that shippied is 6lbs!
October 29, 2014 A288LVEX2R2GG5
Its much less than 3 lbs. That might be the weight of the whole thing, box and all, but it would be shipped inside another box with padding. Remove the tops of the plastic thongs that are over the motors to let them cool in operation and they will last longer.
Dan A288LVEX2R2GG5
5 Works great. Good idea to remove the foam guard as ...
07 5, 2014
Works great. Good idea to remove the foam guard as soon as you get better at flying it. Remove the tops of the plastic things that go over the motors so they cool better and don't over heat and fail. Don't run it at full speed for very long, again to make the motors last longer
October 29, 2014 A3NFL619OAAPJX
I have not weighed it but it is much lighter that the package. It is big and bulky due to blade protector ring and the packaging weighs more that the quad by a lot. Many people remove the protector after their flying skills improve (I am not there yet) because the motor has a short life with the total weight and does much better when the shield is removed. Up to you of course. Good luck, Doug
Douglas S. Basberg "Doug" A3NFL619OAAPJX

Tony Kwong "Tk1970" A2AAPFRSIO2GRQ
4 Fun and Recommend, after 5x (updated ) 12x
12 27, 2013
This is my son's toy - I tested it..:)So far so good. Powerful enough to withstand light wind. I would recommend this, but I only used it once because of a Christmas gift. After confused by the manual, I decided to "just fly it and learn." This is what I found:Quadcopter-The two white LED is the front. (I found this extremely Important)The left stick on the controller is for lift-off (accelerate/up and decelerate/down). Move it to left or right ONLY ROTATE the quadcopter V262. It DOES NOT fly or move while hovering.The right stick is only for SHIFTING/TILTING: left, right, back, and forward and WILL fly/move to that direction until you let go the stick. Then it just hovers in the air.To have more fun, use both sticks...once you are familiar with the control.Controller-The 40, 60,80, and 100% buttons correspond to the "sharpness" of the SHIFTINGS/TILTING.The higher the percentage, the sharper of the tilt. I recommend to start at 40% (unsure if that is what it does. I based this on observations only)The controller screen shows all adjustments of the quadcopter. All my settings are in the middle. It hovers without rotating, shifting, or accelerating/lifting. (Luckly, mine came that way). If yours shift or rotate to one side, slide the slider/tab to the opposite to the direction until it correct itself. All four adjustment slider/tab are placed correspond to the what you need to do. Page 4 on manual. I recommend adjusting/trimming the hovering first. (The left Lift-off stick)Top right corner front button on the controller is for stunt flip. Only perform when quadcopter is at least 15 feet off the ground. It was an accident when I did it. Gave me a fright. The stunt needs at least 4 feet dropTakes about one full hour to charge. 10 minutes of non stop flyingPlay outdoor unless you have a large indoor room or an experience flyer.Note: I did not use terms like rudder, elevator, crab, throttle, or aileron. I just want it to be simple. Apologized to all the non-novice flyers.Pros - powerful and ready to fly after charging. Construction and material seems strong enough for minor crashes.Cons - the manual IS really bad. Small prints. Made in China so the instruction manual is a bit confusing for me. My manual is for model V959 but I purchased V262.???? And the manual called it Quadrocopter not Quadcopter.You need a large space like a park with no trees around unless you are an experience flyer. I'm not...Will update againUpdate: 12/29/13 Charged for the 5th time. So far consistent on the time it takes to charge. 1 hr and 20 minutes. Correction on theflight time. Only 8 minutes 20 seconds of continuous flight not 10 as stated on previous post. Few flips, lots of turns and shifts.Good 40% in full throttle going up. Constant use of both sticks at the same time.My last flight lasted 9 minutes and 12 seconds. Why? I turned off the LED lights and I flew it about 30/40 feet off the ground. Mostlythe use of the right stick shifting/rotation and very few lifts. (still fun but not as cool)I decided to use Gorilla Glue to "anchor" the connection (female end blk/red) wires to the circuit board. The connection wiresrequired a lot of movement to connect to the battery. Way too much "play" on the soldering. Now the first half inch wires from thesoldering doesn't move. I can turn it any way I see fit. (This is my opinion only. It is NOT required).Note: The quadcopter will descend (from what I noticed) by itself when battery is low. I can't guarantee that when it is way up high.So after about 8 minutes of fun, stay low and close. I continue to give a good "Recommend" 4 stars.Will update after 10 more flights. And try the 1000Mah battery.Update: 01/10/14 charge time and flight time remain consistent. Crashed onto grass a few times (tumbling) No damage yet. Pretty durable so far; on grassed park with few trees. One of the main anchor to the styrofoam is loose. It is from bad landing. I powered down too quickly while quadcopter still a bit high. Oops!I read many reviews and I do agree with some of those issues. The motors are hot after the 8-9 minutes of flights, but not enough to remove my fingers. (How hard you push the quadcopter at max speed plays a big role in my opinion)So far I have 12 total flights and no issues yet. (My second v262 has 4 flights)The 1000MAh battery gave me extra 2 minutes. Due to the reviews, (overheating the motors) I would not push the quadcopter at full throttle 75% of the flight due to longer flight time with this battery. This is my opinion of course. My flight patterns are mostly below 75% power and few quick burst at 100%. I drop to 20-25% power when gliding down from up high (trying to conserve battery and possibility of cooling the motor.) Save your money. Not worth it for extra 2 minutes. It also too big (I knew this before purchase)to fit into the original battery compartment.I watched some videos where a camera was attached and it shows the whole neighborhood 5-6 blocks away. So I tried it (95% throttle power) AND yes it can go high; to the point that I was unable to tell if it was moving. (It started to beep) I throttled down to 20% and watched it slide/drop back down. (I performed this after a full/fresh battery installed. Don't do this after a flight, otherwise you might not have enough power to recover from the high slide/drop)I now have my own quadcopters V262. My 12yrs old son and I fly it together, chasing each other with the quadcopters, (not recommend, It will hurt if the propeller/s touch your head) gliding back and forth, dodging, (also not recommend, it hurts) herding my dog back, (not recommend, might hurt the dog) ect. Binding seems to take longer on mine. Construction was solid. The charger block is different. Otherwise everything is exactly like my son's v262.I continue to RECOMMEND the v262 quadcopter still only 4 stars. I would give 5 stars if I can use it 100% throttle for most of my flights without worrying about over heating the motors. As long as you don't push it to full throttle, drop landing, and not crash into trees, the v262 should last. This is my last review unless something serious. Have fun flying!
November 11, 2014 A26LFA0Z6P5N4T
About 20-25 mph
John Fay A26LFA0Z6P5N4T

1/10 2.4Ghz Exceed RC Electric Infinitive EP RTR Off Road Truck Sava Red
9269807460

The Exceed RC Infinitive EP Monster Truck is packed with loads of features that will provide hours o...f action packed off road smashing. The 2.4ghz transmitter and receiver system ensures you will have excellent communication between driver and vehicle. The transmitter also allows dual-rate adjustments for throttle and steering so you can fine tune the power delivery and steering control of this truck. The power-train is reinforced and will handle extreme terrain. Metal geared front and rear differentials are driven by an aluminum center driveshaft and distributes the power to all four wheels. The power department is handled by a brushed 540 motor and supported by a 7.2v 1800mah Ni-Mh battery with charger included. Camber and toe settings are adjustable via turnbuckle linkages which allow you to make precise adjustments for the terrain your truck is smashing through. The high ground clearance paired with the large wheels and tires ensures this truck climbs through the toughest obstacles. This truck comes out the box completely ready to run with the exception of 4 AA batteries for the transmitter. Simply pull the truck out, charge the battery and your ready tame the unknown.Features:Aluminum centre drive shaftPowerful 540 Brushed MotorPowerful Electronic Speed ControllerHigh performance front/rear differentialsAdjustable front and rear suspensionAnodized aluminum radio trayEight oil adjustable shocksOff road knobby tiresLarge diameter wheelsReinforced front/rear bumperSpecifications:Length: 400mm (15.7 inch)Width: 310mm (12.2 inch)Height: 185mm (7.2 inch)Wheelbase: 275mm (10.8 inch)Gear Ratio: 1:10.3Weight: 2267g (5 lb)Wheel Diameter: 120mm (4.7 inch)Wheel Width: 60mm (2.3 inch)

Hero RC H911 2.4GHZ iRocket 4 Channel Fixed Pitch Ready to Fly Helicopter w/ bonus Battery, Balance Bar, Main Blade, Connect Buckle, Tail Blade, USB Charger
9269808955

Hero RC H911 is a 100 class helicopter. It is a 4 channel fixed pitch helicopter providing true radi...o control helicopter flight performance. It is constructed with composite plastic materials providing light weight and durability. Its elastic properties make it great for novice pilots that may crash frequently. The H911 comes equipped with a 2.4ghz transmitter with an LCD screen. The LCD screen provides the pilot with trim information and a visual aspect of trim settings. It also has a plug allowing you to charge the batteries if there is no USB port around. The Hero RC H911 is all about the fun and excitement with radio control helicopter flying. The entire package allows the pilot to be ready to fly within minutes of charging the battery. Extra spare blades are also included in the package in case of mishaps. Specifications:Length: 223mm (~8.7in)Height: 81mm (~3.2in)Rotor Diameter: 189mm (~7.4in)Flight Duration: 5-7minutesCharging Time: 50-60 minutesRange: 50-80m (~54-87yards)Package contents:V911 4-Channel Helicopter2.4ghz Transmitter2x 3.7V 130Mah Li-polyChargerUSB cableExtra rotor bladesRequired to Fly:Transmitter requires 6 AA Batteries to operate**Can not be flown in windy conditions**NOTE** Extra spare parts are on the bottom side of the box.

September 17, 2013 A280SGPTDBH9V2
open-ended
Is this good for 7 or 8 year old?
September 17, 2013 A1BCNHP79ZBP1C
Thats a tough one IMO, its made of light plastic so it's safe in that aspect but the blades do spin quite fast. Would really only be a problem if it were to hit one of his eyes. It does take some practice and patience to fly correctly. With out trying to sound rude, it's possible the child may either break the item in a short period of time or lose patience trying to get to fly right. It really depends on the child and thier capabilities at that particular age. I hope this helped!
Justin Evans A1BCNHP79ZBP1C
5 Hero h911, a must have for heli fans!
06 30, 2013
This Hero H911 is an amaizing little bird! I had a couple 3ch helis last year and while fun the excitement faded after a couple months of use. It was a great place to start and glad I had the oportunity to do that to really appreciate this 4ch unit. Recently I got the itch to fly another RC heli and started to do some research. Just like you I ran across this killer little toy and knew I had to have it! The added 4th channel over the 3ch units I have used makes this heli loads of fun! If you have owned/operated a 3 ch model this will be a bit easier to master but I can safely say that a complete beginner can operate the H911 with a little bit of practice & patience. I cant stress how much bang you get for the buck. Both the controller and heli are very well built with good quality materials. The heli is pretty darn tough! Ive hit the walls and dropped from 6-8ft onto hard wood floors several times and this sucker just keeps on going. Yes you can hover this fairly easily and yes you can avoid walls but to me thats no fun, heheh, I like to push it to the extremes and try entertaining manuevers, fly through different rooms, attenpt fitting through small areas and best of all annoying the heck out of the cat! It does come with some spare parts to replace commonly broken pieces and does have 2 batteries to aid the flight time. For some reason, mine came with 130mah batteries like the V911 (as opposed to 180mah like other places selling I have viewed) but they work fine. I did opt for a couple of the 200mah batteries that I found rather affordable online to get a little more extended flight time. Its a great means of relaxation and unloading my work stress during the week. If your on the fence for any reason, dont be, order it. You will be very satisfied. Those leaving less than high ratings either were unfortunate enough to recieve a defective item or just expect to be an expert in minutes without the need for practice (wich would take the fun out of it if it were that easy in my opinion)!Edit 7/16/13: Still love this heli as much as day 1. I have even flown it outside in light wind a few times (you can search on youtube "h911 outdoor flight in wind" and see a couple vids I posted up) with great success. I do want to point out that some are posting an "upgraded swash plate" comes on the H911 wich is only somewhat true. It IS upgraded over the "old, original" V911 swash (I mean early production) but the swash on the H911 is the same as what you get on the V911 (v2) that has the newer battery connection available online today. Outside of some places offering the 180mah batteries with the H911 for a few minutes more of flight time, the only thing that makes this better (to some) is the Warbird canopy as it appears to be a limited production canopy. I do love it and wish I had ordered a V911 canopy to preserve the Warbird canopy but who wants to fly around on thier $50 heli without the cool Warbird face on it? Not me! Still cant say enough good things about this heli!
September 17, 2013 AA6XXOW7CIR08
It depends on their skill level...it would be tough to fly if they have never flown a heli before...if it is their first time I would start with something like the Syma S107.
Jasem AA6XXOW7CIR08
5 Perfect step up from a coax
08 17, 2013
I started with a Syma S107 and learned the basics of flying a heli. This helicopter is the perfect step up from that. It flies well inside, but you will want more room than with the S107. This heli is much more fun outside in light or no wind. It has two modes that switch at the push of a button on the radio. Mode 1 is great for getting used to the heli and mode 2 will make all the controls quicker as the servos are able to extend further. It is very durable, but you will want to buy an extra set of blades and a couple of connect buckle sets (attach the swash plate to blade to balance bar.) You will also want to get an some more batteries (I got ones that were larger than the stock batteries.) These parts are cheap, like another $20 or so. I looked at several heli's and decided on this one. For $55 or so it is a great deal.
September 17, 2013 A28Y2JISBE9F3U
I would not recommend it.
Ivan Bey A28Y2JISBE9F3U

5 Great Single Rotor Fixed Pitch Heli
07 7, 2014
This little H911 it truly worth every cent. Great entry level single rotor heli. Very stable and forgiving. However if you have mastered your coaxial then this probably won't keep your attention for long. Faster, more nimble, and requiring some more stick and rudder input, it won't be long before you're zipping around the living room and kitchen blowing out candles. If you think you are ready for something a little more challenging, I would drop my extra pennies on the msr, msr x or even the honey bee V3 If you are feeling like you're a natural. Anywho this is a great heli for buzzing around the house, and at the price is definitely worth the fun. "Fly slow and fly fast but power down before you crash."

5 love my new heli
08 10, 2013
this is a great product for the price, im new at rc helis and i crashed it all over, i cant belive how much abuse this thing can handle, be prepared to put it back together like 20 times before you get the hand of it, my house is too small for indoor flying but i fly it at the park and i love it, i recommend buying extra 200mha batteries and extra spare parts if youre gonna use it much and take this as a hobby, and you will, dont listen to lower rates cause of missuse or lack of ability to fly it, once you learn how to youll surely rate it 5 star, remember to put the heli in horizontal position before pushing the battery in, led will blink fast, wait till it blinks once a sec and THEN turn controller on, it will bind inmediately, be carefull throttle stick is at its lowest position before binding and be carefull of not touching it while moving the heli after binding.i also recommend starting with a syma 107 before buying this, or buy the two of them and start with the symai repeat, at first you will get VERY frustrated by the fact of crashing, and crashing, and crashing, having to put the heli back togheter, take it to open field, DONT start inside your house unless you have a big house.well any questions feel free to asksorry for my englishbye!

5 AWESOME LITTLE HELI!
05 15, 2013
I've purchased a few remote control heli's over the past few years and I'd have to say that this by far is the best one! The price is fantastic on this helicopter considering what it does. Control is amazing! Durability is very good as well. I've had a few indoor/outdoor crashes, nothing crazy, and the only part that tends to break are the large blades. This really isn't such a big deal because there are several retailers right here on Amazon that sell replacements. Replacing them is a 15 minute job, but gets easier after you do it a few times. I would definitely advise you to buy a few spares. Other than the large blades nothing had broken on mine. My only complaint, if you can really call it that, is that I can't find an exact replacement for the canopy. It tends to get banged up a bit, and I'd like to get a brand new one. I would absolutely tell you to pick up this heli without hesitation. I haven't had any personal contact with the seller, but I can say that it arrived quickly and in perfect shape.

December 3, 2013 A3JHWYUZ9358PV
Yes ma'am! These are 2.4 ghz which means they are code hopping, they won't use the same code to interfere with each other. These are very very fun to fly, they'll love them!

5 Fun and tough as nails!
02 20, 2013
This little heli bound to my tx with no prob and seems to be deceptively bullet proof! As flimsy as this heli looks, it has bashed into walls, the floor, a table and had about a 7' fall onto the blacktop and hasn't broke not one part! I'm serious, this thing can survive a novices learning process with resilience and steadfast durability. The only problem that I have with this bad to the bone bundle of fun is that I cant seem to fly it enough! This helicopter is addictive and provides a fun filled challenging flight that will make the young and old alike smile for days!
December 3, 2013 A1RJTSOL96VOWK
b_z_momma, Yes, two of these V911's would be able to fly at the same time. With the 2.4GHz technology, you won't have to worry about the two transmitters interfering with each other. The trick is to not "Bind" or turn on both R/C Helicopters at the same time. Example: Helicopter#1 - turn on transmitter and then insert battery and wait for a solid red light on the Helicopter; then it's ready to go. Helicopter#2 - Bind this Helicopter the same way as #1. As long as each Helicopter is "Binded" separately, there will be no issue. And with the 2.4GHz transmitter technology, well over 100+ remote controlled Helicopters, airplanes, and cars can run at the same time without interference issues. b_z_momma, Yes, two of these V911's would be able to fly at the same time. With the 2.4GHz technology, you won't have to worry about the two transmitters interfering with each other. The trick is to not "Bind" or turn on both R/C Helicopters at the same time. Example: Helicopter#1 - turn on transmitter and then insert battery and wait for a solid red light on the Helicopter; then it's ready to go. Helicopter#2 - Bind this Helicopter the same way as #1. As long as each Helicopter is "Binded" separately, there will be no issue. And with the 2.4GHz... » Read More b_z_momma, Yes, two of these V911's would be able to fly at the same time. With the 2.4GHz technology, you won't have to worry about the two transmitters interfering with each other. The trick is to not "Bind" or turn on both R/C Helicopters at the same time. Example: Helicopter#1 - turn on transmitter and then insert battery and wait for a solid red light on the Helicopter; then it's ready to go. Helicopter#2 - Bind this Helicopter the same way as #1. As long as each Helicopter is "Binded" separately, there will be no issue. And with the 2.4GHz transmitter technology, well over 100+ remote controlled Helicopters, airplanes, and cars can run at the same time without interference issues. « Show Less
Richard Luchs "D4YDR34M3R" A1RJTSOL96VOWK
5 Highly Impressed
02 25, 2013
Wanted a fixed pitch flybarred ultra micro RC Heli to fly around the house for enjoyment and although I've tried other brands, this Hero RC H911 is by far the best to date. Included transmitter and extra spares ensures it'll be flying for some time in my fleet.The Hero RC H911 cost way less than a BLADE mSR and flies so much better than either the mSR or mSRX, which has required some (expensive) aftermarket parts to get them to come close to measuring up to the stability and flyability of the Hero RC H911. Packaging was Excellent and all parts & extra's were there (main & tail blades, flybar, linkages). Outstanding canopy design and paint on this Heli, as well.Once recieved, I looked the whole kit over and had a Lipo (battery) charging while I did so. Binding this Heli to the included transmitter went without a hitch; I did this even though the H911 may have been binded to the transmitter already from the factory, out of habit. Checked all the range of motion of the swash plate to ensure it moved the same direction as the transmitter inputs. A bit of throttle and the H911 was in the air. After spending a minute or so trimming both the Aileron & Elevator via the transmitter, this Heli will hover hands off for a bit of time. Piro's were so much better than the one's a mSR can do and flying is smooth and controlled without any major oscillations once the cyclic stick returns to center.Because I also fly larger Collective Pitched Helis, I do wish the transmitter had a configurable timer on it, so as to not out fly the Lipo's capacity. This can damage a Lipo over time.Overall, I'm really happy with the Hero RC H911 and Impressed. A great Heli to fly indoors when the weather is not so great or when I don't want to practice 3d with my other ultra micro CP Helis.
December 4, 2013 A1HH29FVSTXJVA
I think each remote can only be bond to one particular helicopter. My two co-works saw me flying my H911 in the office and they decided to buy one each. Although we did not fly all three at the same time because they worried they might crash on each other, my remote cannot control theirs and vice versa. Their operating frequencies must be slightly different. So, the answer is yes, your boys should be able to fly them at the same time. However, like the combination pad locks, there always is a possibility of buying 2 with the same combination because the number of combination is limited. Then again, what is the chance of running into that? I tell you, this is the best 4-channel RC chopper I¡¦ve ever flown. I¡¦ve convinced 8 people to buy one of these in the past year already and they are all happy with them! Happy flying. ƒº I think each remote can only be bond to one particular helicopter. gt507866 A1HH29FVSTXJVA
5 This little bird rocks!
03 4, 2013
If you are looking for a quick and short answer, then I'd say YES, buy it. Now if you have time and want to know a little about my RC heli flying experience then read on. I started flying the RC heli with an indoor, toy-grade, 3/3.5-channel, infra-red (The sun light will interfere with infra-red), coaxial (2 sets of main rotor/blades) model. It's cheap, slow, and stable, but less responsive to the control, and the fact that it needs a 20~30 minute charging time for every 3~4 minutes of play is just a pain in you know what. After I became pretty good at it (Also tired of it), I got crazy. I moved up to a 450 class 6-channel collective pitch single rotor model, which was a huge mistake. It's like from playing with a harmless toy to an upside-down lawn mower! It was a money pit! Every crash (Usually happened in 10 seconds after take-off) would cost me at least $10~$20 for parts and lots of time trying to repair and adjust it myself. Stepping from a 3.5-channel model to a 6-channel one is a big step. If you think you are a born RC heli generous, then I congratulate you. As for the rest of us, it will crash, again, and again, and... I don't know it's the fact that I ran out of patience or I almost chopped off my fingers, but my money is definitely running out. So I sold the remaining of the chopper on eBay and completely gave up flying RC heli. About 8 months later, I came across the V911 single rotor indoor/outdoor with gyro model made by WL Toys (I think it's a 100 class), and saw nothing but positive reviews. Of course I was skeptical this time after I got burned by the big chopper. But considering 1, the kit (RTF- Ready to fly) is still inexpensive; 2. It's not a lawn mower, so I went for it. Boy I tell ya, I am so happy that I made the decision. I have so much fun with this little buzzer. Oh, by the way, I bought the H911 version because the canopy looks so much cooler.The gyro works. It's mentioned in the instruction, but I'll say it again. You need to set the heli on a leveled surface as soon as you insert the battery, because it will initialize the gyro right after that and uses it as the "base" meaning the heli will always try to return to this position during flight until next initialization. So imagine the heli's "base" is in a tilted position... Not fun! Fly indoor first if the space is big enough, or fly outside when there is NO WIND during your leaning period. I'd still call it a toy, but there is still a little bit of learning curve, because the heli is very agile and the control is very sensitive compared to the indoor infra-red 3.5-channel model. If the gyro is initialized correctly then it should hover pretty easily. After some trimming, it will hover by itself, and then you will have some serious fun! Remember, crashing is inevitable, at least for me, so practice practice and practice. This little bird can take some `unintentional beatings'. There are a lot of cheap replacement parts you can on eBay, so don't worry about your wallet being too shallow. Some personal advice: I'd buy another charger and some high capacity (200 mah) batteries to allow more, if not continuous, flying time. I also bought a few replacement canopies and replaced the original one before I destroy it. The shark face is just too cool!That's all. I hope that would help you making the final decision. Any comment is welcome. Thanks for reading.
December 4, 2013 A1R5I01TER0H4N
Yes they can.just turn one on before the other.
bob otley A1R5I01TER0H4N

5 Amazing product for the price.
02 7, 2013
This little 4channel RC single rotor 'copter is really incredible for the small amount of money I paid (under $50). The amount of minaturized hardware (gyros, servos, etc.) on this small bird really astounds. Once you've mastered a Syma 107G you can step up to this Heli and master 4 channel fixed pitch flight. Hovers and flies right out of the box. Great packaging and a good instruction manual. Extra parts and two 180 MA batteries for 7-8 minute flights x 2. Well made and detailed. Super value. The most fun and excitement I've had for the money ever.

5 Amazing Fun for a More Than Reasonable Price
11 7, 2013
I love this helicopter. I have one of the $20 helicopters that uses infrared and its been great fun indoors but I wanted something i could fly outdoors. There is definitely a learning curve so this should be bought as the next step up from the indoor ones as you can apply all those skills. Highlights are the numerous ways to "dial it in" from the controls, the speed, the cool bank turns and the durability. It also has two modes which allows you to take things slow at first. My only complaint is i wish the led light was on the outside as night time is great to practice due to no winds but its disappears at certain angles. I'm still giving it 5 stars though as it is challenging yet loads of fun. This purchase should be a no brainier and it's extra cool that it included spare parts.
December 2, 2013 A2LRONCF6YA26Q
It is a remote control. I wouldn't suggest this as a first helicopter for a child; 12 year old to learn on, as it is a 4 channel helicopter. Now if he/she has had plenty of practice and is proficient with a 3 channel helicopter, this is definitely the next step up from there. It is an awesome 4 channel flying helicopter, but I personally feel it is a graduated step up from the basics of a 3 channel helicopter. I recommend the Syma S107/S107G R/C Helicopter Helicopters for starters. They are some excellent 3 channel; up/down, left/right, forward/backward flying helicopters for anyone that is just learning to fly and you can usually buy them for around $20. I hope this helps. December 2, 2013 ABFY83CON4YEN
This is indeed remote controlled. Whether or not it is appropriate for a 12 year old depends entirely on the 12 year old. If they have any experience with a remote controlled helicopter before, then this would be a fine gift for them. If they have no such experience but enjoy the challenge of mastering a new skill and have a great deal of patience then this may also be a good gift. If they have no RC experience and don't handle crashes well, I would suggest a coaxial 3-channel helicopter instead. They are much easier to fly, though this will be more rewarding if and when it is mastered.
Sean ABFY83CON4YEN
5 Awesome first four channel
03 15, 2013
I bought this helicopter from another website but I want to share my review here for anybody who's looking.I've had this heli for about half a year now. I fly it almost entirely indoors, in my little apartment. It's small enough to fly safely inside without worrying about breaking things. Although it does scuff the walls up a bit if the blades hit them. I used to think the all-metal designs were the best, but this one has convinced me otherwise. It's much lighter than a metal heli, and it withstands crashes that would destroy other copters.It has two holes in the servo arms that you can connect the control rods to. I would definitely suggest moving them to the inner hole for beginning or indoor flight. It is much slower and more controllable that way. It also has a button on the transmitter that controls the turn sensitivity. It says mode 1 and mode 2 but it's really just turn speed.Outside is where this thing really shines, because you need space to take advantage of its speed. Just don't try to fly it in the wind. If the wind is strong enough to feel, it will toss this thing around like the toy it is.I absolutely love that there are two batteries and they are removable for charging. Twice the fly time means twice the fun.Overall, this thing is way more than fifty dollars worth of fun. If you want a beginning four channel helicopter, this is the one.
December 2, 2013 AIUSCP5WF8BI8
Yes, it's radio controlled. As for the suitability for a 12 year old I'd have to say that these are difficult to to learn on. My suggestion is to start by learning to master a coaxial infrared remote controlled copter like the Syma S108G. They can be flown indoors and are the best way to learn the basics of remote controlled flying. Trust me... there's a big learning curve to mastering these birds.
Jim Bly AIUSCP5WF8BI8
5 Addictive!
10 10, 2013
This is the copter to buy if you're ready to graduate from a 3 channel indoor bird. The 2.4 Ghz radio control allows outdoor as well as indoor flight. Super responsive and a real gas to fly. Check out some U-tube videos... Be sure to get the extra 200 mah batteries for longer flying times (you're definitely going to want more flying time), and a spare parts bag because you'll no doubt break some main rotor blades. Other than that, this copter is very durable, enduring crashes very well as long as you back off of the throttle before impact. Have fun!

I was really quite surprised with it especially for the price. Hope this helps

5 Perfect step up from a coax
08 17, 2013
I started with a Syma S107 and learned the basics of flying a heli. This helicopter is the perfect step up from that. It flies well inside, but you will want more room than with the S107. This heli is much more fun outside in light or no wind. It has two modes that switch at the push of a button on the radio. Mode 1 is great for getting used to the heli and mode 2 will make all the controls quicker as the servos are able to extend further. It is very durable, but you will want to buy an extra set of blades and a couple of connect buckle sets (attach the swash plate to blade to balance bar.) You will also want to get an some more batteries (I got ones that were larger than the stock batteries.) These parts are cheap, like another $20 or so. I looked at several heli's and decided on this one. For $55 or so it is a great deal.
August 21, 2013 AA6XXOW7CIR08
The manual just basically tells you how the controls work...the main thing is make sure you're in mode one and not mode two on the remote... the top left Silver button switches the mode...mode one is much easier to control...you can fly it in light wind or inside, but I would start outside in no wind to get used to it first
Jasem AA6XXOW7CIR08
5 Perfect step up from a coax
08 17, 2013
I started with a Syma S107 and learned the basics of flying a heli. This helicopter is the perfect step up from that. It flies well inside, but you will want more room than with the S107. This heli is much more fun outside in light or no wind. It has two modes that switch at the push of a button on the radio. Mode 1 is great for getting used to the heli and mode 2 will make all the controls quicker as the servos are able to extend further. It is very durable, but you will want to buy an extra set of blades and a couple of connect buckle sets (attach the swash plate to blade to balance bar.) You will also want to get an some more batteries (I got ones that were larger than the stock batteries.) These parts are cheap, like another $20 or so. I looked at several heli's and decided on this one. For $55 or so it is a great deal.
August 23, 2013 A39IDAUEE4VEFZ
I'm not sure about downloading one, but I purchased 2 of these heli's and both did come with a manual. I would contact the manufacturer or seller and request one. Good luck!
ACoss72 "ACoss72" A39IDAUEE4VEFZ
5 AWESOME LITTLE HELI!
05 15, 2013
I've purchased a few remote control heli's over the past few years and I'd have to say that this by far is the best one! The price is fantastic on this helicopter considering what it does. Control is amazing! Durability is very good as well. I've had a few indoor/outdoor crashes, nothing crazy, and the only part that tends to break are the large blades. This really isn't such a big deal because there are several retailers right here on Amazon that sell replacements. Replacing them is a 15 minute job, but gets easier after you do it a few times. I would definitely advise you to buy a few spares. Other than the large blades nothing had broken on mine. My only complaint, if you can really call it that, is that I can't find an exact replacement for the canopy. It tends to get banged up a bit, and I'd like to get a brand new one. I would absolutely tell you to pick up this heli without hesitation. I haven't had any personal contact with the seller, but I can say that it arrived quickly and in perfect shape.

9269809811

Features:High capacity fuel tank with perfect caliber makes it impossible to overflow and provides l...ong run timesNew lightweight suspension arms deliver quick suspension response and reduce the critical sprung weight and overall weight of the truckThe new .18 engine features a new crankcase and upgrades to the cylinder, piston, connecting rod and crankshaft, delivers more power, more torque and extra cooling.The Infinitive will be available "Ready-To-Run" making it the highest on-road performance 4-wheel drive nitro racing car available to everybodyCompletely preassembled with high quality radio gear, painted, trimmed and ready to rollThe new .18 (18 CXP) engine provides reliable and consistent power for high performance on-road drivingThe 2.5mm lightweight aluminum alloy chassis provides excellent performance and durabilityExcellent differential system design provides quick access to the front or rear differential by removing only few screws. You can now access the front and rear differential for easy maintenanceNew lightweight suspension arms deliver quick suspension response and reduce the critical sprung weight and overall weight of the carThough metal disk brake system provides efficient deceleration and precise control, New lightweight suspension arms deliver quick suspension response and reduce the critical sprung weight and overall weight of the carHigh capacity fuel tank with perfect caliber makes it impossible to overflow and provides long run timesThe high quality AM transmitter and receiver work together to let you precisely control your car.***STARTER KIT REQUIRED AND SOLD SEPARATELY***

December 23, 2013 A8FULY7RPRD7D
open-ended
what do I need for batteries
April 25, 2014 A31NOORFC1UAYG
Craig L. Is Correct. This RC requires 8 AA Batteries. 4 for the remote and 4 for the truck. 4 AA batteries need to be placed in the receiver box of the truck itself when being binded with the radio. the truck uses electric servos for steering and gas/brake engine control.
Ernie A31NOORFC1UAYG
5 Fun Toy!
04 23, 2014
I took it out 3 times and haven't had any problems getting it to start, Sometimes I drive it with the painted body off. It's a rugged little vehicle. I did some small jumping with it and gunned it across open grass. Although I accidentally drove it into a good sized puddle the servos still work fine, Just wiped the water off and packed it away.Note: The only issue I see with this truck, Is where the manufacturer positioned the fuel line too close to thegear box, the metal gears have potential of cutting the fuel line causing a gas leak. That being said, The fuel linemay need to be shortened
