Mousetrap Game (2005 Edition)
B00000DMFD

Build a better mousetrap? We dare you. Naturally, the object is to trap mice in the mousetrap, while... avoiding getting trapped. By rolling the die, you proceed around the game board, collecting cheese pieces and building a mousetrap bit by bit. Once complete, you set the wheels in motion, as it were, to try to capture the opposition's mice. But this is no ordinary trap. With this contraption you start by turning the crank, that rotates the gears, that push the lever, that moves the shoe, that kicks the bucket, that sends the ball down the stairs and into the gutter, that leads to the rod that releases a second ball, that falls through the bathtub and onto the springboard, that catapults the diver into the washtub, that causes the cage to fall and--whew!--hopefully, capture a mouse. The last "mouse" left uncaptured wins--Alison Golder

April 24, 2014 A263A70R6XLJZA
open-ended
how to play the game mouse trap
April 24, 2014 A1QIG8RJL0KF1G
the instructions are in the box. You roll the dice, move your piece around the board. Almost every time you land you build a part of the mouse trap. Once it's complete you can launch the trap and try to catch the other players to win. Hope that helps!
J. Manley A1QIG8RJL0KF1G
5 Great game
01 17, 2014
My six year old son loves this game. We have a lot of fun playing it together as a family. Just like I remembered it!
April 24, 2014 A2R83XSXK123CV
This is played like a traditional board game, where you roll the dice and advance your player. You get pulled forward or pushed back based on where you land. To add to this, you are constructing a complex mouse trap on top of the board at the same time, one piece at a time. When conditions are right, you are able to run a round weight through the trap and possibly catch an opponent to make them lose the game. It's a fun game for everyone.
B. Peick "fun and work" A2R83XSXK123CV

5 The Dick and Jane Little Red Wagon
11 7, 2013
We have started a new tradition of giving our nieces and nephews what we call "The Dick and Jane Little Red Wagon" as a present on their third birthdays. Call it nostalgia, or whatever. Unfortunately, we had a very difficult time finding this particular model. We were adamant about finding a metal one, you know, the one from the Dick and Jane readers of our youth. We were able to find one at Walmart, but it had to be ordered and wouldn't arrive until the following Friday. We would need to pick it up at the store and then assemble it. When telling a friend about this, she suggested ordering it from Amazon, which should be re-named, Amazin', because we were able to get the exact same model at the same price, and have it shipped directly to the birthday boy's house! Plus, no delivery charge, no tax and it arrived in two days,instead of 5! From now on, Amazon will be the first place I look.

3 The stuff dreams are made of...
12 6, 2013
It has the classic look ... it makes people smile when I walk by with my grandchildren riding in the back. But...Sadly it is like so many things that have declined in value and quality over the years. My brothers and I kicked the heckout of a tougher version, riding, racing and crashing until the red paint had faded and the name was scratched off. Ourswas made in Chicago and was built to take a good lickin'.The new version from China bends the first time you put a load in it. This wagon will need to be treated gently or it won'tlast long. The deck in mine already has pings in it like hail marks on the roof of a car. Perhaps we will make a nicenostalgia garden, planting flowers in the back this coming spring. If you're big on memories there is a smaller versionavailable that will sit safely on a shelf out of harms way. :)
December 17, 2013 AO3KNUMWMAHFT
Check with the manufacturer. I had it shipped directly to my nephew's home, so I didn't see the box.

3 Not For Active Toddlers
05 1, 2012
This tent is easy to construct and holds togethers very well for the price. But I quickly discovered it was designed for younger, less active children than my 15 month old. First, she put all her toys into it and started pushing it over with one of her push cars, that seemed innocent enough, but before long she was in it herself pushing the walls and rolling around the playroom as if she was inside a giant gerbil ball. Foreseeable misuse? She also enjoyed pulling the poles out, so that she could wave them around and poke at things. If she could, my toddler would give this product five stars and title her review, "Great Fun," but from a mommy's perspective, it was not safe. We had to take it down.

4 Great play tent fits in very small bag
06 8, 2010
I bought this tent to take to the beach for my 8 month old. The bag it comes in is so small that I thought, at first, that the tent may be too small for my baby. The tent is a great size for an 8 month old and even a little larger. It's very durable and is great for the beach, except that, when your baby isn't in it, you need to put something in it to keep it from blowing away. The assembly was very easy for my husband who has assemble tents before, but I found it a bit more difficult. I would recommend that you face the solid purple tent side in the direction of the sun as the shear sides don't provide shade. The first day we used it on the beach, I ended up draping our beach towels over the side to shield my napping baby from the sun. Overall, I am VERY happy with my purchase of this tent. I think it is value priced, and it fits back into its very small back with ease.

3 Good Purchase
05 29, 2014
I used this during Memorial weekend at the beach. Overall I like the product. It was a little challenging to put the tent up by myself, but I was able to do it with some frustration. When the baby wasn't in it, I had to put something in the tent so it wouldn't blow away. Keep in mind it wasn't that windy. I like the fact the tent was very light to throw into a bag. I will be bringing this when I go to Lake Tahoe since it doesn't take a lot of space in the luggage and it's not heavy at all, I do hate that there is no padding on the bottom of the tent. I had a blanket that I used before laying the baby down, I'll prob look for a soft mat or something so the baby is more comfortable. Can't beat the price though. Oh, I was able to be in the tent with my bsby. She also fell asleep in the tent. How to Host a Murder: The Last Train from Paris
B00000IVSX

Agatha Christie mysteries have nothing on this Decipher 9 game of international murder and intrigue.... This now-famous role-playing game for adults can turn an average dinner party into dinner theater. Food isn't required, though, and costumes can add to the sense of play. All that is needed is one host and seven guests to become character-murder suspects on a train from Paris on June 13, 1940. The trip has already been completely organized with a host as guide, secret clues, guest invitations, player manuals, a cassette tape with murder details--even name tags and a diagram of the murder scene. Now that's travel planning! (Not recommended for children under 16)Lynne Sampson--

July 1, 2014 A2C13JCQ0NRSL
open-ended
Is there a good place to break for dinner? Or can one of the four rounds be played while dining?
July 1, 2014 A3G8QCSF61HF1X
All rounds can be played while dining. That being said I always serve appetizers and play the first round. At the end of round one I serve dinner and we play round two while we eat. Then I serve dessert after round two or three depending on how people are feeling. So we eat through the whole game, eating as we play. We have done 6 of these and it always works great!
Andrea LeMahieu A3G8QCSF61HF1X
5 My favorite mystery so far
10 1, 2012
I have hosted many murder mysteries and The Last Train From Paris is my favorite by far. I have hosted it 3 times with different sets of friends. During one party no one was able to guess the murderer and during each of the other two parties one of the guests had the murder figured out by the second round. A great mystery and highly recommended for some fabulous fun!
July 3, 2014 A1BY2F67KG4S45
you can continue to play during dinner, just be aware that everyone is hearing the clues at the table. It seems daunting but after a few times you will get the hang of it!Warning: the solution requires sharp attention to detail!
Peggy Holbrook A1BY2F67KG4S45
4 Family reunion: Georgia on my mind
09 25, 2002
Our nuclear family reunion in Helen, Georgia featured the last train from Paris this year. We were able to incorporate the children as servers and cooks, so everyone felt they were participating. (8 adults, 5 children). It was very fun and convuluted enough to be challenging but yet not impossible. We all had a great time and would recommend it.
July 6, 2014 A2PFCO5ON4N2UP
Either off the first two rounds are conducive to playing while you eat. Our taking a break between the rounds works as well. After the first two rounds the situation can get tense and breaking for dinner might be more of an interruption.
Charles S. Holzheimer "durnik150" A2PFCO5ON4N2UP
5 One of the best Murders they have committed!
09 3, 2002
I won't go into great detail on the game structure other than to say it is great for parties and requires 8 people to play. We traditionally have a "Murder" each New Years Eve. These games are not really meant to be educational but using the leetle grey cells to follow the clues is a mentally challenging activity. Reusing an episode is really not feasible since the mystery is solved at the end and it doesn't change at all with replaying. I have reused these episodes with new sets of friends and just sit back and watch.This adventure is situated on a train leaving Nazi occupied Paris. The characters are great and the mystery is actually one that can be solved. This is one of the few HTHAMs that gives you a fighting chance to solve the mystery.If you are looking for a great evening of mystery and fun with friends, this is the game (and the episode) for you.
September 29, 2014 A1X0LVN6HA2L25
open-ended

September 30, 2014 A2SPTRHAHES3T9

Step2 Push Around Buggy (Red)
B00000IZEM

When it's time to go outside for a bit of fresh air and exercise, the Push Around Buggy from Step2 i...s ready to roll. Just slip baby in the generous molded seat, hook up the seat belt, grab the handle, and go! While you actually steer, baby can pretend to drive (and can even start the fun with a nifty ignition key). When there's an obstacle in the way or a friend passing by, baby can honk the horn. The buggy rolls smoothly and surely on four oversize poly wheels. A small trunk in the front can hold a few travel items. Both durable and fun, this sweet red and blue Push Around Buggy is a winner. The extra-long handle is removable and can be stored underneath the buggy.--N. Mered

B00000J50W

A high quality introduction to the joy of music. Anyone can play - just slide a songsheet under the... strings and pluck the string around each printed note. It's that easy. Made of quality hardwoods. "Oppenheim Toy Portfolio" Platinum Winner

November 16, 2013 APGFPTYTCGO18
open-ended
what songs are featured
November 16, 2013 A2E79CIBPNYMOC
The Fox and the Goose, Lazy Mary, Oats Peas Beans, The Animal Fair, Little White Duck, Tom Tom the Piper's Son, Bingo, The Alphabet Song, A Tisket A Tasket, Song of the Fishes, Mister Frog Went A-Courting, and There was a Crooked Man. There are additional sets available from this supplier and ones for other brands should work. You can design your own, too. Note that there are no sharps or flats.

5 A Family Tradition

I would highly recommend this for an individual with simple musical talents.

How is the zither different from the lap harp?
July 18, 2014 A3FR08A4PCH33E
A zither has a portion of strings with frets while the lap harp has only strings. The zither has a lot more strings as well.
Anja Cheatham "Bohemia" A3FR08A4PCH33E

July 18, 2014 A2DL61Q3YPXBJ5
I'm no pro, but it looks like most zithers are more complex and lean more toward the autograph, without the buttons and vary in their more advanced features. This lap harp is much more basic and could be for casual use, or beginner.
Amazon Customer A2DL61Q3YPXBJ5
5 Good Simple Instrument
02 27, 2014
Not for a professional gig, but it's playable. But, realize you have to learn how to tool it, even if it were tune prior to shipping. Any string e x instrument will quickly go out of tun e u until it is broken in. One of the sheets describes which strings should be turned to which note. You need any reasonable means to tune it, be it an electronic tuner, a keyboard, or reference tones off the internet. This is one of those things you have to learn to do for any string instrument. By the way, when tuning the peg will sometimes get to a position where it will seem that you can't properly get the tool on it. The tool has the same opening on the other end, only rotated, so you sound use the opposite end of the tool if you when you run into this situation...probably buried in the instructions somewhere. Happy harping... and look for their song book for addition music templates... No need to learn to read music, if you don't want to.
November 26, 2013 ADLVFA9OVMR14
open-ended
In what country are these harps made in?
November 27, 2013 A31CXEZDNUT3OF
According to actual product "lap-harp" website there are 2 versions. The Music Maker and The Melody Harp. Music Maker is made in Belarus. Melody Harp is made in Romania. Here is their website: http://www.lap-harp.com/faqs.htm
The Busy Bee A31CXEZDNUT3OF
3 Difficult to tune, so keep wires in check!
09 30, 2008
I received this harp many years ago as a gift for Christmas. I loved it then, and had many happy hours learning how to play the different songs that are provided,It is very easy to learn for children and once you have the basics of "tune" a child naturally starts to play music by memory and adapt other songs to the melodious harp on their own. You can also buy extra songs of different categories (Christmas, Christian, Folk, etc.)The only caveat I see with this lap harp - is unfortunately a very problematic one. The strings on the harp are looped, and so two notes share one string (see picture) - Making it very difficult to keep the harp in tune for longEX: Tightening one side can change the other, and thereby changing both notes. Only a few years into having it as a child, I lost the "tuning key" and was completely unable to tune it thereafter. [A wrench, pliers, etc strip the small studs]I found my harp again in pristine condition from whence it was packed all these years, and it is still horribly out of tune. I will have to buy a tuning key from a music store - after a second try with pliers stripped the pegs yet again. Different tuning keys for different harps - not one fits all, so I discovered.I recommend the harp if you can KEEP your tuning key, or are adept at keeping it in tune easily. It is a wonderful learning tool, and fun musical instrument that is different than most.ADDENDUM: Years ago as a child when the tuning key was lost, and internet was not an option - I did not know that there are stores and websites that sell accessories such as extra tuning keys and even Master Key Pitch pipes. After realizing how many people have read this review - I found a website to answer questions about the Music Maker Harp, as well as provide the accessories you need if a piece is lost or it goes out of tune![...]Hope this helps!!
Hopscotch Play Carpets
B00001OHEQ

Everybody knows kids get into manias, where they have to play the same game over and over, be it ja...cks, marbles, or... hopscotch. The only problem with hopscotch is that it's subject to the whims of the weather gods. But with this indoor/outdoor hopscotch mat, kids can hop from 1 to 10 any time they please. At 83 by 25 inches, the thing is as generously sized as one you'd draw on the sidewalk, and with its red, blue, orange, and green squares of washable polyester, it's twice as colorful. The set even includes a couple of stuffed markers, for equal opportunity hopping: one's a boy and one's a girl.--Claire Dederer

Kings in the Corner Game
B00004SDBL

Here's a fittingly regal version of the classic card game of royal sequencing, accentuated with a d...urable plastic folding play tray and scoring chips. Players play cards, in descending order and alternating color, on any exposed card in the tray. The object is to get rid of all the cards in your hand. Haven't got a black queen to play on that red king, or a red seven for that black eight, Your Highness? Well, draw a card from the deck--and toss a chip into the royal treasury while you're at it! Get rid of all your cards and collect the pot--including one chip for every card remaining in opponents' hands. First to 100 wins. When it comes to fast-paced fun for your whole royal family, Kings in the Corner by Jax is wild!--Tony Mason

August 17, 2013 A2DK4K1D54RSC
yes/no
can two play this game?
August 17, 2013 A1U3DEVQF4Z8RI
Y
0.9981
Yes, you need two to four players. You cannot play by yourself. It's like Solitaire only with more players. My granddaughters play it with me - the youngest is seven, but I learned with my cousin and his wife who are my age (70's) There is just enough awareness needed to make it interesting. It was like eating peanuts, we kept playing more games. I had taught my granddaughters how to play Solitaire when they saw me playing it and so it was an easy transition to Kings in the Corner. Enjoy! Beth A.
Applegirl A1U3DEVQF4Z8RI
5 GREAT TO PLAY WITH MY GRANDDAUGHTERS!
04 19, 2013
I taught my granddaughters to play solitaire, so they caught on to Kings in the Corner easily. It's not hard to learn, but tests awareness enough to make it interesting. Some plays are right under your nose, but easily missed. Like eating peanuts, we like just one more game. A great game for families. Mom and Dad will like it, too.
August 17, 2013 A2QG69J18XIN24

Yes. My wife and I play frequently.

open-ended
In the game Kings in the corner do you meld lowest card in your hand or any card that can cause a consecitive run from your hand
March 27, 2014 A2GP64G6H7HZRY
You play as many cards that you can from your hand as well as moving cards from one stack to another. The object is to get rid of all the cards in your hand first.
A. Gift For You "lequeen" A2GP64G6H7HZRY
5 Card game player
12 12, 2013
It's a great game. Started playing it with friends and had to purchase it for myself. May purchase for friends too.
March 27, 2014 A1IAS09X3VTMX1
very similar to solitaire..you meld the runs in your hand.. and move cards from one stack to another..to get rid of all your cards before anyone else does..cards left in your hand count as points against you.

3 Card game for fun
12 20, 2013

October 15, 2013 A3KAAIZERBJS3P
open-ended
It says for 2-6 players, but it shows 8 card positions in the play tray ?
October 15, 2013 A2QG69J18XIN24
Those 8 positions are for the cards---not corresponding to the number of players you may have. My husband and I play all the time....but we also include my mother (3) and have played with 2 other couples(6). It's just a really quick, fun, competitive game. Very easy to play---lots of fun!
Patty Cook A2QG69J18XIN24
5 SUPER!
06 5, 2013
SO MUCH FUN! I'm going to buy a second game to keep in our RV! I highly recommend this for anyone who enjoys strategy and solitaire.
October 15, 2013 A1FMSM1NHYLG3T
You do not fill all eight positions to start. Just the 4 playing (side) positions. The corners are reserved for the Kings during play ( though a King maybe turned on the initial placement on the side). This king would be moved to the corner as part of a players initial play. The picture is misleading
scudly A1FMSM1NHYLG3T
4 Great Gift
05 20, 2013
Made a great gift for the 9 and 11 year old Grand children. The game is right down their ally at these ages.
October 15, 2013 A3F1MDXJGJK0HY
The play tray is like your board game. That is where all the action takes place. It doesn't pertain to the number of players.
Ninja650R A3F1MDXJGJK0HY
5 Great Fun and easy to set up
08 9, 2013
I like the plastic set-up piece. I got it to play with my grandchildren and it helps them keep the cards in order.
October 15, 2013 A272GQHGY4YFC0
4-5 players works best. The card positions are the "playing board" - you play off the cards that are dealt to you. If you are familiar with solitare, you can understand this game. It does require some luck and strategy to be the winner.
Marilyn Mongiello A272GQHGY4YFC0
5 Ageless Card Game
05 10, 2013
Our family has been playing this game for generations. If you know how to play solitare it helps but is not necessary. Have taught the Grandkids and they love it.
October 15, 2013 A3KMLVMC0F8IRR
The play tray holds the "runs", but does not control the number of players. Each player can place cards in any of the card positions - PROVIDED HE/SHE HAS THE CORRECT CARDS! ;-)
Mountaingirl A3KMLVMC0F8IRR
4 Ratings
09 14, 2013
Didn't buy ANY of these items to rate them. Just enjoying all of them. Would not have bought them if I didn't see value in them!
October 15, 2013 A2NN8K10QXSLQB
4 of those card positions are for the kings and 4 are for the play cards. If I understand the rules correctly only the dealer puts in the four starting cards then each person takes their turns playing the card positions. Not all 6 players put cards in the card positions at the same tme. It just around the table to each player who then makes the moves on the card positions.
Henrietta Myers "media mania" A2NN8K10QXSLQB
5 love it
04 14, 2013
Easy to play for the two of us. Easy to store. Everything in one box. Enjoyable for two never played with more.
October 15, 2013 A1U3DEVQF4Z8RI
Four slots are for the four kings whenever they are drawn. The other four slots are for playing lower suit cards until the top card in the stack can be played on a king or other stack. The cards are played high to low, black on red or red on black like Solitaire. The challenge for me is not to miss an opportunity for a play. You must consider the cards in your hand as well as the stacks in the play tray. I have missed chances right under my nose! It's a simple game with just enough challenge so that it is not boring.
Applegirl A1U3DEVQF4Z8RI
5 GREAT TO PLAY WITH MY GRANDDAUGHTERS!
04 19, 2013
I taught my granddaughters to play solitaire, so they caught on to Kings in the Corner easily. It's not hard to learn, but tests awareness enough to make it interesting. Some plays are right under your nose, but easily missed. Like eating peanuts, we like just one more game. A great game for families. Mom and Dad will like it, too.
October 16, 2013 A13VDWCTH6LUMR
There are eight card positions because each player does not have a particular position that is theirs to play alone. All positions are used by all the players to play the cards in their hand.
B. A. Hill A13VDWCTH6LUMR
3 You don't really need this set to play the game
07 22, 2013
The blue plastic card display holder is really not necessary to play the game, and we don't even use it. The instructions are good, but you can find them on the internet. All you really need is a deck of cards and some pennies or chips to play the game.

September 28, 2013 A1U3DEVQF4Z8RI
Kings In the Corner is almost Solitaire except that there is more than one player. It is simple; I play it with my granddaughters, ages 7 to 14. The trick is to be alert to opportunities for matching the cards. It is definitely low stress for adults, great if you want something simple while you snack and enjoy conversation. You play several rounds to get enough points to win. Good luck!
Applegirl A1U3DEVQF4Z8RI

Bruder Toys Roadmax Garbage Truck
B00004U3E4

Pretending to do the work of adults is a favorite pastime of toddlers everywhere. With a realistic ...rear trash container and a front cab that opens and closes, this sturdy Roadmax Garbage Truck makes it easy for little ones to take on the role of the local garbage collector. Sporting bright primary colors and oversize components with smooth edges to prevent cuts and bruises, the garbage truck is made of durable plastic and measures approximately 16.5 inches long and 9.5 inches high. The truck comes with a separate trash bin that can be attached to the hand-powered lift on the back of the truck and then dumped into the trash container. Once it's full, the truck driver can lift the container and unload its contents at the dump. Equipped with treaded rubber tires, the truck's front cab can be opened and closed and is big enough to hold up to two action figures (sold separately). Other Roadmax vehicles are sold separately.--Chris Burns

December 2, 2014 AOB6AH8731Z79
open-ended
Is this too "babyish" and basic for a 3 year old? Should I go with one of Bruder's other more realistic garbage trucks instead?
December 2, 2014 A8T50F26UNL5U
No it is not too babyish. Kids that age are very hard on toys, and this Bruder Garbage Truck is very durable. I bought it for my grandson when he was 2 yrs, he's now 4 yrs and plays with it as much as he did in the beginning. His cousin has the larger "more realistic" garbage truck, firetruck, dumptruck etc. and they have to be put away when the 4 year old comes to play. I would say at least 5 yrs before you go with the more realistic larger Bruder Trucks.
C130 A8T50F26UNL5U

Dirt Devil Junior Lights Sounds Upright Toy Vacuum Cleaner
B000050B3H

Little tykes who like to play pretend can clean the floors with this scaled-down Dirt Devil vacuum.... Standing 28 inches tall, it's a lightweight plastic vacuum cleaner with a pivoting handle and wheels that glide across any smooth surface. Push a button and the base lights up, while the motor kicks in to make a revving sound. It takes three AA batteries (included) to create the light and sound, but with or without batteries, this is a likely hit amongst the tidy crowd.--Lauren Bernard

does this set come with paint thinner
October 19, 2014 A1E23YTGHD2RD6
Y
0.9945
Yes it does but you may want to consider getting a larger container to fill it up when you run out. You would be surprised how fast paint thinner disappears especially when using several different colors and brushes that are different sizes that use more paint and paint thinner to keep clean.

Step2 Naturally Playful Sandbox
B00005U8TE

This contemporary sandbox holds up to 200 lbs of sand, and is styled to match your existing backyard... landscapes. With a stone and sun motif, the Naturally Playful® Sandbox includes a convenient cover for protection from weather and pes, has molded-in "cornerstones" for seating, and can even double as a planter, lily pond, or fountain.

May 26, 2014 A3VCZ9RJ0PXY73
open-ended
What is the size of the sandbox?
May 26, 2014 A28LM7Z1GU4E8R
Exterior is 48" x 38 ". The interior is about 44 x 37" and angled at the corners for the seats. We've had ours for years and it's held up super well. It's in the sun about half the day and that might help how it's worn. But kids and dogs have climbed on the lid (I try to keep them off) and no cracks yet. The seats are more for me and although small, are tolerable for a while. Was just out in ours yesterday with 2 grandkids. I like ours much better than the ones you usually see and it fits with our sandstone-type brick work we have here.
Amazon fan A28LM7Z1GU4E8R

08 11, 2009

Kidoozie Funtime Tractor
B000063JQJ

Kidoozie is where the fun begins! From our proven, award-winning top sellers to our great, new selec...tions, these high quality, innovative toys provide years of playtime fun!

January 2, 2014 A21UY3RA87ZMGQ
open-ended
how big is the tractor?
January 3, 2014 A2QYOFAZTDBYVV
It's about 15.5 inches long, including the wagon, which does not detach. It's 5.5 inches wide and 7 inches tall. The picture doesn't show, but there's an arch above the tractor, right behind the driver, that you can use like a handle to pick up the whole thing. The wagon and the tractor articulate sideways, but when you pick it off the ground it stays level. This was a hit. My son still loves it almost two years later.
Josigata A2QYOFAZTDBYVV
4 Cute but loud!
01 3, 2013
My 18mo loves this thing. He loves the animal noises and sings along with the farmer. The tractor is very cute and looks well-made. This picture doesn't show, but it has a "handle" over the middle part that can be used to pick the whole thing up and move it. The wagon part articulates but does not come apart. The wheels are rubberized and don't scratch my floors.I would give it five stars if it had an on/off switch or, even better, a volume button. We put a piece of tape over the speaker holes, and that did the trick just fine - brought the volume down to a good level.
January 3, 2014 A1OD1IYO9O8X7H
The box size is 17.7X6.3X7.5 inch, so the tractor is about this size.

BA Smart Shop R ""Makada"" AHPUOJ8G2HSHR
5 Versitle, Exciting, Durable, Realistic Old MacDonald Farm Animals Toy with Song and Sounds!
12 18, 2013
This Funtime Tractor is the "cat's meow" for any young child who loves and knows the song, "Old MacDonald Had a Farm". Our grandson learned the song and now yells out E-I-E-I-O, asking for the videos on the I-phone or brings us his Old MacDonald books to read. At 22 months, he can sing the whole song and picks which animal we sing about. This toy was the best gift for him! He loves every feature about it. Push down the farmer, and the "Old MacDonald" sings an Old MacDonald verse, which is a catchy tune, well done. Push down on each animal in the wagon and each animal sounds off, recordings of real animal sounds. The farmer and animals can be removed for independent play and are well-made chunky sized for little hands. Push the orange smoke stack and the tractor moves forward until you push it again for the brakes (which sound real!) or the tractor soon comes to a halt itself. Push on the tractor horn and it has a realistic honk.Our 22 month old grandson loves this toy, hasn't tired of it, and it's holding up well, durable for use with lots of hands-on and drops by preschoolers. The tractor and wagon are connected and don't fall apart. I truly recommend this for any young child who loves Old MacDonald or farm animals. I must say that the animals are sometimes difficult to pull up out of their positions tightly held in the wagon that make them sound off, but our grandson is learning to pull harder, or get help from us, saying "Cock-a-doodle do stuck! Help!" This is an educational toy for imaginative play, recognizing the various animals and their sounds and the famous song.
February 19, 2014 A3MF3680ESN63M
The figures should have come with the tractor and trailer.
Sooz A3MF3680ESN63M

YES I have replaced the batteries to make sure that it is not the problem.I am ordering this toy again because it broke. I 'have' to order again because it is my 14 mos. old grandsons favorite toy. I should contact the company because it is only about one month old. I thought it would last longer than that. At first I thought it was the batteries so I replaced them with new. It still didn't work. Disappointing...... Nothing plays and the wheels don't go around. WHEN IT WORKS.......it is a great toy. I am also ordering the John Deer tractor as a backup. 5 The hit of Christmas morning!
01 14, 2014
This toy was a huge success on Christmas morning! It was the most played with toy of the day! We were very happy grandparents to have been able to pick a truly fun, and educational toy for our grandchild.
Cranium Cariboo
B000063XO3

Taking a step away from trivia questions and clay sculpting, the makers of Cranium have instead crea...ted a game for teaching wee ones a few colors, shapes, numbers, and letters. (And, if you know 3- to 6-year-olds that won't lose all the included cards and balls, they may also learn sharing, cooperation, and imaginative play.) The bottom of the box houses the game itself, with three chutes along the top that the balls are dropped into and three rows of flip-up panels that are decorated with various colored objects. Players draw cards, match them to a panel, flip up the panel, and hope there is a ball underneath it. Once all six balls are recovered a treasure chest pops open and gameplay can begin anew.--Pam Lauer

March 25, 2014 A1L1ECE0BXJ1DY
open-ended
For what age is it appropriate?
March 25, 2014 A2LUF8TP0LDY15
3 and up...very fun to play in various ways
Fei Wang A2LUF8TP0LDY15
5 very good
08 15, 2013
it was supposed to be used for teaching 3 yr old son's game playing and alphabetics and numbers, but he was very interested in playing the balls and the treasure box alone. Anyway, well designed game!
March 25, 2014 A3NNVJZDNRV6N5
This game is great for ages 3 and up. My kids loved this game and it grows nicely with them. Initially it's matching shapes or colors. As they get bigger, its more complex matching. It's easy, quick, doesn't take a lot of skill or strategy. Lots of fun and not painful for parents to play either!
J. George A3NNVJZDNRV6N5
5 Great Game
11 5, 2008
We got this game as a Christmas Present. We now drag it where ever we go! My kids LOVE this game. It's fun for kids and adults. My kids are 5 3, they both can play - which is great at this age. It's very education, has been fairly durable, although we have had some issues with a door breaking (It was an easy fix however). My kids BEG to play this game and we've had hours of fun. I highly recommend this game. Makes a great birthday or christmas gift. We've had it for over a year and it's still a big hit
March 26, 2014 AB4UNTODK74NC
The game if played as is, would be appropriate for young children through maybe 7 or 8. Older, depending on the developmental age and ability of of the child. I have modified it by making my own cards for the doors (a simple word template and import your own pictures, numbers, categories, etc.) so it works for older kids.

B0000658L5

Tarik. T A2YXWENP814QLI
5 Great one for the toddlers.
12 16, 2013
At first, i was disappointed my son (he was just about 18 months at the time) didn't really take to this toy. But a few weeks later he was using it all the time. We have used it to help learn about colors and shapes. the only thing this train is missing is a way for the toddler to tug it. (they love tugging) so I secured a shoelace to the bottom of the engine piece and the other end of the shoe string to a large wooden bead my wife had lying around the house. Now our son really likes this toy as he enjoys tugging it behind him from room to room.High quality wood, paint and finish. Melissa and Doug have done it again!
January 10, 2014 A3L5LG1FHJVVD2
No...there is not a recall on this, nor does the paint chip off. The only problems i've had is that the glue that holds the posts on and the wheels on, is very weak and within a few playings, it all falls apart.
Heather Trefethren "trefy04" A3L5LG1FHJVVD2

January 10, 2014 AREOC3C9WSI74

open-ended
Do the tracks for the other Melissa & Doug train sets work with this?
February 24, 2014 A1AUNFWZCB1IRR
No, I don't think it will. I haven't tried it personally, but the Thomas trains (which we have) are supposed to work with the M&D; tracks, and this train is much wider than the Thomas or other similar trains. Each block is about 1.75-2 inches wide, making the wheels at least 2 in apart, too big for those tracks.
JWil A1AUNFWZCB1IRR

Lauri Toddler Tote
B00006JBKT

This assortment of toys may be used in several ways to entertain little ones and help them learn. In... addition to having fun with basic pegging and puzzle-making, they will learn about shapes, colors and numbers. Kids can even use the crepe rubber puzzle pieces to make up a fun story.

December 15, 2013 A3RJEXG2TZ7KCF
open-ended
Are these foam, as one review says, or are they real rubber? We try to avoid foam toys. Thanks!
December 15, 2013 A2INDFVXX1L37U
They are foam but they are pretty sturdy. We've had ours for 2 years now and my son went through a phase where he would bite them all the time. I've never had them tear or break. He's been pretty rough on them and they've held up really well over the last 2 years. I definitely recommend.
JP A2INDFVXX1L37U
5 Great product!
12 7, 2013
These are great! Got it for my child when he turned 2 and he still loves them at 3. They are lights so they go in the diaper bag and can easily be washed, which is nice for a kid who puts everything in his mouth.
January 15, 2014 A2BWFAKXWWM38N
open-ended
Would this be a good airplane toy for a 15mo old? I'm worried she might be too young to play with or be interested in it...
January 15, 2014 A30YGP17UUE1TJ
My grandson was 22 months old. We used the squares and cutouts on the plane but not the pegs. We used the pegs in the hotel room though. Just remember that things that come apart can be dropped and 'lost' under the seat, especially if they like to throw things! Not sure if it was worth the money. The best toy we found was Bucky. It is a turtle that has buckles all over it. That kept him very entertained. We were way overpacked with toys. Our grandson loved looking out the window and we planned it so he played like crazy at the airport and fell asleep after taking off.

Melissa & Doug Primary Lacing Beads
B00006JZCR

30 wooden beads with oversized holes teach children hand-eye coordination and color recognition. Co...nvenient wooden case makes clean up and storage a cinch.

December 10, 2013 A31XF2NWJUQVRJ
open-ended
are strings or laces includes?
December 10, 2013 A32XJ77JNG4UKY
Yes there are laces included. The quality is fantastic.
Shani A32XJ77JNG4UKY
5 Beautiful Collection of Beads.
10 5, 2013
I was so pleased by the quality of this collection of wood beads. Beautiful colors, easy for little ones to lace and sort.
December 11, 2013 A3S5RW2OAPDM5X
Yes. My only objection to the laces (there are two) is that they (1) do not have anything on the end to stop the progress of the bead and (2) have aglets (the stiff end of the lace) that are too small and too short. Young or disabled hands have trouble dealing with those two issues.
Donna "Donna June" A3S5RW2OAPDM5X
1 Too Many Problems
08 27, 2013
I gave this as a gift to an 88 year old who has been developmentally disabled as a result of encephalitis. There are very few educational toys that she can enjoy and when we found that she loved the Alex Toys "String a Farm" and "String a Treat" toys so much that she nearly wore them out, we opted to try this one.Big mistake. (1) There is nothing on one end of the lace to stop the bead from just sliding right on off. The Alex Toys versions have a built in, secured "end" to stop the beads when they are strung. (2) The "aglets" (the end of the string that you poke through the bead) on this toy are too small and too short for clumsy fingers to get all the way through the bead easily. The aglets on the Alex Toys versions are thick and long enough to make it easy to thread them through the beads. (They feature the aglets prominently in their packaging, for just that reason.) (3) The inside of the beads are unfinished, causing the thread to catch and frustrate the person using them to no end (if they weren't frustrated enough!I normally love Melissa and Doug products, but I can't recommend this one, at least not for individuals who struggle with this kind of dexterity anyway. An alternative product is Alex Toys various versions.ALEX Toys - Early Learning String My Abc'S -Little Hands 1487
December 11, 2013 A3MZVR7ZM4ZNL3
Yes, there are two strings included. The beads can be stacked for building and added to blocks. Counted. Sorted by shape and color. A great creative toy.
Dianne Martin A3MZVR7ZM4ZNL3
5 Fun and challenging
10 11, 2013
Just what I was looking for to help develop fine motor skills. The beads can be used as blocks and sorting also.
December 12, 2013 A3SE49YW4G92A
yes, 2 long thick cords, 1 red, 1 green. My grandson really didn't use the beads to string, he liked to stack them and knock them down. He is three now, and still likes to do that.
Christine Martinez "chris,rn" A3SE49YW4G92A
5 Good quality toy.
11 8, 2013
I bought these for my grandson his first Christmas,and he is now 3, and really enjoys stacking them up and knocking them over. A fun way to learn colors, shapes, and sorting.
July 13, 2014 AWVSI3GUNIO94
open-ended

July 13, 2014 A2YOBK1M648KPY
I can't answer. I gave this as a gift, but I think it was large,like maybe a quarter of a inch.

?
0.9102
Well, yes. But, some "users" have a problem with the end of the string - the aglet - not being long enough to feed through the beads. If hands are clumsy, it is difficult to feed it through and catch it on the other side before you drop it.

Christine Wesley A1NIVQOOW99WEL
3 Great set but....
08 22, 2013
This is a great set and helps improve fine motor skills. I do have a few complaints, however. First, the inside of the beads is not sanded which can make it difficult for the little ones to get the string thoroughly the block. To compensate for this they made the whole in the blocks bigger, which brings me to problem number two. The holes are to big in the blocks. Even if you tie a knot in the end of the string the locks still slide off the end. Problem number three is the case. It works alright, but it doesn't hold the blocks in very well when you want to put them up.

B00007FY4H

5 Swimming!
01 23, 2013

March 17, 2013 A347W8AVC0IQ2T
One other comment: I saw the post from the person who said they killed themselves blowing it up. Floats these days have a valve that you have to pinch when you're blowing them up. If you're not doing it right, yes, you're going to bust a gut trying to blow it up. If you're pinching it right, it should only take a few minutes at most.

Peg Perego John Deere Farm Tractor and Trailer
B00015MFXO

Your 2-4 year old will help you get those hauling projects going with this chain driven pedal tracto...r with matching trailer. A built-in dashboard with gauges lets your little worker keep an eye on the instruments while operating the controls. Large tractor wheels make it easy for your child to ride on any terrain. Let him harvest a few tomatoes or take a load of mulch out to the flowerbeds. Whatever task you set, it's sure to be more fun with this child-sized John Deere tractor and matching trailer.

October 2, 2014 AUVUTAC87UL1X
Y
0.9814

Lisa "twin_mommy_in_CA" AUVUTAC87UL1X
3 Not what I would expect from Peg Perego
06 9, 2013
I am disappointed in this tractor. The plastic wheels slip on everything, and overall this toy is extremely cheap and flimsy. There is a measly 11-lb weight limit on the trailer, though I would not trust more than 5 lbs. The trailer is is constantly coming apart from the base - it doesn't attach securely to the pegs and so is merely held on by gravity. How lame is that? Do I really need to patch a Peg Perego toy together with Super Glue? I feel cheated. True, this toy is not as expensive as some Peg Perego products, but I would prefer they make a quality product and charge me more than sell this weak product under their brand name known for quality. Not anymore, I guess.On the flip side, it does look cute, and my son likes it, even though it frustrates him by constantly falling apart and having the wheels slip on nearly every surface. I had to take sandpaper and cut grooves with Xacto blades to the wheels for added grip. Which actually now work fairly well. If you have a spare 2-3 hours to do this, and what busy mom of three doesn't, by all means try it.
October 9, 2014 A27TB7SJHL9GAL
Y
0.9814
yes

Bruder Toys Caterpillar Excavator
B00024QOUO

This 1:16 scale replica of a Caterpillar Excavator is just like the real thing! Realistic details in...clude individually linked tracks for real movement and sound, an easy-to-use shovel arm with removable bucket that is operated with a handle, a cab that rotates 360 and a hood that opens to reveal the ventilator grill. There are even some included rubber inserts that attach to the tracks to give them grip on slippery surfaces like tile or linoleum.

1 Cheap and not durable!!!
02 15, 2014
I bought this for my son as a gift a while ago thinking he would actually be able to play with it in the sand or dirt. The only good thing I can say about this product is that it looks nice out of the box, but looks can be deceiving so don’t’ be fooled by the pictures or appearance of this toy excavator.Everything is made of thin cheap plastic that breaks very easily. Within a day one of the tracks came off and broke. At first I was able to snap it back together, but after two days the plastic broke completely. Then the base of the tracks and the top of the excavator separated and could not be fixed. My son ended up just playing with the top part of the toy and then the bucket teeth broke and the plastic hydraulic bars broke off. IT LASTED LESS THAN A WEEK AND WENT INTO THE TRASH!!! JUNK!!! This “toy” is not meant to be played with by any child.

2 Expensive and flimsy
04 20, 2014
This toy is very cool looking and, from its appearance, should provide lots of fun for kids. However, it is very flimsy and, considering the number of moving parts, will probably not hold up for very long. Additionally, there are no instructions about how to make any of the moving parts work, which means that kids will force them and break them through no fault of their own. It wouldn't cost much to add a few lines about how to make the arm go up and down or move the other parts.Pretty disappointing, in general, considering the price.
December 7, 2013 A3BS683N8LJN0B
open-ended
what size is this
December 7, 2013 A15AVGVEW07H9J
The main section of this excavator is about 11 inches long and 7.5 inches wide. With the boom of the shovel fully extended the entire unit is almost 2 feet long. The toy is 1/16th scale. It's larger than you might think. Just look at the handle on top of the boom. You can fit an adult size hand in that handle alone. It's an impressive toy.
Rev1216 A15AVGVEW07H9J
5 Very Nice
12 3, 2013
I bought this excavator for my 5 year old boy and he loves it. Its much larger than I expected and very high quality. The shovel does swing 360 degrees and the bucket moves and extends in a realistic fashion. The tracks move easily and it rolls smoothly even on carpet. The cab door does not open, and to put a guy in the seat, you have to shove him through the window space. This frustrates my 5 year old somewhat. The engine compartment does open. This is a very nice toy and if you are planning on letting your child use it in the sand, there are lots of little places that sand will get into and probably never come out. My boy has no trouble working the digger but we use it to scoop blocks and marbles not dirt. It's just too nice to mess up. One major positive is that there is no real small pieces to lose or break.
December 7, 2013 AHBDMJF9CAZO6
I don't have it at my house to measure because I bought it for my grandson, but it is a good size. It isn't a small toy. Sorry I could not be more help.
Linda T "Loves books" AHBDMJF9CAZO6

Olga Esquivel-Holman A27FCFKRJSHVYZ
4 Lovely
03 11, 2013

August 25, 2014 A1NE4PW6H38X49

Dangerous Dan A1NE4PW6H38X49
5 a wonderful globe!
10 2, 2013
I purchased this as a gift for someone but I had to assemble it first. After reading other reviews of misaligned holes making assembly difficult, I decided I would do the hard work before giving it as a gift. This item was packaged nicely in one box. Everything was individually wrapped and damage free. A lot of work went into shipping this globe so that it would not be damaged, I was honestly expecting to receive a squashed globe that looked more like an earthly helmet but it was packaged absolutely wonderful which is important to me. Assembly was easy and only took about 15 minutes. There was no discrepancy with holes lining up, it was simply easy to put together. The finished product is both functional and acts like a piece of fine furniture so I kept it for myself and used a gift card for the person it was suppose to go to. In any event, I love this globe, the meridians and equator line up exactly as their suppose to, the color is very distinct and rich looking, the ridges representing mountain ranges are a nice feature and make the globe a workable and functioning product. I can't say anything bad about this globe and believe me, I scrutinize everything. If you're in need of a classy globe at an affordable price, you won't be disappointed with this one.
October 8, 2014 AD47T5I4OFSLW
open-ended

October 8, 2014 APRXNCLUFUPWF

December 18, 2013 A2TJSYH4UN3H2R
open-ended
How tall is this?
Lord Galderon A2TJSYH4UN3H2R
4 Made For a Great Chirstmas Gift
02 12, 2014
I bought this globe for my dad for Christmas. Good globes that are reasonably priced are actually pretty hard to find. I searched various other sites including the National Geographic store, but either the globes had poor reviews, or were extremely expensive. This globe is the perfect price and had good reviews, so I purchased it, and I am happy I did.The Good:-Delivery was fast and efficient. Someone said the globe comes in a giant box the size of a large oven. That wasn't the case for me. Maybe a microwave oven sized box, if that. The one drawback I had with delivery is that I marked this item as a gift on amazon, yet it still came with large 'GLOBE' markings on the box. Amazon refunded me $20 for this inconvenience.-Very easy to put together. All holes are pre-drilled and everything screws in easily. I think all I needed was a phillips head screwdriver. The whole process from opening the box to full assembly took about 15 minutes-Size. The globe and stand are a nice size. The stand is a little over 3' tall. The unit fits nicely in a small or medium size office and isn't too bulkyThe Bad:-The globe itself is a little cheap. The equator has a gold band around it that is basically a laminate sticker that looks like it can easily peel off. And the globe itself is very light and the build quality in general isn't the best. I only took off one star for this though, because it is still a decent globe, and the way it sits flush in the stand and smoothly rotates is very nice.Overall I recommend this globe for a gift or for yourself. It is a nice decorative item and can be educational too. My dad says he takes little breaks from his work to look at the globe and relax. It should be mentioned that the print is somewhat small. He mentions he uses a magnifying glass to look at cities, but I can't fault the globe for this because almost all have small print, and he has bad eyes.
July 20, 2014 A37N08NM1LKDHO
open-ended
Is the map current, up to date?
July 20, 2014 A1NE4PW6H38X49
Yes! Now, I'm not a geographical major of any sort but after scrutiny and close examination, it appears to be current. I do anticipate some global changes in the near future IE; Ukrain & Middle East but that's not an anomaly by any means, so you must accept the fact that any Globe purchase comes with the risk of becoming outdated or even obsolete as the world turns, so to speak. If you check the manufacturers website, it appears as though quality control is a key component of their success, at least I was convinced. To sum it all up, I have been very pleased with my purchase as it is both functional and a nice (furniture) accessory. Best wishes... Yes! I do anticipate some global changes in the near future IE; Ukrain & Middle East but that's not an anomaly by any means, so you must accept the fact that any Globe purchase comes with the risk of becoming outdated or even obsolete as the world turns, so to speak. Nickels to Dimes Magic Trick
B0006GK9WM

A stack of four nickles doubles in value when it is transformed into four dimes. Change a stack of n...ickels into a stack of dimes! Or make the stack of nickels disappear! Or pass right through a solid table! Many effects possible- instructions for a number of effects included.

April 20, 2014 AZUB5R3PXMWZL

5 Great for Beginners
02 9, 2013
This was my first trick as a kid, and it's an easy one to learn. Most lower cost non-card tricks are made of cheap plastic, but this is made of actual metal, giving it a higher quality look and feel. I recommend this to anyone getting started in magic.

Revell 1:535 Uss Missouri Battleship
B0006I8POY

This battleship was the site of the Japanese surrender in World War II. Features: WWII configuration... including scout planes on catapults. Skill Level 2-requires paint and glue (not included).

February 2, 2014 A1620JHEOZ0WWQ
yes/no
If I am starting to build models , should I start with this one ? ( I'm 13 )
February 2, 2014 A1LNI288TM7ZB4
?
0.9162
It depends on a couple of things, like how much painting you want to do and how comfortable you are with painting and gluing small parts and details. If you've never built a model before, I'd start with something a little simpler, like Revell's P-51D Mustang, a famous WWII fighter, or their F-18 Hornet, both in 1:48 scale. Planes are much simpler, larger parts and fewer of them. The Missouri was fairly difficult, has a LOT of small parts and a lot of detail painting, plus rigging with thread for radio antenna and signal flags if you want. If you're inclined towards ships, a submarine or PT boat would be a better choice for starters. Revell also has a line of snap together models (SnapTite) that are good entry level models, have decals, and can be painted. Revell's website lists all their models, and has a "getting started" page that is helpful. Good Luck! It depends on a couple of things, like how much painting you want to do and how comfortable you are with painting and gluing small parts and details. If you've never built a model before, I'd start with something a little simpler, like Revell's P-51D Mustang, a famous WWII fighter, or their F-18 Hornet, both in 1:48 scale. Planes are much simpler, larger parts and fewer of them. The Missouri was fairly difficult, has a LOT of small parts and a lot of detail painting, plus rigging with thread for radio antenna and signal flags if you want. If you're inclined towards ships, a submarine or PT... » Read More It depends on a couple of things, like how much painting you want to do and how comfortable you are with painting and gluing small parts and details. If you've never built a model before, I'd start with something a little simpler, like Revell's P-51D Mustang, a famous WWII fighter, or their F-18 Hornet, both in 1:48 scale. Planes are much simpler, larger parts and fewer of them. The Missouri was fairly difficult, has a LOT of small parts and a lot of detail painting, plus rigging with thread for radio antenna and signal flags if you want. If you're inclined towards ships, a submarine or PT boat would be a better choice for starters. Revell also has a line of snap together models (SnapTite) that are good entry level models, have decals, and can be painted. Revell's website lists all their models, and has a "getting started" page that is helpful. Good Luck! « Show Less
Robert G Crane A1LNI288TM7ZB4
4 Great ship, OK model
05 31, 2012
I built one of the Revell USS Missouri models when I was a teenager, around 1957-59, and loved it. After watching the USS Iowa depart San Francisco on May 26 with my 11-year old grandson, it was time to do it again. We're almost done, and it we had a great time. I was somewhat disappointed in some aspects of the accuracy. For example, there is a single rudder, not two (the Iowa class battleships had two), and there are no propellers or shafts. The bottom is flat, and there is no below the waterline bulge at the bow. The paint scheme is also weird: below the waterline is red, and there is no black stripe separating the red from the gray freeboard. This is unlike every single picture I've seen of any of the Iowa-class battleships and unlike the picture of the completed model on the box. The barrels of all the guns are to be painted silver, also unlike the real thing. The quality of the model? Having assembled numerous Revell and Monogram models, I knew what to expect and was not disappointed. There seemed to be more flash than I remembered, but that was 50 years ago, and easy to trim. All in all, I recommend it if you want an inexpensive model of a great ship. Besides, it's just about the only show in town in that price range.
February 2, 2014 A2R7K6I0KODL85
?
0.7176
I started doing models when I was 12 and now I'm 15. This was an easy one and I think it's a good kit to start on.
Model Man A2R7K6I0KODL85
5 Revell USS Missouri
04 30, 2012
I received this kit as a gift for my birthday. At the time I had only built two other ships - the Arizona and Lionfish. When I was building the Arizona I had difficulty painting the deck tan which was my big fear about this kit. It didn't turn out to be as big a problem on this one. One of the nicest features of this kit is the one piece hull. The Missouri has around 70 parts so its a medium size kit. The deck was also one piece that just fit snugly over the hull. Overall, the kit is pretty well designed and easy to construct. The big issue for me was the painting. For the deck I just painted it tan and then with a smaller brush went over all the details in gray. The only problem with that is the gray doesn't match the gray of the polystyrene so you should probably paint everything gray first. Also the decal on the stern looks kind of goofy. I've never been on the Missouri or seen pictures of the stern so I don't know if the decal is accurate. It looks too big and lopsided, but like I said I don't know. Overall, it was a fairly good kit for the price, but it's not super detailed or museum quality so if you're looking for something along those lines don't get this model.
February 2, 2014 A323PBTV8YKUX8
Y
0.9875
it's as good as any I like it I have it oh a counter like on displayed it just that the stickers aren't my favorite I rather have the paint they used to have with them
RICHARD A323PBTV8YKUX8
5 5 stars
01 30, 2014
i liked the boat it was fun to build but i was hoping the paint came with it so that the bottom could be painted that red color
March 8, 2014 A1A7UTZ90OJ768
?
0.6236
This would be a good start and take your time, follow the directions that come with the model and you will gain a lot of experience with this one!
Kenneth A. Cook "Gothic Rogue" A1A7UTZ90OJ768
5 USS Missouri Battleship
10 30, 2012
I bought this or received it as a Christmas present back in the early days, late 50's and I spent a lot of time building this model. I already had model building experience so I knew what was going to take place. If I didn't have the tools, glue and paint it would never been finished! Cleaning all the excess plasic and junk was first, then parts that had to move were checked so they would move! A lot of detail went in the process before things were put together! I watched the tv series Victory at Sea and got a lot of clues what needed to be painted! Basically painting is a option, Battleship gray was the primary colors on most everything except the main deck! Painting the 16" guns, ack ack guns, 40mm guns, the 2 planes was and still is personal preference! Testors was the best paint to use and as far as the glue, a good styrene glue worked the best! Check the pictures that you can find on Google and you will know for sure what was painted anything except battleship gray! I had a total of 45 models, USS Mo, 1st Atomic Sub nautilus, 4 tanks, 1 190 mm cannon on 2 heavy trucks for light Atomic weapons that the military never used, but spent billions to build them and the rest was jets of all kinds, DC-3, DC-8, B-36 bomber, B-17, B-24, B-29 and the USS Enterprise from Star Trek! If you don't have the patience, the will, the right tools, GIVE IT UP!
May 11, 2014 A6R9N5JTD6WJZ
open-ended
im 13 is this a good ship to start with
May 11, 2014 AXGBM5VHR19UY
I don't know the answer to that as I purchased it as a secret Santa for a 11 year old boy but my husband who was in the Navy thought it would be perfect.

1 Seriously, the instrustions are very poor
08 4, 2012
If you buy this product, it will tell you where to paint. but they wont color it for you.When i bought this, I thought they already colored the instrustion booklet so I can get an idea where to correctly paint. Sadly, this is a piece of Junk and if you buy this you would have to waste your time online painting the battleship the correct colors that the real battleship would be.
May 12, 2014 A1LNI288TM7ZB4
If you think you're going to build a lot if models, you might want to start with something easier just for practice. Most fighter planes and a few boats like PT 109 are simpler but still a lot of fun. It takes a while to figure out how to paint small things and straight lines and how to keep from getting glue on your fingers. The Missouri model is fairly complicated with a lots and lots of small parts: the main guns and turrets, ten 5" gun turrets, and twenty 40 mm anti-aircraft turrets, plus assorted antennas and rigging, all of which need painting and gluing! On the plus side, all the parts fit pretty well with very little trimming needed, the instructions are decent, and even without paint it still looks like one of the most awesome battleships ever built. If you think you're going to build a lot if models, you might want to start with something easier just for practice. Most fighter planes and a few boats like PT 109 are simpler but still a lot of fun. It takes a while to figure out how to paint small things and straight lines and how to keep from getting glue on your fingers. The Missouri model is fairly complicated with a lots and lots of small parts: the main guns and turrets, ten 5" gun turrets, and twenty 40 mm anti-aircraft turrets, plus assorted antennas and rigging, all of which need painting and gluing! On the plus side, all... » Read More If you think you're going to build a lot if models, you might want to start with something easier just for practice. Most fighter planes and a few boats like PT 109 are simpler but still a lot of fun. It takes a while to figure out how to paint small things and straight lines and how to keep from getting glue on your fingers. The Missouri model is fairly complicated with a lots and lots of small parts: the main guns and turrets, ten 5" gun turrets, and twenty 40 mm anti-aircraft turrets, plus assorted antennas and rigging, all of which need painting and gluing! On the plus side, all the parts fit pretty well with very little trimming needed, the instructions are decent, and even without paint it still looks like one of the most awesome battleships ever built. « Show Less

4 Great ship, OK model
05 31, 2012
I built one of the Revell USS Missouri models when I was a teenager, around 1957-59, and loved it. After watching the USS Iowa depart San Francisco on May 26 with my 11-year old grandson, it was time to do it again. We're almost done, and it we had a great time. I was somewhat disappointed in some aspects of the accuracy. For example, there is a single rudder, not two (the Iowa class battleships had two), and there are no propellers or shafts. The bottom is flat, and there is no below the waterline bulge at the bow. The paint scheme is also weird: below the waterline is red, and there is no black stripe separating the red from the gray freeboard. This is unlike every single picture I've seen of any of the Iowa-class battleships and unlike the picture of the completed model on the box. The barrels of all the guns are to be painted silver, also unlike the real thing. The quality of the model? Having assembled numerous Revell and Monogram models, I knew what to expect and was not disappointed. There seemed to be more flash than I remembered, but that was 50 years ago, and easy to trim. All in all, I recommend it if you want an inexpensive model of a great ship. Besides, it's just about the only show in town in that price range.

May 13, 2014 A29KQVFADE3FTN
Yes. This would be a good starter model for a 13 yo. The trickiest part is at the end applying the decals.You have to have a bowl of warm water to soak them in before applying (use your index finger). Also, usethin black thread for the rigging. Let the glue dry completely before applying the the signal flags (my son and I were able to spell out " US VICTORY " ). It's these sorts of details that make a model look cool in theend. Eventually, when you get more proficient, You might want to try airplanes. Revell does a much better job with airplanes but they're more complicated so get your father to help you. Good luck ! Yes. It's these sorts of details that make a model look cool in theend. Eventually, when you get more proficient, You might want to try airplanes. Revell does a much better job with airplanes but... » Read More Yes. This would be a good starter model for a 13 yo. Eventually, when you get more proficient, You might want to try airplanes. Revell does a much better job with airplanes but they're more complicated so get your father to help you. Good luck ! « Show Less

Kenneth A. Cook "Gothic Rogue" A1A7UTZ90OJ768
5 USS Missouri Battleship
10 30, 2012
I bought this or received it as a Christmas present back in the early days, late 50's and I spent a lot of time building this model. I already had model building experience so I knew what was going to take place. If I didn't have the tools, glue and paint it would never been finished! Cleaning all the excess plasic and junk was first, then parts that had to move were checked so they would move! A lot of detail went in the process before things were put together! I watched the tv series Victory at Sea and got a lot of clues what needed to be painted! Basically painting is a option, Battleship gray was the primary colors on most everything except the main deck! Painting the 16" guns, ack ack guns, 40mm guns, the 2 planes was and still is personal preference! Testors was the best paint to use and as far as the glue, a good styrene glue worked the best! Check the pictures that you can find on Google and you will know for sure what was painted anything except battleship gray! I had a total of 45 models, USS Mo, 1st Atomic Sub nautilus, 4 tanks, 1 190 mm cannon on 2 heavy trucks for light Atomic weapons that the military never used, but spent billions to build them and the rest was jets of all kinds, DC-3, DC-8, B-36 bomber, B-17, B-24, B-29 and the USS Enterprise from Star Trek! If you don't have the patience, the will, the right tools, GIVE IT UP!
September 15, 2014 A2515IKVOYQ4DF

September 15, 2014 A12B203CDL7ZOA
No it is just a plastic display model.

05 21, 2014

But I highly doubt that because this plastic model is too light. If you put a motor in it, you would probably sink the ship.

Mr. Nguyen A36LUDS8NZZFV3
4 Good But Needed Improvement
11 11, 2013
I bought the Revell USS Missouri a little over than two months ago, and I just finished building it, which took me like six days. Basically, all the parts are very small, so you have to be very careful not to break the delicate plastics. The ship model length is approximately twenty inches long, and the detail of the kit is extremely basic; thus if you want further details I would recommend to buy the 1/350 scale from other manufacturers such as Taniya. I hope in the future Revell will develop a bigger model kit of this historical battleship as the Trumpeter has recently released a 1/200 USS Missouri. When I have the budget, I'll definitely purchase the 1/200 one.
September 4, 2014 A2OOQW6CAYTYHB
If you want it to look like a real ship YES I painted mine and it looks great, but if you just want a toy to play with do what you want, but why get it if your not prepared to do a nice job and make it look like the real thing. That is what modeling is.Don't get started doing things half way it is a bad habit to break always do the best you can at what ever you start and you'll never go wrong.
kennybygod "Kenneth L Dunn" A2OOQW6CAYTYHB
1 Poor model of a great ship
01 28, 2013
I don't normaly build battelship as I love building tallships sailing ships of the line. They seem to be more detaled, but I got this mainly because of the price and It is just what you pay for. Very poor model and very little detail. Could not recomand this model to anyone over ten years. It is a shame this ship desirves to have a better model than this one, but you get what you pay for. Best services did a great job getting the model to me and they can't be held responsible for the model. So I killed a few days doing this that is about all I can say for it. Get a larger scale and spend a little more don't wast your money on this one.

?
0.8714
There are some small parts that would probably break off, but for the most part it should stay together fairly well. Quite honestly, it all really depends on how well it's put together and what kind of cement and paint is used.
Model Man A2R7K6I0KODL85
5 Revell USS Missouri
04 30, 2012
I received this kit as a gift for my birthday. At the time I had only built two other ships - the Arizona and Lionfish. When I was building the Arizona I had difficulty painting the deck tan which was my big fear about this kit. It didn't turn out to be as big a problem on this one. One of the nicest features of this kit is the one piece hull. The Missouri has around 70 parts so its a medium size kit. The deck was also one piece that just fit snugly over the hull. Overall, the kit is pretty well designed and easy to construct. The big issue for me was the painting. For the deck I just painted it tan and then with a smaller brush went over all the details in gray. The only problem with that is the gray doesn't match the gray of the polystyrene so you should probably paint everything gray first. Also the decal on the stern looks kind of goofy. I've never been on the Missouri or seen pictures of the stern so I don't know if the decal is accurate. It looks too big and lopsided, but like I said I don't know. Overall, it was a fairly good kit for the price, but it's not super detailed or museum quality so if you're looking for something along those lines don't get this model.
May 12, 2014 A3TR1OAI4BZDZJ
?
0.9056
A plastic model is basically a showpiece. It's not to be played with as if it were a toy. In fact, keep it on high AWAY from kids. If you want a toy boat I'm sure you can find more than a few.
Ron Z A3TR1OAI4BZDZJ
4 Revell Still Going Strong
12 15, 2010
In 1953 and '54 I was privileged to command three American warships simultaneously. These were the aircraft carrier USS Franklin D. Roosevelt, the destroyer USS Sullivan and the battleship USS Missouri. I do believe I was the youngest naval officer at the time, being only 10 years of age.I took on the Japanese fleet in my bedroom. I accepted their surrender in 1955 aboard the USS Missouri which was stationed on my windowsill. Turning to the world's press I then announced to all: "These proceedings are now closed."I remember these Revell models so very well. It's been fifty years now, but I still remember deciding not to glue down the guns, allowing them to swivel.Assembly instructions ranged from easy to impossible. I remember using the picture on the box as an aid. When instructions were easy I enjoyed the work. When instructions got hairy I became upset. Time to yell, "Ma!" though I knew I shouldn't. I was supposed to do it myself."Slow down," she would tell me. "Do it right. Don't be in such a hurry to finish."I'm glad for the experience of building these models although I'm not exactly sure why it remains in my head. Treasured memories? Perhaps. Maybe something more: Often do I think about the guys who fought and died so that I could be a 10-year old engaging in my fantasies.Thank you, gentlemen. You are NEVER TO BE FORGOTTEN!
May 13, 2014 A22WM5C8FEM89Q
?
0.6200
Very.
Hippygeorge A22WM5C8FEM89Q
1 I don't like it.
12 20, 2011
This is very poor quality. Just about every single part needs trimming. Also to many items on the deck made it hard to get a nice wood paint job. Items are too small to mask off. Bigger items do not line up correctly. Assembled most of it with super glue so parts would not shift during dry time. Sorry I purchased it.

Y
0.9706
Yes it is very fragile model with small parts not a toy.

3 Problem with the parts!
12 30, 2012
I bought this model hoping that the quality would be as good as some Japanese models, but alas! It is not.A lot of the parts were broken,the plastic was barely molded,some parts did not click together,and I was missing a lot of parts.Maybe I just had a bad kit.
October 13, 2013 A1LNI288TM7ZB4
?
0.1657
No. There are no motors or even propellers. It is model that's really detailed and great for a static display, like on a bookshelf, but it has only a few working parts: the main turrets rotate and the main guns go up and down, and that's about it.
Robert G Crane A1LNI288TM7ZB4
4 Great ship, OK model
05 31, 2012
I built one of the Revell USS Missouri models when I was a teenager, around 1957-59, and loved it. After watching the USS Iowa depart San Francisco on May 26 with my 11-year old grandson, it was time to do it again. We're almost done, and it we had a great time. I was somewhat disappointed in some aspects of the accuracy. For example, there is a single rudder, not two (the Iowa class battleships had two), and there are no propellers or shafts. The bottom is flat, and there is no below the waterline bulge at the bow. The paint scheme is also weird: below the waterline is red, and there is no black stripe separating the red from the gray freeboard. This is unlike every single picture I've seen of any of the Iowa-class battleships and unlike the picture of the completed model on the box. The barrels of all the guns are to be painted silver, also unlike the real thing. The quality of the model? Having assembled numerous Revell and Monogram models, I knew what to expect and was not disappointed. There seemed to be more flash than I remembered, but that was 50 years ago, and easy to trim. All in all, I recommend it if you want an inexpensive model of a great ship. Besides, it's just about the only show in town in that price range.
October 13, 2013 A2R7K6I0KODL85
N
0.0680
No, it is a plastic model kit that is for show only.
Model Man A2R7K6I0KODL85
5 Revell USS Missouri
04 30, 2012
I received this kit as a gift for my birthday. At the time I had only built two other ships - the Arizona and Lionfish. When I was building the Arizona I had difficulty painting the deck tan which was my big fear about this kit. It didn't turn out to be as big a problem on this one. One of the nicest features of this kit is the one piece hull. The Missouri has around 70 parts so its a medium size kit. The deck was also one piece that just fit snugly over the hull. Overall, the kit is pretty well designed and easy to construct. The big issue for me was the painting. For the deck I just painted it tan and then with a smaller brush went over all the details in gray. The only problem with that is the gray doesn't match the gray of the polystyrene so you should probably paint everything gray first. Also the decal on the stern looks kind of goofy. I've never been on the Missouri or seen pictures of the stern so I don't know if the decal is accurate. It looks too big and lopsided, but like I said I don't know. Overall, it was a fairly good kit for the price, but it's not super detailed or museum quality so if you're looking for something along those lines don't get this model.
October 13, 2013 AQY433VCNNT0M
?
0.1364
Do not buy this, is not remote controled.Even you will have dificulties to assembly the cheap plastic pieces.
Richard Placencio "Richard Placencio" AQY433VCNNT0M
