kennybygod "Kenneth L Dunn" A2OOQW6CAYTYHB
1 Poor model of a great ship
01 28, 2013
I don't normaly build battelship as I love building tallships sailing ships of the line. They seem to be more detaled, but I got this mainly because of the price and It is just what you pay for. Very poor model and very little detail. Could not recomand this model to anyone over ten years. It is a shame this ship desirves to have a better model than this one, but you get what you pay for. Best services did a great job getting the model to me and they can't be held responsible for the model. So I killed a few days doing this that is about all I can say for it. Get a larger scale and spend a little more don't wast your money on this one.
November 7, 2013 A1A7UTZ90OJ768
?
0.5511
This is a Display only, build it out of supplied plastic parts yourself model of the USS Missouri!
Kenneth A. Cook "Gothic Rogue" A1A7UTZ90OJ768
5 USS Missouri Battleship
10 30, 2012
I bought this or received it as a Christmas present back in the early days, late 50's and I spent a lot of time building this model. I already had model building experience so I knew what was going to take place. If I didn't have the tools, glue and paint it would never been finished! Cleaning all the excess plasic and junk was first, then parts that had to move were checked so they would move! A lot of detail went in the process before things were put together! I watched the tv series Victory at Sea and got a lot of clues what needed to be painted! Basically painting is a option, Battleship gray was the primary colors on most everything except the main deck! Painting the 16" guns, ack ack guns, 40mm guns, the 2 planes was and still is personal preference! Testors was the best paint to use and as far as the glue, a good styrene glue worked the best! Check the pictures that you can find on Google and you will know for sure what was painted anything except battleship gray! I had a total of 45 models, USS Mo, 1st Atomic Sub nautilus, 4 tanks, 1 190 mm cannon on 2 heavy trucks for light Atomic weapons that the military never used, but spent billions to build them and the rest was jets of all kinds, DC-3, DC-8, B-36 bomber, B-17, B-24, B-29 and the USS Enterprise from Star Trek! If you don't have the patience, the will, the right tools, GIVE IT UP!
November 11, 2013 A2WFLJ748UH3VA
open-ended
where we can get the rigging?
November 11, 2013 A1LNI288TM7ZB4
I used thin black sewing thread, after I'd finished painting everything on the deck and before gluing the deck to the hull. I'd tie the thread around a piece of a toothpick then feed the thread up through the deck, then wrap it around its destination, like a cross tree or antenna, then secure it with a drop of glue. On the tower in front of the first smokestake there's a loop where 6 wires come up from the deck and meet, so for that I used a single thread that would go up from the deck, through the loop, over to the other side, down through the deck, over to the next hole and up through the loop. For the pennants I Googled "maritime pennants" and printed a bunch of tiny ones and spelled my grandson's name with them. I used thin black sewing thread, after I'd finished painting everything on the deck and before gluing the deck to the hull. I'd tie the thread around a piece of a toothpick then feed the thread up through the deck, then wrap it around its destination, like a cross tree or antenna, then secure it with a drop of glue. On the tower in front of the first smokestake there's a loop where 6 wires come up from the deck and meet, so for that I used a single thread that would go up from the deck, through the loop, over to the other side, down through the deck, over to the next hole and up through the... » Read More I used thin black sewing thread, after I'd finished painting everything on the deck and before gluing the deck to the hull. I'd tie the thread around a piece of a toothpick then feed the thread up through the deck, then wrap it around its destination, like a cross tree or antenna, then secure it with a drop of glue. On the tower in front of the first smokestake there's a loop where 6 wires come up from the deck and meet, so for that I used a single thread that would go up from the deck, through the loop, over to the other side, down through the deck, over to the next hole and up through the loop. For the pennants I Googled "maritime pennants" and printed a bunch of tiny ones and spelled my grandson's name with them. « Show Less
Robert G Crane A1LNI288TM7ZB4
4 Great ship, OK model
05 31, 2012
I built one of the Revell USS Missouri models when I was a teenager, around 1957-59, and loved it. After watching the USS Iowa depart San Francisco on May 26 with my 11-year old grandson, it was time to do it again. We're almost done, and it we had a great time. I was somewhat disappointed in some aspects of the accuracy. For example, there is a single rudder, not two (the Iowa class battleships had two), and there are no propellers or shafts. The bottom is flat, and there is no below the waterline bulge at the bow. The paint scheme is also weird: below the waterline is red, and there is no black stripe separating the red from the gray freeboard. This is unlike every single picture I've seen of any of the Iowa-class battleships and unlike the picture of the completed model on the box. The barrels of all the guns are to be painted silver, also unlike the real thing. The quality of the model? Having assembled numerous Revell and Monogram models, I knew what to expect and was not disappointed. There seemed to be more flash than I remembered, but that was 50 years ago, and easy to trim. All in all, I recommend it if you want an inexpensive model of a great ship. Besides, it's just about the only show in town in that price range.
November 27, 2013 A1A7UTZ90OJ768
There isn't any rigging with the kit. You will have to make your own rigging out of a thick thread and I don't remember if there is a diagram showing where its supposed to go! Might be something on the box! You might Google USS Missouri and maybe you can get information of the rigging in the pictures. Thread is a dust catcher and my recommendation is not to put any thread on the model, but personal preference is your choice!
Kenneth A. Cook "Gothic Rogue" A1A7UTZ90OJ768
5 USS Missouri Battleship
10 30, 2012
I bought this or received it as a Christmas present back in the early days, late 50's and I spent a lot of time building this model. I already had model building experience so I knew what was going to take place. If I didn't have the tools, glue and paint it would never been finished! I watched the tv series Victory at Sea and got a lot of clues what needed to be painted! Basically painting is a option, Battleship gray was the primary colors on most everything except the main deck! Painting the 16" guns, ack ack guns, 40mm guns, the 2 planes was and still is personal preference! Testors was the best paint to use and as far as the glue, a good styrene glue worked the best! Check the pictures that you can find on Google and you will know for sure what was painted anything except battleship gray! I had a total of 45 models, USS Mo, 1st Atomic Sub nautilus, 4 tanks, 1 190 mm cannon on 2 heavy trucks for light Atomic weapons that the military never used, but spent billions to build them and the rest was jets of all kinds, DC-3, DC-8, B-36 bomber, B-17, B-24, B-29 and the USS Enterprise from Star Trek! If you don't have the patience, the will, the right tools, GIVE IT UP!
Revell 1:48 B29 Superfortress
B0006JNS9A

The Superfortress was used extensively in the China/Burma/India theatre, the SW Pacific during WWII ...and later in the Korean conflict. Although it was used at low altitude over Japan, it was designed and built as a high altitude, long range strategic heavy bomber capable of carrying a 20,000 lb bomb payload. Defensive armament included 4 remotely controlled turrets, each utilizing two .50 caliber machine guns. Features: Bomb load, complete interior, Hamilton Standard hydromatic propellers. 1:48 Scale. Skill Level 2-requires paint and glue (not included).

September 9, 2013 A174CBCHZE366K
open-ended
What special paint is needed ? Aside from the basics.
Woodman "S.W.Aston" A174CBCHZE366K
3 Have some putty handy
09 17, 2013
Things were going well until it was time to join the fuselage together. The model is a big one and gaps were to be expected I suppose. Going to have to ruin a nice spray job now with the putty. Also, two absolutely useless cockpit floor panels included. Can't figure out what they're for. All in all it's okay I suppose. Just be prepared with the putty.

4 B 29 SUPERFORTRESS
02 7, 2014
THIS B 29 IS A HUGE MODEL. IT WILL TAKE A LOT SPACE ON YOUR SHELF. RIGHT NOW MY MODEL IS STILL ON THE TOP OF MY REFRIGERATOR WITH NO ROOM. THERE IS A LOT OF DETAILS INSIDE THE FUSELAGE INCLUDING PILOT /CO PILOT, BOMBERDIER, BOMB RACKS, TAIL GUNNER ETC. SO I TOOK PICTURES OF THE INSIDE FIRST BEFORE PUTTING IT TOGETHER. TOO BAD IT DIDNT COME WITH CLEAR FUSELAGE HALF TO SHOW ALL THE DETAILS. THIS WAS ONE OF MY MOST EXPENSIVE MODEL BUILD.

Hi Antonio, yes it does come with the A-bomb, actually two bombs one very similar to "big boy" and another one that I guess is "fat man", even has some decals for it and a cart to load the bomb, but it is not listed nor shown in any picture. It's a cool detail to find out.
KillerJoe A34LGN78XOSA90
5 beautiful and huge
01 19, 2013
Have to say I bought this model and wanted to take the time to build it as best as I could, then I found all the paint I needed. Well here is my review: The model is really detailed, be careful as there are really tiny stuff in the cockpit to be assembled and painted and also decals to work on it very tiny, but the result is so realistic, for instance you need to build the bomb release control on the bombers position. You also get twelve bombs, Little Boy and Fat Man are also included but for some I guess politically correct issue they don't sell this model as the Enola Gay (the one I wanted) but you get The Cream of the Crop, anyway, besides that other details comes from the crew's bedrooms, radio desk, and gunmen positions, it is awesome. It took me 10 days in a row to work it out, as painting process takes time and you need to go section by section.I used automotive spray aluminum paint to achieve a better finish on the fuselage and it really worked, no brush marks and even a more realistic look. I'll be uploading some pictures of the model once I get the Enola Gay's decals. It's a must have for collectors.
June 11, 2014 ARFXGM31UFLWI
?
0.6889
It comes with Fat man and little boy (Atomic Bombs). Or at least ones similar to it. I don't think that I have seen a bomb cart with it though.
Rob W. Phillips ARFXGM31UFLWI
5 B-29 Superfortress Review
06 21, 2014
I liked this kit. It has its flaws but will turn out to be a awesome model and one of your favorites. You can build two variants which is enough for me, Cream of the Crop and Humpin Honey. Don't worry there is no nudity in the decals if it will offend anyone. The interior detail is fine. The directions suggest little detail so you must come up with it on your own. The exterior detail is average for a large model. However this kit is so amazing because of its nice appeal and and smoothness. It is a giant! 25" by 35"! making it one of the biggest models I have ever built. I must hang it from my ceiling because I have no were else to put it! It is not very difficult actually it is fairly easy to build and paint. I was able to finish it in 3 weeks of non stop work. Comes with alot of custom pieces such as Atom bombs and crew. Overall I would rate it at a 4.5, but I will rate it at a 5 for Awesome looks.

5 GRANDPA AND GRANDSON WORKED ON THIS MODEL
06 2, 2013
My husband and grandson had a great time putting this model together. Patience is required working on models....no model is perfect, so don't give up. I read reviews that come from perfectionists that need every model to be just perfect for them to get any enjoyment out of it. Well, that's unreal....the idea is to enjoy working on a model. It's better to put it down when it gets frustrating and resume work later on. Overall this was a good-value product. Now we're looking for the next model to order from Amazon. We've ordered mostly "Revell", but there are other models out there.

I'll be uploading some pictures of the model once I get the Enola Gay's decals. It's a must have for collectors.
February 2, 2014 A1620JHEOZ0WWQ
yes/no
If I am starting to build models , should I start with this ( I'm 13 ) ?
February 2, 2014 A34LGN78XOSA90
Y
0.9781
I don't recommend that. Because the model is very beautiful and detailed, and you need to get the feel about how to organize the pieces, what to paint first, how to handle the crystal clear parts, when to paint and glue, and how to get the finishing an final assembly of the whole set. You can try first with a smaller model, with detailed painting, decals and clear parts, so you can acquire those skills and then go for the B52. Takes a lot of patience and well on my first model I glued the pieces before paint them and it was a huge mistake, just an example on my own experience. Good luck friend! I don't recommend that. Yes, I think you could start with the B29 Superfortress because it's a larger model than most, which makes it easier to deal with. Be patient while working on your first model...it takes manual dexterity and diligence to complete a model such as the B29 Superfortress. Then you can work on the B-17 next, which is smaller. Hope this helps.

?
0.8014
If I were you, I think I would start with a smaller model that is less complicated and less expensive and work your way up to this model so you can do a really good job, learn how to take your time and do it right the first time and have a model that you can be proud of.
Robert W. Brooks AFWH22U4JQY0S
5 A very big model.
07 10, 2013
I love it because it is hugh and just like it was described. I would recommend this item to anybody looking for a large plane model.
February 2, 2014 A3TPXS56ZGI3K2
?
0.5320
No, I would start with something much smaller not that it is too complicated necessarily but you probably be better off doing something that won't take as long and you can finish sooner and develop some skill and get used to the basics. I would do a bunch of small models first just to get some completed and finished so you can marvel at yourself. If things start going not so good which will happen it's better to go through more trials and tribulations so you can start over sooner. In short, no, get some experience because it sucks to be unhappy about the way things are going but stuck with a giant like this. I did it once with an aircraft carrier and was super frustrated and still had 1000 pieces left. Not fun. No, I would start with something much smaller not that it is too complicated necessarily but you probably be better off doing something that won't take as long and you can finish sooner and develop some skill and get used to the basics. I would do a bunch of small models first just to get some completed and finished so you can marvel at yourself. In short, no, get some experience because it sucks to be unhappy about the way things are going but stuck with... » Read More No, I would start with something much smaller not that it is too complicated necessarily but you probably be better off doing something that won't take as long and you can finish sooner and develop some skill and get used to the basics. I would do a bunch of small models first just to get some completed and finished so you can marvel at yourself. If things start going not so good which will happen it's better to go through more trials and tribulations so you can start over sooner. In short, no, get some experience because it sucks to be unhappy about the way things are going but stuck with a giant like this. I did it once with an aircraft carrier and was super frustrated and still had 1000 pieces left. Not fun. « Show Less
P. Martin A3TPXS56ZGI3K2

08 31, 2013

KillerJoe A34LGN78XOSA90
5 beautiful and huge
01 19, 2013
Have to say I bought this model and wanted to take the time to build it as best as I could, then I found all the paint I needed. Well here is my review: The model is really detailed, be careful as there are really tiny stuff in the cockpit to be assembled and painted and also decals to work on it very tiny, but the result is so realistic, for instance you need to build the bomb release control on the bombers position. You also get twelve bombs, Little Boy and Fat Man are also included but for some I guess politically correct issue they don't sell this model as the Enola Gay (the one I wanted) but you get The Cream of the Crop, anyway, besides that other details comes from the crew's bedrooms, radio desk, and gunmen positions, it is awesome. It took me 10 days in a row to work it out, as painting process takes time and you need to go section by section.I used automotive spray aluminum paint to achieve a better finish on the fuselage and it really worked, no brush marks and even a more realistic look. I'll be uploading some pictures of the model once I get the Enola Gay's decals. It's a must have for collectors.
July 16, 2013 A3BDEDB3INXPZR
Hello Marcelo. I'm sorry, but inks, paint color and paintbrush are not included with item. Try to find ink in amazon or local stores.
Orlando Fermin Pacheco A3BDEDB3INXPZR

Hot Stuff Super-T 1 oz HOTHST-7
B0006O3TO4

Super T MEDIUM gap-filling CA glue has a viscosity (200-300 cps), similar to syrup and is perfect fo...r gluing somewhat porous materials and pieces which have small gaps between them. Super T instant glue cures at a slower speed (10-25 seconds) than Hot Stuff. You can bond wood, metal, rubber, nitrile, composites like carbon fiber and Kevlar, many types of plastics, and more. To bond two parts together, apply the Super T CA glue to one part and accelerator to the other part, then push together and hold tightly for 30 seconds. Super T is Satellite City's most versatile CA glue, able to bond porous and non-porous materials with a good fit as well as fill gaps, which is why it is so popular. You don't have to be a professional to use Super T- it's perfect not only for recreational hobbies like model-building, but also for fixing all the little things that fall apart. In addition to bonding parts together, you can easily use Super T for a professional-quality finish and to repair damage to other finishes. We recommend using NCF Quick CA glue accelerator to speed up the cure time and ensure a complete cure of the bond. Accelerator is not always necessary when bonding materials, but it is a must-have when using Super T as a finish because it can take hours instead of seconds for CA glue to cure when it is sitting on a surface instead of being pressed between two parts. This item is a 1oz bottle of Super T.

February 21, 2014 A1NQ9TBIUHOCNX
open-ended
Does it work on ceramics
February 21, 2014 A3FJ35K4SN26YN
I have used Hot Stuff to repair ceramic figurines, ornaments, cups, plates, etc. I wouldn't trust using any coffee cup with the handle reattached just for the danger of hot coffee in your lap if the repair fails but it does work. This is the best super glue I have found and I have tried a lot of them. I find the "Gap Filling" Hot Stuff to be more versatile than the thinner "Original" type.
Mel Berman "Mel" A3FJ35K4SN26YN
5 The best Super Glue I have found.
11 9, 2013
The best Super Glue I have found. Beats all the other brands I have tried and I'm a glueing maniac.
February 26, 2014 AAYOIJFPPWOB6
I don't think so only because this adhesive is thin. It would be better to choose a thicker consistency CA for ceramics.
Ravenbiker "Ravenbiker" AAYOIJFPPWOB6
4 The product is the best but the bottle it comes in could be improved
06 28, 2013
This product is really good super-glue. It response well to "kicker" (the spray that near instantly dries it).The bottle is not made very well. The nozzle will slowly be snapped away because the glue dries inside the nozzle even with the cap securely on. By simply pricking the hole back open with a pin or nail is really not an option because this stuff dries really solid. I hammered a nail into it one time but eventually I can see the nozzle disappearing completely.

December 27, 2013 A2Y94KLURF84BE
open-ended
what is the best age?
December 27, 2013 A1RZ61JY5BFW09

D. R. Bender A1RZ61JY5BFW09
5 Lots of Laughter and Fun with the Stomp Rocket
12 11, 2013
I have never seen my grandchildren (ages 7 and almost 4) have so much fun with a toy! I thought they'd have to wait for warmer weather to play with it, but with the soft rockets, the Stomp Rocket can be used inside, especially in a long rec room. The two actually played together, with one aiming the rocket attached to the hose and the other jumping on the air "bladder." (No batteries!) They haven't tried the rocket yet using the stand outside. I warned my daughter to be sure they keep it away from the house and trees or they'll lose a lot of rockets.
December 27, 2013 A2EZWZ8MBEDOLN
My daughter is 6 and she loves it. I'm 46 and I love it ;)
Charlo A2EZWZ8MBEDOLN
5 Possibly the most fun you can buy for $15
12 17, 2013
This is a great toy if you have the space. I was a little sceptical about it's claim of flying 200+ feet in the air, but it does. The rockets need to be launched a few times before they really start to fly high- I can't explain why, but it seems to be the case. The rockets themselves are durable enough for the price, but the fins begin to get worn and torn over time. I've repaired mine a few times with scotch tape. They do sell replacement rockets but I haven't needed to go that route yet. The air bladder that you stomp on is very durable- even when adults stomp it. Smaller, lighter children will have a harder time launching the rockets because they simply don't have the mass to stomp down with much force. My 6 year old loves it. When we bring this to the park, all the other kids gravitate over and want to get in on the fun.
December 27, 2013 AD86VMD9FDSK6
I would say three and a half years old and up any younger than that they might have a balance issue as you have to stop on the Launcher. Fun toy
Cindy Shimko AD86VMD9FDSK6

No Batteries... outdoor fun, super easy to assemble and best of all I believe this is great for hand / eye coordination as he was catching the arrows after the 3rd or 4th try... AWESOME TOY !! even the adults had fun with this. Highly Recommend !!

30 Key Fancy Baby Grand
B0006PJOW4

Schoenhut's Fancy Baby Grand is beautifully designed with curved legs and an elegant style, yet extr...emely durable and sturdy. This piano is a great way to introduce a child to basic keyboard skills and musical concepts. Lovely chime-like tones are created by small hammers striking metal rods, the sound that makes Schoenhut toy pianos unique. The two and one-half octave span of full-width keys provides a good foundation for the transition to a larger model. Includes: Schoenhut's Learning System and bench. Schoenhut's Learning System, with its play-by-color assortment of songs, makes playing simple and fun. A removable, color-coordinated strip fits behind the keys to guide small fingers from chord to chord. The corresponding Songbook contains a collection of familiar tunes. This Learning System has been specially designed to build a child's confidence and develop basic playing skills.Weight 28 lbs Height_ 21Material WoodBench Dimensions 19 long x 20" wide x 21"

December 3, 2014 A2SAF22XA6NNMS
open-ended
Is it made of wood?
December 3, 2014 A46ZOWGJOKDGQ
yes, mostly wood, but the sound sucks.
J. Hill "pekasauruserex" A46ZOWGJOKDGQ
2 Tone is not at all musical, and out of tune
02 11, 2014
The piano looks nice, and is made reasonably well. The tone, however, is not at all musical. It sounds more like hitting a pan than like a musical instrument. We have many instruments for our son, and all of the others sound reasonably musical. The lowest note is out of tune quite a bit and some of the others are slightly out also. Chords sound terrible in any position. While a melody is recognizable when played, chords are not. We are quite dissapointed, and will only be buying musical instruments from brick and mortar locations so that we can try them out first. My son prefers other instruments to this one, even if they are out of tune, because the tone is unpleasant, and often downright irritating. I recommend an electric keyboard over this one so that you can get nice musical tones.
December 3, 2014 A346EW8GP8JRYU
Yes it is!

Intex Giant Bellows Foot Pump
B0007CNJ5Y

The Intex Giant Bellows Foot Pump lets you quickly inflate and deflate almost any inflatable device,... without the luxury of an electric pump and wall outlet. Its oversized design moves more air with fewer strokes, and the accordion hose has three nozzles to fit small, medium, and larger air valves. The pump measures 12 by 8.5 inches (W x H), and weighs just 2.1 pounds.When you're not at the lake or the pool, the pump also offers a handy way to create extra sleeping space at home.About Intex RecreationIntex Recreation makes above-ground swimming pools, air beds, inflatable toys, pool and lake boats, and the proprietary Intex Saltwater Pool System. The company has been in business for over 40 years, and is a global leader in designing and producing innovative products for indoor and outdoor recreation.Intex products meet the most stringent safety standards, undergoing intensive testing to ensure years of safety and satisfaction. During the manufacturing process, trained Intex employees continuously monitor a wide range of factors, including quality of raw materials, calibration of the machines, manufacture and assembly of each product, product testing, and careful packaging of every item.

July 14, 2014 A28NNZYPRWI5WN
open-ended
Can this be used to inflate beach balls and kiddy pools?
July 15, 2014 A3QJQSO4OH7SHZ
I suspect it might be able to inflate beach balls and kiddy pools as it comes with a small, medium and large air valve connector - so far we've only used it to inflate an air mattress for camping so I can't say definitively.
Kim A3QJQSO4OH7SHZ
4 Good pump for the price
08 21, 2013
Purchased this foot pump to inflate a queen size mattress that we bring camping with us. It worked fine. The hose is long enough to be attached to the mattress inside the tent while I stood outside the tent stepping on the bellows.It did not take an extraordinary amount of time to inflate the mattress. Did not have any problems with the nozzle coming out. When the mattress got near "extra firm" fullness, I did notice that I had to make sure I didn't miss a beat with stepping on the bellows or the air did seem to leak out a bit but that wasn't an issue for me. Please note that this is a large piece of equipment as indicated in the product specs but I knew this when I bought it and bought it because of its ability to push air into the mattress quicker than the smaller foot pump we already had. I did not use the deflating option so can't comment on that. Overall this meets my expectations.
July 15, 2014 ATM4U1M3LL7YF
You may need someone to hold the air hose nozzle while you press the foot pump. Im not sure if it will stay there on its own. With help I'm sure it will do the job.
pak ATM4U1M3LL7YF

04 12, 2014
Purchased for a science project, so it has taken a beating. I still is going strong, much better than other foot pumps I've had in the past.Sturdy construction.

open-ended
Can you use this foot pump or exercise balls
June 2, 2013 A2SYD5AC4N312E
I did not have much success filling stability (exercise) balls with this pump. It would fill the ball, but at the end it it was not strong enough to make the ball firm - the air would start leaking back through the pump. Went back to the hand pump that came with the ball.
NJITman A2SYD5AC4N312E
2 High Expectations - Big Disappointment
04 14, 2013
I bought this pump to replace the various hand pumps provided with stability balls. The hand pumps work and will definitely fill the ball until it is rigid, but you feel like you already completed a workout by the time you are done.So, I saw this foot pump and read the reviews and thought I had found the ultimate solution.WRONG!First, the pump is huge and the bellow is clumsy, it does not compress smoothly. You really have to stomp on it to get full air flow.Next, the nozzles are not long enough, not tapered enough and do not stay in the air inlet for the ball. So, you spend a bunch of time filling the ball, the nozzle falls out and you lose some of the precious air you just pumped in.Worst of all is the pump suffers from backflow when the air pressure inside the ball gets high, at the point when you are trying to get the ball rigid. Each time you pump, you hear the air leaking out of the tube (red fitting at the base) and back out of the bellow intake. I am going to try putting electrical tape around the tube connection to see if that helps, but my confidence is low.I only bought this to fill up stability balls while traveling, so I cannot speak to its ability to fill basketballs, inflatable mattresses, etc. I saw a review by someone wanting to fill a kayak and they had the same results - could not finish the job.I had considered a small electric pump, but the reviews for those stated that they were ineffective in finishing the job as well.I will continue my search. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this one.
June 2, 2013 A2QDTOUW81TEE
I tend to agree with the first answer: while these type of pumps are good for balloons and pool toys, there is no true resistance with those. They're not really designed for exercise balls or sports balls.
Mick D A2QDTOUW81TEE

Gregor J A12Z8CB8UL5D8S
4 Useful for air mattresses
08 6, 2011
I used this to inflate a one-person air mattress. Just for grins, I counted the number of breaths it took to blow it up and compared it to the number of foot presses with the bellows. I've forgotten the actual count, but the bellows took more cycles than it took breaths to fill it, but I didn't get lightheaded, and I got it filled faster because I didn't have to take breaks after every 10 breaths.

September 11, 2013 A30NV1XKOUDZA

Fredericton1234 A30NV1XKOUDZA
5 Great Puzzle
03 17, 2013
I've been doing puzzles since my mom took me to daycare, this is the largest puzzle I've completed to date (though I want to get the 24000 piece puzzle someday). This puzzle was very fun. Unlike a lot of puzzles that are one huge image, this is several images that can be worked on separately until its all done. I really like that there isn't a lot of fields of one colour. The space part is a little like that, but there is enough variety to keep it from being absolutely mind numbing. The tiniest gripe I have is that the pieces of the two halves are identically shaped, which lead to a few go backs realizing I had a slightly wrong colour piece in a spot. This wasn't a huge issue, but I like to see a complete variety. I started the puzzle on Feb 1st and completed it March 17th, so it consumed a good amount of time. I read complaints of missing pieces, and I will say that I had no missing pieces with mine.Highly recommended for any puzzle enthusiast!
September 11, 2013 A38QY5KZ81T218
It states that it is 76" x 54", which is 6'-4" x 4'-6". But you have to give it approximately 1/2 - 1" for cut and fit of puzzle and whether or not you are going to mount it. Still working on it.
Mark A. Visel "Mavrick" A38QY5KZ81T218

5 great size puzzle
12 9, 2013
love large puzzle , then this is what you need . it takes about 3 months to build and looks beautiful
August 4, 2015 A2LCC55IDNU57X
The dimensions of this puzzle are: 76" x 54" which is 6 feet 4 inches by 4 feet 8 inches or 193.04 cm by 137.16 cm. As for the question is it 4 times as large as a normal 1000 piece puzzle that is difficult to answer as 1000 piece puzzles vary in size by manufacturer. Ravensburger seems to go with a 27" x 20" size format for their 1000 piece puzzles, which would be 68.58 cm by 50.8 cm size. So using those dimensions 68.58 cm x 50.8 cm and multiplying by 4 it would be a puzzle bigger than this 9000 piece puzzle. So the puzzle piece sizes in this 9000 piece are smaller than a normal 1000 piece. All larger puzzles by Ravensburger ship with multiple bags, so in this case these are (2) 4500 piece bags and you can do the puzzle in 2 parts and then put those larger pieces together as a finishing touch. You could always elect to mix both bags together for the added challenge and put it together on one giant surface. The dimensions of this puzzle are: 76" x 54" which is 6 feet 4 inches by 4 feet 8 inches or 193.04 cm by 137.16 cm. So using those dimensions 68.58 cm x 50.8 cm and multiplying by 4 it would be a puzzle bigger than this 9000 piece puzzle. So the puzzle piece sizes in this 9000 piece are smaller... » Read More The dimensions of this puzzle are: 76" x 54" which is 6 feet 4 inches by 4 feet 8 inches or 193.04 cm by 137.16 cm. As for the question is it 4 times as large as a normal 1000 piece puzzle that is difficult to answer as 1000 piece puzzles vary in size by manufacturer. Ravensburger seems to go with a 27" x 20" size format for their 1000 piece puzzles, which would be 68.58 cm by 50.8 cm size. So using those dimensions 68.58 cm x 50.8 cm and multiplying by 4 it would be a puzzle bigger than this 9000 piece puzzle. So the puzzle piece sizes in this 9000 piece are smaller than a normal 1000 piece. All larger puzzles by Ravensburger ship with multiple bags, so in this case these are (2) 4500 piece bags and you can do the puzzle in 2 parts and then put those larger pieces together as a finishing touch. You could always elect to mix both bags together for the added challenge and put it together on one giant surface. « Show Less
Erik Pavelchak A2LCC55IDNU57X
5 Really awesome designed puzzle
04 8, 2013
I have NOT even opened the seal but once I finish the Ravensburger 3000 piece ancient globe map puzzle this is my next conquest. This has to be one of the most beautifully designed puzzles ever. The concept of making a puzzle about the zodiac signs to me would not have been really anything really special in my mind, but once I saw this I knew someone spent a lot of time thinking about how to lay this out in a very beautiful and intriquing manner. The detail is amazing and has numerous break points in which you can attack this puzzle. The innermost circle is a design of the solar system, with a black ring around it. Then there are the 12 unique zodiac symbols which are seperated into individual areas and are all encircled with a double black ring around it. Then there is a silver ring with the month ranges defining when during the calendar year each zodiac symbol covers. Next are the 12 seperated mini paintings of what the zodiac signs represent which are very colorful and detailed. Next there is a silver 12 sided circle that is offset that is acting as the top of the zodiac pictures. Then in each compartment is the name of each zodiac sign in big letters. Then there is the last ring which is another 12 sided circle that is flush to the top of the puzzle. Now we get into the astronomy aspect of the zodiac signs where they are all drawn out in the night sky with the zodiac symbol near them so people can identify them appropriately. Lastly there are 4 symbols in total each in a different corner that help separate out each quadrant. I completely agree this is worthy of getting framed and being put on your wall for all to see for it truly is a work of art. Kudos to Ravensburger for designing this and also to their attention to detail on the artwork. Additionally some people may say a puzzle is a puzzle there are no differences from one manufacturer to the next. That is by far a incorrect statement. Ravensburger pieces really are unique and you will not find yourself with 20 pieces that oddly enough all fit into the same space creating an additional layer of complexity for no reason. I highly recommend Ravensburger products and this puzzle very specifically. It would be cool if they brought back their out of print puzzle called "Tarot" that was 2000 pieces as that is another really interesting piece of artwork.
February 27, 2014 A3TGTRVL4FXCJD
open-ended
Why is Virgo spelled Vergo in this puzzle?
February 28, 2014 A3HHS8GFHF7E5P
The puzzle I have spells Virgo correctly - very strange that yours is incorrectly spelt - maybe you will have to look to the stars to answer this one!!

November 8, 2013 A1DJN4Z0Z6WW5W
We used a big fold out table and layed a piece of plywood on top. We built it in for sections. After each section was done we slid it one a bigger piece of plywood the is big enough for the whole puzzle and added each section to it. Once it was done we were going to take the big piece out side but could not get the plywood out the door. LOL Even tried to slant it to get it out, but the puzzle wanted to slide off the board. So we left it on the reckroom florr for a while and took pictures. Then we took it apart and sent it to some one else to have fun putting it together. Its a beautiful picture puzzle. Once it was done we were going to take the big piece out side but could not get the plywood out the door. LOL Even tried to slant it to get it out, but the puzzle wanted to slide off the board. So we left it on the reckroom florr for a while and took pictures. Then we took it apart and sent it to some one else to have fun putting it together. Its a beautiful... » Read More We used a big fold out table and layed a piece of plywood on top. We built it in for sections. After each section was done we slid it one a bigger piece of plywood the is big enough for the whole puzzle and added each section to it. Once it was done we were going to take the big piece out side but could not get the plywood out the door. LOL Even tried to slant it to get it out, but the puzzle wanted to slide off the board. So we left it on the reckroom florr for a while and took pictures. Then we took it apart and sent it to some one else to have fun putting it together. Its a beautiful picture puzzle. « Show Less
skybray A1DJN4Z0Z6WW5W
5 Great
03 13, 2013
I ordered this product for my mother in law, she likes to work on puzzles. This 9000 piece puzzle will keep her occupied for a while.
November 10, 2013 A38QY5KZ81T218
I took 2 pieces of 3/8" plywood and connected them side by side. Using the place where they connected as the center point. Left as least one foot on each side to help with space in order to put puzzle together. Sanded the whole board smooth, putting the puzzle together now and then glueing it down.
Mark A. Visel "Mavrick" A38QY5KZ81T218
5 Puzzles
07 20, 2009
I have done 100's of puzzles and again Ravenburger puzzles excel in quality. Each peice is beautiful and well defined. All that is needed now are more puzzles between 2000 and 9000 peices.
March 2, 2014 AH9GMD4XR2LMV
I used rigid foam insulation that comes in a 4x8 sheet... I cut notches in it to keep the pieces together (I couldn't get the whole sheet in my car) and added some extras along the long edge to make it deep enough. It was a 3/4 inch thick sheet
Nancy D Karrels AH9GMD4XR2LMV

Erik Pavelchak A2LCC55IDNU57X
5 Really awesome designed puzzle
04 8, 2013
I have NOT even opened the seal but once I finish the Ravensburger 3000 piece ancient globe map puzzle this is my next conquest. This has to be one of the most beautifully designed puzzles ever. The concept of making a puzzle about the zodiac signs to me would not have been really anything really special in my mind, but once I saw this I knew someone spent a lot of time thinking about how to lay this out in a very beautiful and intriquing manner. The detail is amazing and has numerous break points in which you can attack this puzzle. The innermost circle is a design of the solar system, with a black ring around it. Then there are the 12 unique zodiac symbols which are seperated into individual areas and are all encircled with a double black ring around it. Then there is a silver ring with the month ranges defining when during the calendar year each zodiac symbol covers. Next are the 12 seperated mini paintings of what the zodiac signs represent which are very colorful and detailed. Next there is a silver 12 sided circle that is offset that is acting as the top of the zodiac pictures. Then in each compartment is the name of each zodiac sign in big letters. Then there is the last ring which is another 12 sided circle that is flush to the top of the puzzle. Now we get into the astronomy aspect of the zodiac signs where they are all drawn out in the night sky with the zodiac symbol near them so people can identify them appropriately. Lastly there are 4 symbols in total each in a different corner that help separate out each quadrant. I completely agree this is worthy of getting framed and being put on your wall for all to see for it truly is a work of art. Kudos to Ravensburger for designing this and also to their attention to detail on the artwork. Additionally some people may say a puzzle is a puzzle there are no differences from one manufacturer to the next. That is by far a incorrect statement. Ravensburger pieces really are unique and you will not find yourself with 20 pieces that oddly enough all fit into the same space creating an additional layer of complexity for no reason. I highly recommend Ravensburger products and this puzzle very specifically. It would be cool if they brought back their out of print puzzle called "Tarot" that was 2000 pieces as that is another really interesting piece of artwork.
November 7, 2013 A3BRBQV4BGNZOF
Google the puzzles dimensions...
T. Duke A3BRBQV4BGNZOF
5 Awesome puzzle
05 8, 2013
It's an awesome puzzle, but mine came with a giant crack in the box, I returned it with no issues, but all Ravensburger puzzles are great, the pieces are best quality around, not that thin cardboard junk....

June 18, 2013 A3SKDDWQ4NX9IT

5 Exceeded Expectations! Great Starter Set
12 11, 2013
I was HIGHLY concerned with making this purchased, having read numerous negative reviews. I'm considering this a starter set for my 8 year old son, who shocked us with his Christmas list when he asked for a chess set. I wanted to by something nicer (wood) than a $5 plastic and cardboard set. I also didn't want to invest some $200 chess table with marble pieces only to have him be disinterested in chess in a month. This $30 to $40 price range seemed appropriate, but the negative reviews on virtually ever set on Amazon were disheartening.Needless to say I am glad I took the risk on this one. I'm not getting a $100 chess set for $35 but for $35 this far exceeded my expectations. The board is very nice, the pieces seem of decent quality and the wood checker pieces actually stack for "kinging"I think folks who have a problem with the quality of this product may want to consider what they paid for it...

4 For the price, this is an excellent toy!
03 12, 2013
I got this for my son's second birthday, almost a year and a half ago, and he's still entertained by it. The bubbles did work until the bottle ran out and we didn't bother refilling it, since I had read the reviews by others and figured I'd skip the irritation. He doesn't care anyhow! This little mower gives a pleasant and muted "mowing" sound when pushed and it's very sturdy. After over a year of using it, it's still in good condition, despite being left outside all the time in the rain, snow, and really hot summers. Colors haven't faded either! I'm impressed with the quality of this toy, especially for $20.

01 2, 2014

It was a Christmas gift and we had to keep it indoors without the bubbles attached, but it did a great job on the green carpet...hahaha. It made a great machine noise and the buttons on the top were solid and made great realistic noises. You could tell by pushing it that it was solid and the wheels were tight so that you didn't fly around with it, it was more slow and grinding in a way that made the child feel like he was really pushing a powerful machine. I loved it.
January 22, 2014 A2ELNSK33UOD3K
It comes with a little 4oz bottle of bubble solution...
Blue Jay A2ELNSK33UOD3K
5 THE BEST MOWER
01 15, 2014
Bought this for our 2yr old grandson for Christmas because he was obsessed with trying to push a real, heavy mower around (not on, of course). We snapped the toy together and wrapped it ready for use. Our grandson pulled the paper off, and with a HUGE smile proceeded to mow the floors in the house for well over an hour while the rest of the family unwrapped gifts. A neighbor had previously given him a mower that was yellow and played songs, but it was not realistic enough to be a substitute. This Fisher-Price model is visually true and even has a motor sound that starts when the tires move. We'll introduce the bubbles when it warms up outside. A great toy for a toddler!
January 23, 2014 A1JX590E7X2B9C
4 oz.
Debra Carroll A1JX590E7X2B9C

07 7, 2014

Clue DVD Game
B000B4SPX4

Clue has been a fiendishly clever board game for almost 60 years, and this DVD edition adds a whole ...new level of enjoyment to the deductive fun. Experienced Clue-doers will recognize the floor plan layout of the game board, as well as the cards and character pieces. What they might not recognize this time is the crime: The game's central intrigue has been downgraded from murder to a more family-friendly larceny. It's up to players to figure out which of Mr. Boddy's guests is the thief, which item was stolen, as well as the time and location of the theft. The enclosed DVD serves as game master, with animated butler and inspector characters prompting you with questions and/or doling out clues. It may seem like a gimmick at first, but there are several smart ways in which the DVD makes set-up a snap and games both fair and interesting.Aside from the bells and whistles, this is Clue. The object of the game is to gather clues without giving away too much information to the other players. Once you feel you've adequately sussed out the case, you can test your theory in secrecy through the DVD menu and the special decoder lens. If you're correct, you'll get a satisfying detective show round-up of how all the clues work together to eliminate all of the other possibilities. If you're wrong, you're going to have to show some of your info to the other players. There are ten different mysteries built into the game plus a general game that is more like the traditional Clue board game. It comes with game cards, decoder magnifying glass, DVD disc, game board, four plastic locks, case file envelope, and 10 suspect pawns.--Porter B. Hall

November 16, 2006 A2KRHPDAA1BHDU
open-ended
How do you play this? every time i play, the dvd always tells me to take a secret passage. i do, but where do you go on the game board?
July 19, 2014 A3LOXOMPX3ZPRK
Play the game like normal while the DVD just sits there and does nothing. Don't try to use the DVD, just keep playing the game. After 10 or 20 minutes the DVD will wake up and do something exciting. Then you continue playing like normal. Slowly, over the course of an hour, the DVD will enable more options that you can use.
Lawrence Brown "Larry Brown" A3LOXOMPX3ZPRK
3 It's nifty.
09 28, 2009
No review here really explains how to use this DVD system. As you can see, many reviewers (including this one) were confused by the operation of the DVD.It's important to note that the DVD does not drive the game or follow along with the game. The DVD does not track whose turn it is or where each player is on the board. When you first start the game the DVD will only light up two options: "use a secret passage" and "make an accusation." You won't be making accusations until near the end of the game, so the only options seems to be the secret passage and that's confusing all of us. The other options are all gray.I just spoke to HASBRO today and the lady mentioned that you may have to play 15 or 20 minutes before the DVD starts doing anything. You just play the board game like normal at first, you don't use the DVD at all after it instructs you how to setup the board and game play begins. After several turns you may use the DVD when you are in a room where you want to use a secret passage. The DVD may tell you that something unexpected happens while you are traversing the passage. Eventually after possibly 10s of minutes, the DVD may do something. The DVD works on a timer. The DVD senses how much time has passed and starts yielding the clues as time goes on. What will happen is that as the DVD just sits there on the options screen, seemingly doing nothing other than looping thru its music and watermark animation, it's actually counting time. It assumes that you are playing the Clue game just like normal. At some random time interval, the DVD will come to life and the inspector will say "I would like to see you right now." Then you can use the remote control to answer the inspector and he will play a clue for you. After that he may turn on one of the other options like "call the butler" and then you may start using that option. As the game progresses more of the options will become available.To answer some concerns that other reviewers have mentioned:It should be noted that a DVD is of limited intelligence. It's not a general purpose programming medium so it can't be as smart as a normal computer program. It was never intended to do anything as smart as play a game, so it's only clever programming that gets it to simulate the intelligence it needs. As such you shouldn't expect too much out of it.The 10 fixed cases in the Clue DVD game allow custom animation. For example, if Miss Scarlet stole the broach at midnight, a dramatic animated scene can be scripted such that Mr. Boddy tells of how Miss Scarlet tried on the broach and he knew that she was an incorrigible night owl. For this kind of content the fixed cases are a must. With a normal computer program it might be able to shuffle predetermined scenes or lines of dialog to match a random case, but the DVD is not that smart. So the fixed cases are a compromise of allowing nifty Clue scripts to be played at the expense of having a finite number of Clue cases on the DVD. The DVD also includes a random case but that's not going to feature the custom story line and animated snippets. It's going to be more generic.You could just play regular Clue with it, you don't have to use the DVD. Compared to Classic Clue it's a deluxe game with the cute dolls, 3D colorful game board, and the expanded possibilities. Compared to the standard Clue game this one is missing the weapons so that's too bad. If you don't like the expanded possibilities because it makes the game longer, just eliminate some cards at the start.
December 31, 2006 A2SU5BIY338Q98
open-ended
Item cards How do you get to see the item cards in the butler's pantry when you don't have that choice on the screen and are not allowed to visit the inspector? The direction book for this game is very confusing. Item cards How do you get to see the item cards in the butler's pantry when you don't have that choice on the screen and are not allowed to visit the inspector? The direction book for this... » Read More Item cards How do you get to see the item cards in the butler's pantry when you don't have that choice on the screen and are not allowed to visit the inspector? The direction book for this game is very confusing. « Show Less
July 19, 2014 A3LOXOMPX3ZPRK
You can't use that option to visit the inspector or view the butler's pantry until way into the game, like half an hour. Just play the game like normal and over the course of the hour long game the DVD will gradually reveal more and more options and clues.
Lawrence Brown "Larry Brown" A3LOXOMPX3ZPRK

09 28, 2009

As you can see, many reviewers (including this one) were confused by the operation of the DVD.It's important to note that the DVD does not drive the game or follow along with the game. 5 Zoob is the best building toy for young kids
12 17, 2010
I bought this set of ZOOB for my 5-year-old grandson because my 10-year-old grandson got this set a few years ago - he has played with it nearly every day since receiving it and still does. We have never had a broken piece; the pieces all fit nicely into the storage case, which is very sturdy; and the instruction/idea booklets that come with it are creative and for the most part easy to follow. My only complaint (pertaining to the set we've had for years) is that the purple latches on the storage box never stayed attached when the box is open and they are difficult even for me to unlatch from the closed position. I haven't examined the new set to see if this feature has changed but the picture looks the same. This is one of the best building toys I have ever seen.

Thumler's Tumbler 320 Plastic Tumbling Beads 1/2 lb(8 oz)
B000BUR98A

THT 320 Plastic Tumbling Beads...

July 19, 2013 A3T4ZOJQT3WDU3
open-ended
I want to tumbler little pieces of stained glass to use in mosaics. Looking at the lortone tumbler. Do i need beeds or grit to smooth the edges?
July 19, 2013 A2ELO2FQ428XEK
Sorry, I polish rocks exclusively, so I do not know.
cdrdi A2ELO2FQ428XEK
5 Works as Advertised and Per DIrections
10 4, 2012
I like the beads. They have the additional benefit of making the tumbling even quieter.I've re-used my beads several times: you just have to be sure to use them with the same grit each time. The ones I use for the second step grit do get smaller, so I have to add more and replace them more often. For the third and fourth (pre-polish and polish) steps, they show very little wear.Separating them from the rocks is a snap. I use a kitchen strainer to rinse rocks and beads; dump the whole thing into a container and fill it with water; and then pour the beads back into the strainer as they float on the surface (unlike the rocks). I rinse them some some more, air dry them in the strainer, and return them to the ziploc bag marked for that stage. Easy peasy!
April 7, 2014 A1CU3WBULAU1LB
open-ended
Is this good to polish stones for jewelry
April 8, 2014 A2MBLCGS3212UN
Yes. The beads protect the stones during the tumbling process and can be reused. Wash them thoroughly and use one set of beads for the coarse steps and another set for the polishing steps. That way you don't have to worry about any residue on the beads scratching your stones during the polishing process.
Jayne Lossing A2MBLCGS3212UN
5 Beads work well
10 2, 2013
Purchase two boxes of these so you can use one for the coarse ground and one for the polish cycles. Great that they are reusable. Good value.
April 8, 2014 A56UYCTG43CYZ
absolutely ,they cushion the stones ,i use them for all my grinds.
acesr1 A56UYCTG43CYZ
5 TUMBLING BEADS
06 14, 2013
THESE 2 PRODUCTS .MADE MY TUMBLING EXPERIENCE A GREAT JOY . I HAVE USED OTHER PRODUCTS AND THRU THEM AWAY BECAUSE OF POOR QUALITY .
April 8, 2014 A1NLGDHSOLGFDM
It's part of what you need to fill the tumbler. The different sizes of grit are used to take stones for jewelry from a rough polish to a final smooth polish. These help prevent the stones from chipping as you polish them.
Engineer "Full Time Mom" A1NLGDHSOLGFDM
4 Function not Fashion
05 15, 2010
These act as a filler for our Lortone rock tumbler. It helps prevent chipping of the rocks. We don't reuse the beads so think of this as a disposable part of your rock tumbler. Whenever its time to go to the next finer grit then we use new beads because you can't clean the grit out of the beads. It might be possible to reuse these but then you have to separate them and keep track of the fineness of the grit you used along with each step in order to not scratch your rocks. We fill the rock tumbler halfway with the beads, water and rocks.
April 8, 2014 A2RB232WPPCK5I
I have not used this product yet.
mcharming A2RB232WPPCK5I
4 Plastic beads for rock tumblers
04 30, 2011
These beads are to keep rocks In a tumbler from striking each other with full force while in a tumbler. They did what they were asked of them. Please note they are not in a plastic bag in the box, and opened without care, these beads may remind you of your mistake for years to come

5 Great tumbler I loved it
10 9, 2010
Just finished making my first run in it, had a great time. Produce some really nice looking rocks.No problems running it at all. The rubber barrel makes it repetitively quiet (run it in a closet and barely hear any noise (bit like rain).My seven year old lost interest pretty quickly (though enjoys sorting through stones and picking some finish ones for jewelery.)But I'm loving it.Went to ebay and bought grits for a 12# tumbler for just over $20 delivered (he through in a couple of pounds of rock as well free), so I have grits for another 6 runs...Plenty of rocks at good prices at Ebay as well (group your purchases to save on shipping as its a killer when buying a couple of pounds of rocks). My local beach has lots of quarts pebbles so no shortage of matterial for me.Great price great deal...would recommend it over the toy little plastic barreled ones (since it only costs about $10 more) .

3 False advertisment
01 12, 2014

I was very disappointed to see that it was a rotary tumbler since it takes twice as long to polish. As for the product it works well. The rubber barrel does rub on the plastic pieces of the tumbler's axle causing wear and tear.

4 Pretty good tumbler but..
01 20, 2014

B000BYE0A6

''This is an intergalactic emergency,'' declares your favorite Space Ranger who's come to the rescue... with this Talking Buzz Lightyear Action Figure. Our Buzz Lightyear toy has lots of exciting features that will give your young Toy Story fan a smile that stretches to infinity and beyond. Imported. Press button to hear five different Buzz phrases. Features voice sampler and sound effects. Press button for wing release. Press arm laser button for laser light and sound! Retractable helmet. Poseable joints. Buzz's Space Ranger suit features special glow in the dark effect! Plastic. 12'' H. Requires 2 AA batteries, included. Ages 3+. WARNING: CHOKING HAZARD - Small Parts. Not for children under 3 years.

Revell 1:48 F/A-18E Super Hornet
B000E8BHLE

The F/A-18 Hornet series of fighter aircraft has been a staple of US Navy and Marine aviation since ...the late 1970's. This versatile warplane can attack and destroy targets both on the ground and in the air equally well. The newer F/A-18E single seat version is a bit longer and can carry considerably more fuel than earlier models.

January 29, 2014 AF7I796YTS5KT
open-ended
Would this be good for an 11 year old first model? If not, any suggestions?
January 29, 2014 A1UA7F5GCC54NP
This might be a bit too complex for a first model. I would suggest one of the Snap-Tite kits that are also available on Amazon. The F/A-18E will be a good kit after the young modeler has assembled a few of the simpler kits first.
Michael C. Benolkin "Michael Benolkin" A1UA7F5GCC54NP
5 Revell 1/48 F/A-18E Super Hornet
11 27, 2012
I did a quick-build of this kit at cybermodeler.com and found the model goes together quite well. You can see the results for yourself without filler or paint on the model just how well this model is engineered. The kit represents an early-block Super Hornet so you may need some aftermarket updates if you're building a late-block airframe. Have fun with this kit as there are many great aftermarket decal options available 'out there'.
January 29, 2014 A13XFM2UU8EKKL
This one may be a little lengthy for that age as a first model. I would recommend something like a Revell Spitfire, or one of their other smaller, Vintage birds. Minimal pieces, and a little soft on the wallet in the event that they lose interest. If they show a liking towards modeling, perhaps purchase this as a second kit.
Nickolas Williamson "Nick W." A13XFM2UU8EKKL
4 Great affordable alternative.
05 22, 2013
I have built two of these kits since I got back into my modeling frenzy about a year ago, and they are really well built. For the price, you absolutely cannot find a more suitable substitute. The parts fit generally well, and it looks the part once completed. There are a few very minor details that keep this from being a five start kit in my book. Starting with the flaps being molded in the up position. This isn't necessarily a bad thing if you plan on building a static display of a plane in flight, but generally, most people like to build them with weight on wheels. There are aftermarket kits out there to allow you to surgically remove the default flaps and add lowered flaps, but it seems like a lot of work, and holds this kit back from being a real all star. The other feature that I'm not a big fan of is the way the intake ducts go together, and the depth of the engine turbine faces. When modeled, they are way too close towards the inlet itself, which is highly inaccurate. Again, to the novice who simply wants to try their hand at building a great airplane, then that's a very small oversight. Some putty is required along the top of the nose and in front of the windscreen to fill in some pretty obvious seams, but they're easy to tackle, and don't require too much sanding or filling. All in all, when it's done, it looks really great, and you don't have to shell out 70 bucks to make it happen. At such a low price, this is a great choice for me to grab if a customer wants a lock and stock Super Hornet, and aren't too picky on the realism.
January 29, 2014 A3DMFA20SLHYE4
I didn't see the instructions, but the pieces are not too tiny and if the 11 year old is adept or especially if there will be an adult to help with the gluing, then I think it would be fine. It isn't like some models with hundreds of tiny little parts.
anon "ymous" A3DMFA20SLHYE4
3 Grandson wanted a toy to play with...
01 24, 2014
I didn't realize this was a kit. Too bad it didn't specify clearly enough on the Amazon site. He and his Dad are making it.

0.7280

If he does well with that, by all means, this will be a next step. Be advised this kit will require glue and paint that are sold separately.

3 Ravell build a very basic model
05 29, 2013

October 28, 2014 A1GQUF1VK6K0B6
Yes, you need paint, glue, and a hobby knife.
RDB A1GQUF1VK6K0B6
5 Impressive Kit
12 26, 2013
I admit I always have doubts when I order from Revell; however, I was pleasantly surprised with this kit. It seems their new molds are pretty much on par, it's their 1970's molds they still use for some of their WW2 aircraft that perpetuates the perception that Revell makes junk kits. The instructions for this kit are clear and easy to understand. I did not expect this kit to have intakes with trunks which enables you to see the fan blades for the engine, nice touch. All the pieces fit well and went together with little sanding or 'creative manipulation'. The only drawbacks are very minor. Revell has a habit of modeling their copyright information on horizontal stabilizers - nothing some careful sanding can't knock out. The flaps cannot be re-positioned easily because there's a thick actuator that controls the surface on the underside of the wing. You would need to cut through that and reshape it. Not worth the effort in my opinion! Like I said, minor stuff. I recommend this kit!
August 5, 2014 A394CFIQH570SM
open-ended
How long is it when complete?
August 5, 2014 A3DMFA20SLHYE4
It was for my grandson, so I wasn't there to put it together. However, I visited and I saw the jet done. I believe it is 10-12 inches long...I didn't measure it, but it isn't tiny.
anon "ymous" A3DMFA20SLHYE4
3 Grandson wanted a toy to play with...
01 24, 2014
I didn't realize this was a kit. Too bad it didn't specify clearly enough on the Amazon site. He and his Dad are making it.
August 5, 2014 A3I5LQUDHCGQVY
Its approximately a ruler length, say about 30cm.
JEB A3I5LQUDHCGQVY
4 Fun to Build
08 15, 2011
The product was fun to build. My son loved playing with it. All the major components fit together nicely. There were some very small components that required tweezers for fitting, but its a model. Overall the product was great and the instructions were good. The only drawback is that it did not come with enough missiles to fully load the plane. Would recommend this model for others.

4 Great affordable alternative.
05 22, 2013
I have built two of these kits since I got back into my modeling frenzy about a year ago, and they are really well built. For the price, you absolutely cannot find a more suitable substitute. The parts fit generally well, and it looks the part once completed. There are a few very minor details that keep this from being a five start kit in my book. Starting with the flaps being molded in the up position. This isn't necessarily a bad thing if you plan on building a static display of a plane in flight, but generally, most people like to build them with weight on wheels. 5 Revell 1/48 F/A-18E Super Hornet
11 27, 2012
I did a quick-build of this kit at cybermodeler.com and found the model goes together quite well. You can see the results for yourself without filler or paint on the model just how well this model is engineered. The kit represents an early-block Super Hornet so you may need some aftermarket updates if you're building a late-block airframe. Have fun with this kit as there are many great aftermarket decal options available 'out there'.

I hand painted all of mine so I can tell you the adult men, women and glow in the dark men are one inch tall, The children and dogs are half an inch tall then the clowns are an inch and a quarter tall. Jakks VMIGO Console with Dog - Handheld
B000ETRFRI

Most dogs, even notoriously friendly ones like Golden Retrievers, don’t take too kindly to bein...g dressed up in silly outfits. And then there’s the shedding and smell factors of dog ownership, not to mention the risks to allergic family members. So what’s an animal lover to do? Get a virtual Golden Retriever, of course! This particular fellow from Vmigo is full of energy and will love playing catch, the Sniffing Game, Disc Duel, or going on adventures. He’ll do tricks for his master, and if you brush him and give him treats and take him out when he needs a potty break, he’ll reward you with hours of slavish love. This virtual pup appears on the tiny screen of the Vmigo handheld or, if docked with the TV docking system, on your TV screen. Earn Pet Points by being a good dog owner, and use them toward "buying" supplies necessary to keep your pooch healthy and happy, or even to buy a new dog! Two pop-up menus allow owners to interact with their Golden (feeding, playing, moving him around, etc.). If players have a friend with another Vmigo pet, both users can link together to share the fun. And the docking system allows players to turn the hound loose on the big screen in full color and with vastly enhanced activities in Doggy Town! Requires three "AAA" batteries (included) and four "C" batteries (not included).--Emilie Coulter

December 30, 2013 AIBJWTB1HXQVK
open-ended
What dogs does this handheld have?
January 1, 2014 A1IICUMRPXC4AL
I bought this for someone who liked the Nintendogs game for Nintendo DS. This is NOT a good replacement for that. The handheld device is cheap and small. It is hard to see the screen clearly. Hooking the hand held device to the console and then to your TV doesn't make things much better. The graphics are terrible and one cannot tell what is going on clearly. Plus the game is simple and gets boring very quickly. The console runs on C batteries - and no power adapter - so that is a con as well. I wouldn't recommend this handheld game and console.
K. Barker A1IICUMRPXC4AL
3 Virtual Dog
01 30, 2012
This product arrived quickly and was as described. The game is fun because you have a portable hand held game where you interact with a dog. You get to pick the type of dog, name it, and then interact with it. You can take the dog for walks, feed it, giv it water, let it sleep, play tricks and other things. It's nice because kids can learn some responsibilities - like remembering to care for the dog and take it for walks. The hand held unit then connects to the game console so you can hook it up to a TV - which allows for a much easier view. The console runs on C batteries. I believe the hand held unit which is the game itself runs on AAA batteries. The big downside is the screen is hard to see on the portable hand held unit - so hooking it up to the TV allows the game to be played much easier. Overall it is not a bad product at all - especially given the price.
Fisher-Price Little People Lil' Movers Airplane
B000EUKRY0

"Ready for take-off…here we go!" Diminutive pilots in training can let their imagination take f...light with this stocky, swooshy, wiggly-wobbly airplane. Measuring 12 inches nose to tail, and 8 inches from wingtip to wingtip, this sturdy plastic plane features a pilot, two passengers, a piece of luggage, a door that opens, six windows, including the pilot’s windshield, a handle over the cut-out top, working wheels (which make the pilot and passengers go up and down as if encountering turbulence), and the obligatory face on the front of the craft. Push down on the pilot in her seat (yes,herseat…we are in the 21st century, you know!) for flashing lights, a tune, flight attendant commentary, and swooshing airplane sounds. Judging from the outfits of the passengers and the palm tree design on the wings, this aircraft seems to be headed for a tropical port--airport, that is. What’s not to love? Check out the entire line of Lil’ Movers vehicles. Three AA batteries required (not included). (Ages 18 months to 3 years)--Emilie Coulter

B000F8TB0W

Set of 12 people representing a variety of occupations - from fire fighter to nurses. The individual...s represent different ethnic groups and genders, allowing children to role play various occupations with all different types of people in these roles. Figures up to 5" tall. Standard Focus: jobs in the community, community studies. Set of 12 Figures. Ideal for role play activities. Represents genders and enthnic groups. Molded in vinyl with realistically painted features. Classroom tested and ready for use at home or school.

4 Loved by son from 18 months to 30 months and going

April 5, 2014 A374DNLJZD8XYJ
N
0.0369
No, they are not bendable. The size is perfect for little hands, and they are always popular in my classroom. I have not had much luck with bendable figures. The common ones have wood for the head, hands, and feet. The bendable part is similar to a heavy duty pipe cleaner. Frankly, they're difficult for the children to manipulate. Hope this helps.
Teacher A374DNLJZD8XYJ

03 5, 2014
This toy is excellent for creative play. In my classroom I use them alone, or with blocks, and sometimes with playdoh. Always a favorite.

Carson Dellosa Kid-Drawn Emotions Bulletin Board Set (3250)
B000F8X7EI

This captivating, emotion-themed bulletin board set includes: 16 cut-apart emotion cards (7.5" x 16"... each) 16 emotion word cards A "Sometimes I feel..." header

October 27, 2013 A2VVXH882321BI
open-ended
Is this available as a poster or is it separate cards?
October 27, 2013 A23U2RC1J3W42O
It is a series of posters. There are 2-3 feeling cards per poster. I cut them into separate cards. It's easy for a group to see, and they can be hung on a wall or magnetic board.
Sally Pencap A23U2RC1J3W42O
5 Visual Emotions
02 25, 2009
I use this bulletin board set for an after-school art expressions program.Children readily identify with the pictures. It helps normalize drawing and discussion of emotions. Sometimes the kids copy an image, and later personalize it. I think it's helpful for them to see examples, rather than lead in with a discussion about emotions.
October 27, 2013 A1EYBB7RVV2CUQ
It is two posters but you could cut them into cards they are about 6x4..

Kelsyus Floating Lounger
B000F9O85E

The inflatable perimeter of the Kelsyus Floating Lounger suspends your body in the water, while the ...mesh seat allows your weight to descend into the water, just enough to keep you cool.A comfortable backrest and extended ottoman let you stretch out and relax for increased comfort while you float, and the convenient built in cup holder allows you to take your favorite beverage along for the ride.Jet Valve™ technology allows you to quickly inflate and deflate the lounger. Ultra portable, the unique spring coil design allows you to fold and store the lounger easily into the included carry bag for storage.Special clips on the side of the float allow tethering to dock, boat, or other Kelsyus float products.

Portapuzzle Standard Puzzleboard 1000
B000FCURJC

PortaPuzzle is the number one puzzle storage solution for up to 1000 Piece puzzles. It has a special...ly designed interior, extra surface area, secure fastening, and luxurious leather look external finish.Dimentions: 32.25 x 22.75 inches

August 5, 2014 ALT2AHHWYZORI
open-ended
Is this actually a rigid board or more of a floppy mat?
August 6, 2014 A12MLWHV2XR464
It is rigid.the main board is rigid,the two sides are semi. I work on my puzzles , when I am finished fold it up and slip it under my bed.
arlene anderson A12MLWHV2XR464
5 Five Stars
06 25, 2014
Jusy what I wanted
August 5, 2014 A2ILJGWBZU1Q00
It's actually several rigid boards. You are able to arrange pieces in the middle and on two side pieces and then pick up those side pieces to place them atop the middle area before folding the wings in. It's really very cool.
Summer A2ILJGWBZU1Q00
5 Best Puzzle Board
01 11, 2011
Bought this for my puzzle-lover for Christmas, and she loves it! It's the nicest one for a reasonable price. It has two half-size pull-out sheets for laying pieces on. You can sort your pieces on these and begin the puzzle on the middle flat piece. When you need your table, you just set the half-sheets on top of the middle piece and fold over the sides. There's felt everywhere, so your puzzle is very stable. I really can't imagine how this product could better fit the need. Certainly beats the cookie sheets she had been using.
August 6, 2014 A2AXHAGKS3TADC
A rigid board
Susan A2AXHAGKS3TADC

06 21, 2007

I can hold the gun with not strain or anything in just one hand, and if I put the butt of the gun against my shoulder, I have bend my elbow quite a bit. Yes, I know I could buy a real gun, but those are much more expensive, and I'm on a lmited budget.

Doll Stroller
B000FKCYAO

The Chicco Doll Stroller is a lightweight stroller that folds easily. Its features are just like a r...eal Chicco stroller. The fabric is removable and machine washable on a delicate cycle. Lightweight baby doll stroller that designed for fun and imagination. Recommended for ages above 3 years.

December 7, 2013 A1439OJVKZ06B5
open-ended

It was sold out ..& it was for my granddaughter, I panicked. Found this one and it was perfect. Adults & child loved it. Style, construction & size are perfect, & my granddaughter will probably outgrow dolls before this carriage! Hope this helps

open-ended
What is height of stroller and would the height be ok for a 2 year old?
August 24, 2014 A2MJSNNOSA0QE5
I bought this for my daughter's 2nd birthday and it was just fine. My daughter is a bit on the taller side, but I think for most two year olds this would work well. The height from the floor to the curve of the handle is about 26". So if her eye level is over 26-27" it will work great. Hope that helps!
MinnesotaMary A2MJSNNOSA0QE5
5 Love the rubber wheels and the quality
03 19, 2014
I bought this for my daughter's second birthday. She is somewhat in to dolls. She keeps getting dolls as gifts, but really only plays with one doll. My 4.5 yr old son pushes my daughter around in it more than anything. She's tall but is low on the weight percentile for her age -weighing about 23 pounds. The stroller has really held up well considering she keeps crawling in to it.The only thing I will call out, is the baby seat lays down - so if your kid is crawling around in it, watch out for the seat suddenly falling nearly flat. The only other thing I've noticed about it, is the mesh basket on the bottom will not lay straight and always seems to be rubbing on a wheel no matter what I do. Regardless of that, the stroller is great quality. The rubber wheels grip our hardwood and carpet really well and it does not have a plastic feel to it. She has also taken her baby for a walk outside and has no problem steering the stroller or handling it. The curved and padded handles are very easy to use. She loves pushing her baby around and having her brother push her around in it. This was a great buy for us and I anticipate as she gets older she will be using it even more.
August 25, 2014 A2VOS9U5TQXKAG
They can most likely see over the top of stroller. A 25th percentile in height child is able to see over and use it just fine.
Karen A. A2VOS9U5TQXKAG
5 very cute and sturdy
01 11, 2014
Bought a little too early on. Child was about 1 when she received this so she could barely see over the top. But loves it nonetheless. Very sturdy stroller, and adorable. Takes a beating better than the other strollers I've seen. Saw the McClaren one after it was abused and read ratings as well. This definitely fares better. This was really made for older kids though.
August 24, 2014 ANLKO4Z9UFHA3
