Yahtzee to Go Travel Game
B000FLX8N0

Play Yahtzee anywhere! Shake up some YAHTZEE fun wherever you go! It's America's all-time number one... dice game. Since 1956 players have been rolling classic dice combinations like Full House, Large Straight, and Five of a Kind - That's YAHTZEE! The unique combination of luck and strategy makes every game an exciting challenge. Can you rack up bonus points by scoring and extra Yahtzee? It's a classic shake-and-score action that keeps the fun rolling! When you are done, take it with you in the handy dice cup with cover. For ages 8 years old and up.

November 20, 2014 A1XMLQ5G8PAV9A
open-ended
Seems to me Yahtzee is naturally quite travel friendly. What makes this edition better for travel than packing up my full-size?
November 20, 2014 A1GUR8WVAVYQBX
Hi, hope this finds you well. The dice cup with "Yahtzee To Go" comes with a lid, so that you can store your dice, a few score sheets, and a small pencil in it without having to bring a whole game box with you. Hope this is helpful.
Dave A1GUR8WVAVYQBX
5 Let 'em roll!
03 5, 2013
I have been a "nut" for Yahtzee for better than 40 years. It is the perfect combination of luck and strategy. It is also simple enough that almost anyone can be taught the game in a very short time (I bought this one for my granddaughter). The term "travel game" is a little puzzling however. To test its accuracy, I set it on a table last night, and since then, it hasn't traveled an inch. Not so much as budged.
November 20, 2014 A2Q5BBNWUBPP51
It fits in my carry on bag! I also stuff some small bubble wrap around the dice so they don't rattle.
J.L. A2Q5BBNWUBPP51
4 Great for travel
01 18, 2013
This is perfect for travel or if you don't have a lot of space to store board games. It is hard to find this version of Yahtzee so buy it if you see it. Hasbro's website doesn't even show this version as current which I think is a shame. Well worth the money.
November 20, 2014 A3N89WVE11RV7
Everything fits in the cup (dice, pencils, score sheet) and the cup has a lid. We have to use a fuzzy sock to cover the cup when playing because the cup and dice are very loud. We just keep the sock around the cup when in storage or traveling.
Coolest Mom A3N89WVE11RV7
4 Fun!
12 31, 2013
Pretty good quality. I love how everything fits in the cup. Shaking the dice in the cup is very loud. We fixed that by putting a long, fuzzy sock inside the cup and then folding it around the outside.
November 20, 2014 A55GUZLX6R02M
Depends on how you travel. When the kids come along on vacation, I need to keep the games small to fit more of them in our luggage...or pack a bag of just games. If you are flying, that gets expensive. If you are driving and have plenty of luggage space, load up all the full size games!
C. B. Farley "DeadGuy" A55GUZLX6R02M
5 Nice travel version
12 25, 2012
This is a very nice travel version. The cup is full sized, with a cap, that holds everything. It comes with score cards that are folded so that they fit in the cup, as well as pencils about the size of the ones you'd get at a mini-golf course. We took this on vacation and played a lot at the beach.

November 20, 2014 A1SHFWWZQJEZVM
Nothing! In fact, I was disappointed in this edition since the company makes an actual travel version which we had at one time, but lost. In the actual travel version, the dice are captured in a hand held cylinder which allows them to tumble when rolled against the hand and then traps them one at a time by snapping the back of the compartment holding the die in place. It is very cool! I kept looking till I found the true travel version. I kept it to give as a gift, since it is a favorite game.

witttiger93 "witttiger93" AZ06K1NN3F09U
3 The dice could be better
09 6, 2010
I actually bought this from a store, so the review has everything to do with the product and not Amazon.It's a foregone conclusion the game of Yahtzee is excellent! This is no reflection on that either.This is more about manufacturing quality.Other editions of this game are better (highly recommend the folio travel edition if you can get it!), but if this fits your needs and your budget, hey, go with it...it's Yahtzee after all!My two biggest problems are the quality of the dice and the shaker which doubles as a container for all the game contents.The dice are very, very lightweight and many of the pips are poorly stamped.And I realize most standard Yahtzee sets come with just a plastic cup as a shaker, but the noise level made by these dice in this cup was so distracting, I actually fabricated my own felt liner for the cup to dampen the sound.I just think Hasbro could have done a little better on the quality is all.
September 23, 2013 AL0J7AZ84QV2O
Y
0.9941
yes, it does and there are several
Mirliegirlie AL0J7AZ84QV2O

01 16, 2013

September 23, 2013 A3B2W8A9FGZ5RQ
Y
0.9891
Yes it does

5 Son loves it, and we love Bruder!
01 4, 2014
Bought this truck for my two year old son who loves construction vehicles. It is great! We love Bruder as usual and have not found a brand that is as tough and durable and well made. It is definitely worth the price over a less expensive brand. It is a great size for little hands to hold, and it is able to fit on the back of the Bruder flatbead truck his grandparents got him for Christmas. Bruder trucks are amazing. The rubber tires hold up well, and the best part is they don't make noise! You can upgrade some of them by purchasing a lights and sounds module separately, but we never do that. It is great to have a toy that isn't blinking and making obnoxious noises all the time. Thanks, Bruder for a great product my son can't get enough of!

Titanium Lili ANKQGTXHREOI5
4 Snuggly friend for boys and girls
11 25, 2013
What an adorable doll! My seven year old son likes dolls, and he fell in love with this one as soon as he saw it. The doll is very light weight for the size (15"), and extremely cuddly. There are no hard parts on this doll, which has a cute, slightly protruding nose, defined buttocks, outie belly button, and defined fingers and toes. The doll does not have nipples nor genitalia, and there is only the slightest little tuft of hair on the top of the head. Though the pajama top and nappy come off and reattach with Velcro, the hat and ID bracelet are attached to the doll. My son and I both find the doll's smile to be welcoming and pleasant.I dislike that the product description is stereotypically sexist in saying that the doll is "(t)he perfect gift for a new big sister" as opposed to "a new big sibling" or some such. Boys often grow up to be fathers, and learning how to nurture at a young age benefits ALL children, regardless of gender.The only other problem in my opinion is the price, which seems a bit high for what one is getting. I think it would be more appropriately priced around $15-16, not the $21.54 as it is listed at the time of this review.Overall, however, it's a charming little doll with lots of snuggliness. If your kid takes this to bed and rolls over onto it, s/he won't be likely to wake up because of doing so, as he's rather pillow-like. Not a bad purchase if you don't mind the pricing.
December 7, 2014 A2C00RI5V7BHHQ
open-ended
Is this doll "anatomically correct" in front? Thanks in advance! (This would be a gift and I figure the"anatomy talk" is totally up to her parents! )
December 7, 2014 ARJ3Y8ZRV3WWQ
Nope no parts.

June 1, 2014 A1U049D88RPUN1
I looked at them and there is no brand identification. While the depth of the trays is great, the fact is they do not turn very well. There is too much weight when you have 6 decks of cards. They would are better as just trays without the turntable. We took the bottom half of the turntable off but that leaves a plastic spike that make the tray tippy. So, we placed it on a dry wash cloth so it could be moved around the table without the screeching sound.
gary tenpas A1U049D88RPUN1
4 Like the capacity
05 19, 2014
We just started playing hand and foot in our new community. Since the game is played with 5 full decks, most trays are not deep enough. This tray keeps the cards from spilling out on the table.

Melissa AOEJ3AIEEH6YW
4 Nice, but needed a little altering before it was given to our 2 year old...
02 7, 2012
When the plates arrived my 2 year old son was anxious to build a Lego City! They are thin and easily breakable for toddlers, so I picked up and sanded the edges of a sheet of plywood...then I spray glued the plates side by side to the plywood. After a few hours, it was dry but not permanent. This way they can be removed later and stuck onto a table as he gets older. His Lego City platform now sits on our coffee table at his level and is easily relocated to his room or anywhere else when necessary.
August 24, 2014 A2178U6QCXPZXZ

1 Looks Great, Performs Like Titanic!
07 9, 2014
It ran fine until it turned over when it hit the edge of the pool and took on water inside the hull. The circuit board inside the hull got wet even though it was sealed (very sloppily sealed, but sealed - I checked it). It's actually too large (28") for a pool unless you have a large pool and taking it to a lake may mean chasing it with your own boat when it dies! When it dies, it dies - wherever it is. Must recharge 4 hours for 10 to 15 minutes of use. It is fast I have to say! The rechargeable battery has to come out of the hull, be recharged and then returned to the hull.and plugged back in. That's fine, but all the wires are in the way of removing and installing. Before my grandson used it, I had to re-route all the lines away from the battery compartment. I knew my grandson would break wires unplugging and plugging it in and it wouldn't be his fault. It looked like a proto-type design before you cleaned up the mistakes. Silly really. Why build problems into a product? I packed the whole thing up and returned it from where is came for a refund.
GoFit 75cm Professional Stability Ball
B000K7I62M

This commercial-grade professional exercise ball was designed with advanced technology so you can wo...rk out with confidence. The superior GoFit Professional Stability Ball features super-thick walls constructed to perform with maximum durability and designed for commercial fitness use. Follow the professionally-developed exercises in the included Core Performance instructional DVD with trainer Brook Benton to significantly improve your core stability, balance, and strength.GoFit's Exercise Balls are scientifically weight-tested by a professional, independent lab to ascertain weight limits at full air capacity. Through this process we determine durability levels to help you choose the best Exercise Ball for your specific level of use. The GoFit Pro Ball is weight-rated up to 2000 pounds of static weight capacity. This Exercise Ball is ideal for commercial use as well as a home fitness program. Mark will guide you through his scientifically proven exercises that will increase your balance, strength, and functionality, to help you feel better, reduce pain, and have more energy so you can live your most active lifestyle.What's in the Box?75 centimeter inflatable Professional Stability BallCore Performance Instructional DVD by Brook BentonExercise BookletRecommended for people who are 6 feet tall and taller

5 Use this for a chair at my computer table
08 29, 2013

As I write this I am sitting on my yoga ball. I did my viewing on youtube how to properly sit on a yoga ball. I do a lot of computer work and had back issues. Now I don't, but it took awhile because I could acclimate myself to the yoga ball. It took around a month to feel comfortable.I told my Doctor about it and when I saw her next she was sitting on a yoga ball. LOLThe reason why I purchased this ball was because of the thickness. I initially purchased a smaller size and gave it to a friend who is much shorter. I am 5'11", and I can also exercise with it.Best and cheapest chair I have ever found. Yet sometimes I do sit in a chair for a short time.They say don't bounce. I love to bounce, especially when I am working and listening to good music. 5 Fun
01 29, 2013
This was delivered on time and was greatly appreciated by the receiver. If you have never tried a Buddha Board, get one. It's a great thing to have at walk-through area of the house. Put a small jar of water near it and be creative on the fly.
August 11, 2013 AHYLUXD3UZT77
open-ended
Why does it say gift card?
August 22, 2013 AEHQPCV0ENBZI
This Mini Buddha Board is labeled as gift card because the board comes with 12 occasion stickers (such as happy birthday, ect.) that you could stick on the front of the board in order to give it as a gift. There is also a section inside the case, opposite of the buddha board itself, that has space to write out a permanent note. So, in short, the board can be given away as a personalized gift if you open the product and set it up before giving it away.
Eseema AEHQPCV0ENBZI
5 Great Addition To My Desk
08 22, 2013
I bought this mini Buddha Board for myself after debating between the original Buddha Board or this smaller one for a fraction of the price. I wanted to use the board to doodle and relax. The smaller sized board fits perfectly on my desk or bookshelf. I like that I can easy pack it into my bag and take it with me, if ever needed. It came in great condition and has served its purpose perfectly. I am now ordering a couple more as presents, both for kids and adults.
August 11, 2013 A20TZE9ELR6AKR
Good question. Don't know. Maybe coz its kind of slim like a card.

Stockmar Beeswax Stick Crayons, Set of 16
B000M02M2M

Stockmar wax crayons meet the highest artistic standards. Through the addition of pure beeswax as a ...binding agent, the light-resistant pigments display their purity and full brilliance. Because they are mixed with wax, the colors are able to be used in a wide range of interesting coloring techniques - more than any other coloring material. The natural transparency of the wax and the lack of additives result in a high degree of opacity like that of watercolors

January 10, 2014 A3QB9R763RDZ76
open-ended
I just received the crayons and it came with a flat plastic part (like in the picture) - any idea what this is/how you are suppose to use this?
January 10, 2014 A3UR3O67WHH7CJ
This is to smooth or add dimension to colored areas. You scrape accross the area usually where it has been colored dark w/the smooth side and it blends it nicely. The rigid side is to add dimension. Hope this helps.
Kim Murphy A3UR3O67WHH7CJ
3 good crayons arrived w/ three broken
08 21, 2013
I as pleased w/the quality of the crayons. However, they arrived w/ three broken off tips and the case is damaged.
January 10, 2014 A2F0RS3D4Y7N7T
You may use it for your drawings themselves, so remove, loghten color etc or It can also for sharpening, shaping the crayon after use, also to help peel the paper down as necessary.
Joslin Joel A2F0RS3D4Y7N7T

Revell of Germany Viking Ship Plastic Model Kit
B000N2F5G4

From the end of the eighth century AD, Vikings originating from Scandinavia regularly appeared in Gr...eat Britain and on the European mainland on raiding expeditions in their Longships. These highly sea worthy fighting ships of around 20 meters (66') in length had a bow at both ends, enabling them to beach and/or launch in either direction. The shallow draught of only 1.5 meters (5') also gave the Vikings the option of sailing or rowing up inland waterways and rivers, allowing them to raid areas deep in the hinterland. With these fast (a speed of 20 knots) and very maneuverable fighting ships also known as "Dragon Boats", the Vikings ventured as far away as Iceland, Greenland and even North America, as excavations at settlements have proven.

December 15, 2013 AN7QM0QEJDJ93
open-ended
I have ordered this for a Christmas gift. What colors and kind of paint and glue do I need to buy to go with it?
December 15, 2013 A3A5XYCNZZNR4
Get a spray can of brown ... Flat brown for wooden planks. Really that is most of it. Everything should be painted by brush and are small details so feel free to mix or not use exact colors. The main color is brown the shield will add color along with sail.
Andre A. Rivera A3A5XYCNZZNR4
5 Awesome Viking Ship
02 23, 2013
Awesome ship and best of all it is 28mm scale for D&D miniature game play. Easy bulid, but tedious. Best to use model spray paint.
April 8, 2014 A3B6OM3XQG5ZWN
Acrylic artist paint works well for painting wood. I base coated with Tamiya deck tan then after dry used a brush to paint the wood various shades to look more realistic. Here is the link to my build. http://www.modelshipgallery.com/gallery/misc/sail/Viking-50-am/index.htm
Arthur W. Macon A3B6OM3XQG5ZWN
5 Revell Viking ship 1/50 scale
03 22, 2013
This was an absolute pleasure to build. Part count was low with the exception of the shields and oars. No real flash issues on the parts and the fit is spot on. The shields decals take the most time. I trimmed my decals to fit without the extra overhang on the edge. I also found cutting the center helped them lay down better. I skipped the sail decal for mine as others have said on here. Best Viking ship for the money!
December 21, 2013 A18K45F52LP9OM
I still have the sheet for it leather brown matt, black matt, gold metallic, carmin red matt,anthracite gray matt, gunship grey matt,brown matt,steel matallic, and ocra brown matt. I picked up a tester set for World War two soldiers and trucks. It had all the paint save gold. I used a tester glue. I hope this helps
Munin A18K45F52LP9OM
4 Looks Great
06 28, 2013
This ship has some really nice detailing. The wood grain looks great. I had this as a child and was really happy to find it again. My only problem is the big viking head decal for the sail. IN the past it was a black raven. That looked a lot less junior high mascot.
April 8, 2014 A4E457FH49J3B
open-ended
How can you apply the water slide decals to the shields and make them stick? The decals has no hole in the center while the center of the shields has
April 8, 2014 A3B6OM3XQG5ZWN
I sliced the center with a razor knife, like cutting a pie, into four sections. Then used Micro_Sol to set the decal on the shield. By cutting the center it will allow it to lay down. To finish I painted the center iron color to match historical shields.
Arthur W. Macon A3B6OM3XQG5ZWN
5 Revell Viking ship 1/50 scale
03 22, 2013

I trimmed my decals to fit without the extra overhang on the edge. I also found cutting the center helped them lay down better. I skipped the sail decal for mine as others have said on here. April 8, 2014 A3A5XYCNZZNR4
Arthur Macon is correct. However, paint the center gunmetal or whatever color you choose prior to emplacing decal. I just took photos to post but not sure I can here. Its tedious which is why I have a ship with no shields sitting on my Iraq artifacts. I did not use Micro_Sol, but I will certainly purchase it to test its capabilities. I just used very tiny bareli visible droplets of crazy glue. But I had to cut each shield a hole with a razor. I have a few that look great but no I did not complete it and its been sitting there almost a year I think. lol. Good luck homes.

3 perhaps, 'auf English', not Deutsch?
02 18, 2014
Ship was fine....Minimum of parts but OK.....But instructions were almost all in German! (Naturally, made in Germany for Revell).....My two yrs. High School German could not keep up with the language....Everything was well stamped and labeled, but many of the parts seem impossible to keep on.....(For example, the shields on the side of boat, constantly need to be reglued)Good decals, however.........Overall, a fun ship to assemble.
November 26, 2014 A1N8GDNFPJF3OP
Yes
Mr. Happy A1N8GDNFPJF3OP
5 Great model
06 29, 2014
Another Excellent kit from Revell!!
March 11, 2014 AVGLF6AGBO0QL
open-ended
How do I apply the decals? I tried on some shields but the ones I used don't stick.
April 8, 2014 A3B6OM3XQG5ZWN
I trimmed the edges off and sliced the center before placing them in water. Place the decal on the shield then use little Micro_Sol to soften the decal and it will lay down flat. After they were set (overnight) I painted them with clear to seal them. This was the most tedious part of the build but worth the effort in the end.
Arthur W. Macon A3B6OM3XQG5ZWN
5 Revell Viking ship 1/50 scale
03 22, 2013
This was an absolute pleasure to build. Part count was low with the exception of the shields and oars. No real flash issues on the parts and the fit is spot on. The shields decals take the most time. I trimmed my decals to fit without the extra overhang on the edge. I also found cutting the center helped them lay down better. I skipped the sail decal for mine as others have said on here. Best Viking ship for the money!
March 9, 2014 AVGLF6AGBO0QL
open-ended
What paints do I need. I have the Testors basic kit. Anything else?
March 10, 2014 A1J1AAKB5DBAXL
I used Testor's enamel paints: they worked just fine.
Jennifer Ferrell A1J1AAKB5DBAXL
4 Great for 28mm tabletop wargaming
03 7, 2014
Bought for 28mm tabletop wargaming rather than a hobby or display piece. My chief concern was scale: was she going to be big enough to use with 28mm miniatures? She is, fitting approximately twenty "standard human" sized miniatures shoulder to shoulder. More if the miniatures are dwarfs or goblins, less if you have some big orks or a troll on board.Since the hull is fully rounded I formed a clay base in the shape and color of waves so as to fit with my tabletop coastal terrain rather than the kit supplied stands.The instructions are clear (no text but good illustrations) and the kit itself is not complex. Good molding, good quality plastic. My only contention is the decals for the shields: the center holes are not cut out, so they do not fit perfectly flat over the "bump" in the center of each plastic shield. There are time-consuming ways around this, but I opted to give the shields a simple paint and ink instead.
April 8, 2014 A3A5XYCNZZNR4
Go to a local model shop and buy a small $5 can of flat brown spray. Its the easiest to apply and looks great. Everythign will look even versus looking clunky like someone painted it. 95% is flat broan, everythign else is small detail. This was very easy to get going. Its the shields and oars that get tedious...
Andre A. Rivera A3A5XYCNZZNR4
5 Awesome Viking Ship
02 23, 2013
Awesome ship and best of all it is 28mm scale for D&D miniature game play. Easy bulid, but tedious. Best to use model spray paint.

5 Revell Continues Its Tradition of Qualtiy
02 7, 2013
Those who have been making models for a long time probably remember Revell as a familiar name from their childhood. There was hardly a subject that the model company did not take a crack at. No matter the skill level, Revell's attention to details and nice prices allowed any modeler to pick up a kit they could be proud of and the Viking Ship is no exception. Whether young or old, new or an old pro, this kit is a fun build.

Jennifer Ferrell A1J1AAKB5DBAXL
4 Great for 28mm tabletop wargaming
03 7, 2014
Bought for 28mm tabletop wargaming rather than a hobby or display piece. My chief concern was scale: was she going to be big enough to use with 28mm miniatures? She is, fitting approximately twenty "standard human" sized miniatures shoulder to shoulder. More if the miniatures are dwarfs or goblins, less if you have some big orks or a troll on board.Since the hull is fully rounded I formed a clay base in the shape and color of waves so as to fit with my tabletop coastal terrain rather than the kit supplied stands.The instructions are clear (no text but good illustrations) and the kit itself is not complex. Good molding, good quality plastic. My only contention is the decals for the shields: the center holes are not cut out, so they do not fit perfectly flat over the "bump" in the center of each plastic shield. There are time-consuming ways around this, but I opted to give the shields a simple paint and ink instead.
Murder Mystery Party Game - Honky Tonk Homicide
B000NCZ3MU

Murder Mystery Party Game - Honky Tonk Homicide by University Games is a party in a box. In this ca...se, just remember, don't mess with Texas - somebody just rubbed out a redneck. The body of Bubba Angus was found in his bar in Cactus, TX. It's up to the

September 24, 2014 A1CLVJI9PR6SRQ
open-ended
Is this scripted or do we have information to reveal/ conceal in each act?
September 25, 2014 AT6WABTWDYFZI
This is not scripted. You will receive information that you should reveal as questions are asked of your character. The murderer is told at the beginning that he/she is the ONE!
Cecylia K. Dunning AT6WABTWDYFZI
4 Lots of fun when everyone gets involved!
04 15, 2013
We hosted the Honky Tonk Homicide for a group of 8 in their 60's and 70's. Everyone really got into their characters with costumes, props, etc. The "bar" set-up was fun. The suggestion for bottles to be set around worked just great, and we used our deck as the site of dinner with newspapers as place mats and dead plants as centerpieces. (Really tacky!)We had great fun trying to investigate the murder, but no one picked him/her out, so I guess the murderer was good at keeping us guessing.My only complaint was the script given to each character in our booklets was a little confusing, and since this was our first try at this, no one knew when to start and when to follow someone else. Would have preferred more direction - like #1 speaker, for example. That would have assisted our novice group.Overall well worth the price and a fun evening. They also include a computer CD with another game, which we'll be trying.
September 25, 2014 A14OGEZUTEJ8UB
I thought it was very easy to follow from beginning to end. Very fun game. Lots of laughs. You will enjoy this.
2Goose A14OGEZUTEJ8UB
5 Awesome Party theme!
03 21, 2011
We just played this game over the weekend. I turned it into a large group game with the 8 main characters and some interaction from the "audience". The characters were perfect for their roles. It was so much fun. We created props from cardboard and I made finger foods for snacks. In between Chapters/Scenes, I allowed the guests to visit the "crime scene" for clues. The only thing I was worried about was the characters reading from their scripts in order so I numbered the paragraphs throughout the scripts to help them along. It was truly a fun time. I would recommend this game!
September 25, 2014 A516VHBUFWS3J
Yes, It is scripted .... each player has a booklet for them to follow.....VeryUser friendly type mystery game. Make sure player dress up per their type character.....Enjoy.
Gary B. Evans "Gary B. Evans" A516VHBUFWS3J

Cecylia K. Dunning AT6WABTWDYFZI
4 Lots of fun when everyone gets involved!
04 15, 2013
We hosted the Honky Tonk Homicide for a group of 8 in their 60's and 70's. Everyone really got into their characters with costumes, props, etc. The "bar" set-up was fun. The suggestion for bottles to be set around worked just great, and we used our deck as the site of dinner with newspapers as place mats and dead plants as centerpieces. (Really tacky!)We had great fun trying to investigate the murder, but no one picked him/her out, so I guess the murderer was good at keeping us guessing.My only complaint was the script given to each character in our booklets was a little confusing, and since this was our first try at this, no one knew when to start and when to follow someone else. Would have preferred more direction - like #1 speaker, for example. That would have assisted our novice group.Overall well worth the price and a fun evening. They also include a computer CD with another game, which we'll be trying.
September 6, 2014 A14OGEZUTEJ8UB
Yes. We had 20 or 25 in our group. I created several extra characters to interact with the main characters. It was a blast!
2Goose A14OGEZUTEJ8UB
5 Awesome Party theme!
03 21, 2011
We just played this game over the weekend. I turned it into a large group game with the 8 main characters and some interaction from the "audience". The characters were perfect for their roles. It was so much fun. We created props from cardboard and I made finger foods for snacks. In between Chapters/Scenes, I allowed the guests to visit the "crime scene" for clues. The only thing I was worried about was the characters reading from their scripts in order so I numbered the paragraphs throughout the scripts to help them along. It was truly a fun time. I would recommend this game!

3 Great BUT
07 21, 2013
The line is too short! It is a cute toy and captured my girls attention for a while but after she saw my mom stick the fish and bait together with her hands instead of "fishing" for it, my daughter grabs the fish and does the same. Completely taking out the fun of the toy. Three stars not because im shifting blame and my dismay from my mom to the toy, but because there is no way to make the line longer. There is a knot that keeps it from winding the kine completely so there is very little reeling to do. You can maybe turn the rod three times and that's it.

1 Choking hassard
12 22, 2013
I bought two of these as gifts and wish I hadn't given them away now. I realized after opening this for my own 19 month old daughter, and the package says it is for 18+ - that there are a number of serious choking hazards present within this product, so it goes without saying that you should never leave your child unattended in the bath, but especially when using this toy!The small worm on the hook is a chokable if it comes unhooked from the line.The line itself is long enough that my 19 month old was able to wrap it around her neck all the way!Major choking and safety hazard for children and Amazon should consider removing immediately.

5 Short String, but Good Toy
12 17, 2013
We've had this toy for a year now, I think. The fishing line was shorter than I'd have liked, but I imagine that's for safety reasons. Safety's best, even at the expense of a more realistic play fishing experience. That said, I like this toy. It has bright colors. It's cute. The water drains out fairly completely after use (if you tip them the right way). We've used them in a sensory bin full of dried beans, in the inflatable pool, and in the bath. My 2 and half year old daughter is just getting the hang of the rod and reel, but she's liked the toy since we got it. I think it's cute that they seem to kiss when they get close to each other.

3 It's the best you can do now.
11 14, 2013
In the good old days, you could buy buckets of Legos, and a child could use his/her imagination to build whatever. Apparently now, kids have to be shown how to make a specific item. Okay, I know the real reason is that those expensive little boxes make them more money. This box is as close as you can come to the good old days. Lots of the pieces a very small, there are too few wheels, and the box is ridiculously large for what comes in it. But my grandson likes it, and it supplements his expensive little boxed sets. (And when he comes to my house, he uses his dad's old bucket of Legos.) Sigh.....

?
0.8030
I am not sure if it is "steel" framed or not, but they are solid...not like a fluffy stuffed animal. The elephant was for a gift, but I have purhased the giraffe and zebra for my daughter (she got the zebra for Christmas...will be 11 in March!) , and they are REALLY well built, and very high quality. A "young" child, maybe less than 60 lbs. (I'm guessing that #) could easily "ride" the elephant. These Melissa & Doug animals are really wonderftul...and I am anti- stuffed animals these days! The giraffe is my favorite...5' tall! Bottom line I think is that any kid would love any one of thse M & D animals. They are free standing, and worth every penny, in my frugal opinion. 5 Excellent Play Therapy Tool
11 1, 2013
This castle had what our Children's Treatment Team was looking for: draw bridge, dungeon with trap door, no gender specific decorations, and durability. We like that it opens to allow better access when there are more players than one. Most of our figures fit but there are large spots (tops of towers, draw bridge, walkways) for the larger figures to be a part of the play. We purchased one to see if we liked it, and will be purchasing more to place in our other play rooms.
November 18, 2013 A3LJH042EIBS5N
open-ended
How high are the doorways?
November 18, 2013 A3BSD1WT1DVXNR
The doorways on this vary a LOT. What's most misleading is that it's not just the height you have to worry about, but the width as well. Depending on what kind of figurines you're using to play with, it's tricky to get them through the doors.Here are a few of the openings:Main entrance (largest): With the drawbridge, it has a clearance of about 4 1/2" tall in the center arch, and is 3 3/4" wide.'Throne Room' is 3 1/2" tall x 3 1/4" wide. (<
W. Edwards A3BSD1WT1DVXNR
5 Fantastic 1st 'Doll House'
01 18, 2013
My elder daughter (3 1/2), kept begging for a Barbie dollhouse for Christmas. I figured a doll house was in order - but I didn't want something overly pink, plastic-y, and related to a specific 'brand'. I wanted something she could use to play with whatever dolls she had on hand.I first spotted the pink, princess version of this on Amazon. I got the 'boy' version for 3 reasons. 1) It's more like historical castles (Neuschwanstein aside), which makes it more educational. 2) She'd never seen the pink version, so she wouldn't care, and 3) it has a jail. She LOVES stuffing her toys into various 'jails' (I don't try to analyze why).She has LOVED this toy. She and baby sis (age 1 1/2) play with it every day for hours. It has become home to many Disney princess figurines, Happy Meal toys, random small puppets. You name it - if it even remotely fits in the castle, it takes up residence.One CON is that some of the openings are SMALL. Toob knights (up to 2") fit well anywhere. The Disney princesses (which range in size from 2" to 4", depending upon what set you get - Buyer Beware, they're really not standard across their figurine sets) are larger and can get stuck. Belle, for example, with her huge skirt, can't go very far, while the slimmer Mulan hides out just about anywhere.This also means that the kids can get their toys stuck easily, then wanted mom to come free the toys. Be prepared for cries of 'the jail is full! get the toys out, please!'Overall, however, this is one of the BEST toys we've ever gotten. We also bought a set of M&D; wooden blocks, which have quickly become stables, out-buildings, bridges across the towers, stairs, you name it. If I only could buy 1 toy for the kids, it would be a toss-up between this and the M&D; wooden blocks. The best thing about this toy is that it's fun for mom and dad to play with, too. I spend a lot of 'floor time' with the girls when this castle is out.Of course, now, I'm totally eyeing that M&D; pirate ship so the princesses can go on more adventures. ;)
November 18, 2013 A308WS2HFPGGNC
The main door (that is arched/draw bridge style)- is 5 inches to the top of the arch. some of the others are slightly lower (3.5-4 inches)
Amy A308WS2HFPGGNC
4 very nice, larger than expected
12 25, 2012
very nice castle! i am always leery of purchasing things online, but i know that "melissa and doug" usually have nice, sturdy wood products. I bought this for my son, and he loves it!! it was delivered on time, and was much larger than i expected. we like the working draw bridge, the "jail" cell with moveable gate/door, and trap door that drops into the jail cell. you can't see that in any of the pictures, but it's there and a really nice surpise. my only reason for not rating it 5 stars, is that the trap door is slightly un-aligned, and doesn't close properly without some jiggling. it's not a major issue though, and i see no reason to return it. overall, i highly recommend!
November 18, 2013 A1O4A9P2JU28WD
Main gate is 5". Others are about 4". My now 5 & 7 year old still love it after a year now!

2 Doesn't get played with
07 30, 2013
My three-year-old son fell in love with his cousin's dollhouse, so we thought this would be a good boy version. We planned on buying some furniture to go with it, but none of the chambers are large enough to hold anything like that. You can put the little knights/dolls in there, but there isn't room for anything else. I felt like it looked much bigger in the picture.It's very nice and well put together, but it doesn't get played with. He does want to sleep with it in his bed, but that the extent of the attention this toy gets. Other kids would probably love it, but I wished I would have tried harder to convince my husband to let me get him a real dollhouse instead.

it just the castle. People sets are avaiable separately

N
0.0224
No, though that depends on what you mean by 'easily.' After a solid year of use, abuse, and being transported in the car to the occasional playdate, some of the wood on the tops of the towers has chipped ever so slightly. Also, when moving it around, you want to be sure to lift it from the bottom platform, not grab it by the towers. (I tried grabbing it by one of the towers once and felt the glue "give" ever so slightly. Immediately grabbed it from the bottom instead.) In short, you wouldn't want to drop it down the stairs, but for average play of kids shoving figurines into it and opening and shutting the moving parts, it's held up remarkably well. 5 Fantastic 1st 'Doll House'
01 18, 2013
My elder daughter (3 1/2), kept begging for a Barbie dollhouse for Christmas. I figured a doll house was in order - but I didn't want something overly pink, plastic-y, and related to a specific 'brand'. I wanted something she could use to play with whatever dolls she had on hand.I first spotted the pink, princess version of this on Amazon. I got the 'boy' version for 3 reasons. 1) It's more like historical castles (Neuschwanstein aside), which makes it more educational. 2) She'd never seen the pink version, so she wouldn't care, and 3) it has a jail. She LOVES stuffing her toys into various 'jails' (I don't try to analyze why).She has LOVED this toy. She and baby sis (age 1 1/2) play with it every day for hours. It has become home to many Disney princess figurines, Happy Meal toys, random small puppets. You name it - if it even remotely fits in the castle, it takes up residence.One CON is that some of the openings are SMALL. Toob knights (up to 2") fit well anywhere. The Disney princesses (which range in size from 2" to 4", depending upon what set you get - Buyer Beware, they're really not standard across their figurine sets) are larger and can get stuck. Belle, for example, with her huge skirt, can't go very far, while the slimmer Mulan hides out just about anywhere.This also means that the kids can get their toys stuck easily, then wanted mom to come free the toys. Be prepared for cries of 'the jail is full! get the toys out, please!'Overall, however, this is one of the BEST toys we've ever gotten. We also bought a set of M&D; wooden blocks, which have quickly become stables, out-buildings, bridges across the towers, stairs, you name it. If I only could buy 1 toy for the kids, it would be a toss-up between this and the M&D; wooden blocks. The best thing about this toy is that it's fun for mom and dad to play with, too. I spend a lot of 'floor time' with the girls when this castle is out.Of course, now, I'm totally eyeing that M&D; pirate ship so the princesses can go on more adventures. ;)
November 27, 2013 AFC9ND74I9P5O
?
0.7158
Nope. The kids have stood on it, fell on it, and it's still standing.
Melissa F AFC9ND74I9P5O
2 Doesn't get played with
07 30, 2013
My three-year-old son fell in love with his cousin's dollhouse, so we thought this would be a good boy version. We planned on buying some furniture to go with it, but none of the chambers are large enough to hold anything like that. You can put the little knights/dolls in there, but there isn't room for anything else. I felt like it looked much bigger in the picture.It's very nice and well put together, but it doesn't get played with. He does want to sleep with it in his bed, but that the extent of the attention this toy gets. Other kids would probably love it, but I wished I would have tried harder to convince my husband to let me get him a real dollhouse instead.

3 Not what is pictured.
05 7, 2012
I bought two of these packs because the pictured pack shows a base set pack with the "1st edition" mark. The second picture listed shows packs without this "1st edition" mark. I only bought two to test and if they were "1st edition" cards I would have bought everything in stock.THESE are not first edition cards. They are base set unlimited.The packs did come in mint condition and factory sealed, so no complaints there. No where in the description did it say they were first edition but the picture was very misleading.
January 13, 2013 A2OOVK3BY9G6P5

Learned_Hand A2OOVK3BY9G6P5
3 Think On It
01 1, 2012
My brothers and I recently purchased four packs. We figured, given the high probability of us getting at least one holo/rare card [worth > $5], and the $0.25-$1.50 we could get for the less rare cards, that with 11 cards per pack [of which at least 2 or 3 will be worthless energy/common training cards] we had fair odds of getting around 32-36 cards worth an average of ~$0.75 [$24-$27], and 1-2 cards worth $5-$35 each.So, based on those expectations, we calculated that for the $52.33 we spent on four packs, the absolute worst we could do is have $29 worth of cards. A $24 gamble was acceptable to us, so we purchased the cards. In the end, once all opened and researched, the cumulative value of the cards we received was around $25--we got one holo card [Ninetails].Further, my brothers and I were watching Pokemon right before we ordered the cards. Therefore, upon reflection, this purchase was probably the result of acute-impulsive-Christmas-time-Pokemon-nostalgia, for which we provided ourselves the excuse of potentially turning a profit so that we could convince ourselves that spending $50 on four packs of Pokemon cards was the right thing to do.In conclusion, if you are looking to add to your collection, these cards are delivered in mint condition and truly bring back that childhood excitement of opening the pack [except it wasn't mom's money this time]. But, if you are like my brothers and I, and you need to give yourself some false reassurance that this is going to be some kind of investment, then you may have acute-impulsive-Christmas-time-Pokemon-nostalgia and you probably ought to "think on it" a bit longer.
January 14, 2013 AHCX4DOOQYAN0
Yes they are. I bought them for my girlfriend and she was very happy with them. No damage to any of them and the package was perfectly sealed.
JCALAR AHCX4DOOQYAN0

06 28, 2012
THis is a great buy if you want to remember the good old days! Still in the packaging it's a great collectors toy to hand down to your children or even get as a simple gift for that loved one.

Bruder Mack Granite Cement Mixer
B000NYT1SU

The "incredibly" realistic driver's cabin with its doors that can be opened, the tilting engine bonn...et, providing a view of the engine block, the foldable rear-view mirrors, and the Many add-on accessories, which give the its chrome look, make this truck a true feast for the eyes of every truck fan. The cement mixer barrel (barrel with mixing spiral) can be turned by a fold-out crank handle. Depending on its direction of rotation, the goods will be loaded into or transported out of the barrel. The chutes attached to the sides of the assembly can be slipped over the rear concrete chute.

Liquid Ass
B000OCEWGW

Liquid ASS is an overwhelming, stinky, funny prank product. Once unleashed, this power-packed, super...-concentrated liquid begins to evaporate filling the air with a genuine, foul butt-crack smell with hints of dead animal and fresh poo. The funny pranks you can pull with Liquid ASS are unlimited. Watching the facial grimaces of people and hearing their comments about the part-your-hair, gagging stench will have you laughing until it hurts. Keep out of reach of children.

May 20, 2014 A1DUW37DKUIKD5
open-ended
What is it made out of ?
May 29, 2014 A32LFBRJOIATYX

Miami A32LFBRJOIATYX
5 AMAZING!!!
03 1, 2014
I order liquid ass the last week and it arrived on Friday. I was surprised that the bottle was literally filled up to maximum capacity. I decided to try it out in the hall way of my college dorm. One spray at the end of the hall and one at the beginning left the whole hallway smelling like a 400 lbs mans ass after he just worked out and wrestled four pigs while a cow took a dump on his chest and while a dog throw up and ate it twice. May 19, 2014 A1ATJD280BQ87U
Y
0.9931
I imagine if you sprayed it directly onto something, the smell would be pretty concentrated on that item. (Say a reef on a doorway - as soon as someone opened the door they would smell it.) But I also imagine the smell would dissipitate quicker as well. In short: yes it will still stink like a fart; but just like a fart, the bad smell will go away quicker in an open area. Hope this was helpful.
